Address: 333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
NandA: Dorsett Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
Title: Quick Staycation Room 912
Review: Location: Right above the Outram Park mrt station. With a sort of dedicated route to the hotel via an elevator from right inside the station. Very convenient. Hotel room: Size is not that spacious but still okay at 22m2 as per its website for the basic room. Our booked King bed was actually 2 singles merged into one. Minus a point for not informing us at the reception. Overall room is clean. Bathroom/toilet is very small. First time I ever got "damaged" twice while in the toilet during my shower. First my right hand swung onto the bath soap tray during shower and while drying myself outside the shower my back knocked against the metal sharp end of the shower door handle. Fortunately it was not that hard that would cause a deep painful bruise. Lastly the toilet door was not working as well. Staff: I have no issues with anyone. Everyone was very efficient and helpful. Due to the SG Clean status of this hotel, the various procedures to ensure everyone's safety from the pandemic were not that inconvenient at all. Sound out to the front office staffs from Rachel who checked us in as well as the entrance lady who'd explained clearly what we needed to do to enter the hotel premises daily. Facilities: The swimming pool was quite nice. We were only allowed an hour daily and the added step to appear at the front desk just to collect the card pass was slightly inconvenient. Would it not be more useful to allow this set hour to be programmed into our hotel room cards instead of needing to go physically collect it at the reception when using the pool? Another minus half point. Summary: We would come back if we need to go Chinatown again and when the price is as good as what we got.

Address: 333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
NandA: Dorsett Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
Title: 4days 3 night stay
Review: This is a four star hotel, but came to my surprise the room feels like a normal hotel, 2 or 3 stars. Cleanliness 8/10 8/10 because the window view facing Cantonment Police HQ panel has loads of dirt and dust. Parking is quite hectic as you will have to pay $12/day by purchasing their one time ticket even when your a hotel guest because the carpark is manned by a third party operator.. What is worst is their carpark lots are so less. Very tight and poorly lit. Drove in at daylight, in the carpark it can be a horror scene. In the end, i parked in open an space public carpark instead, paying $1.20/hr which is much cheaper. Location wise is great as the MRT is just below the hotel and lots of great food for supper nearby. paid half a thousand for 4D3N here, i think i can spend my money somewhere better.

Title: Thoughtful and accommodating.
Review: My partner and I booked a stay for Christmas for our first anniversary and Dorsett helped to facilitate it over the Agoda chat. We appreciated the little touches when we entered our room and the bathtub was luxurious and spacious. The front desk, Aiden, personally brought us up to the pool seeing as our check out time was soon and we were also unable to visit the pool the day before. He went to extra mile to give us a late check out at 2pm to visit the pool at 1pm and even tapped us in (given covid restrictions) It was a very thoughtful gesture. We will definitely revisit Dorsett again for birthdays and celebrations :-)

Address: 333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
NandA: Dorsett Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
Title: Very good
Review: Pros : 1) the hotel has really good location. 2) the room is clean and comfortable. 3) the hotel is accommodative and tried their best to made our stay comfortable. 4) there are many GOOD eatery nearby within 3-5mins of walking. 5) the bed and pillows are comfy! Cons: 1) the hotel does not provide wine glasses and a bottle opener (might be due to the renovation of their restaurant/cafe). 2) the night shift staff at the concierge (on 31st Dec & 1st Jan night) seems to have a nonchalant attitude towards guests. 3) we extended our check out timing to 1.30PM and the house keeping ENTERED our room while we were sleeping at 11.30AM. We feel really disturbed. 4) it is very hard to call the concierge/operator/house keeping from the room phone as nobody would pick up. You have to walk down to make any request. 5) the water in the shower isn‚Äôt hot enough, it is just warm or at room temperature.

Address: 333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
NandA: Dorsett Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
Title: Over-stringent Security
Review: After booking, I received an email 3 days before my stay, warning me about strict hotel policies of not allowing guests to bring visitors into the hotel rooms and guest room floors. They even stated the penalties such as fines up to thousands of dollars and imprisonments and quoted the law if I don‚Äôt comply. It was mentioned again upon checking-in and I was required to sign an acknowledgment form about it. I understand they are being cautious about the COVID-19 situation but I take it that the hotel don‚Äôt trust its guests and I felt threatened. Not comfortable at all. The loft room is nice but the view is not, overlooking the busy street.

Address: 333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765

Title: Exceptional
Review: I booked the hotel for 3D2N for New Year‚Äôs Celebration and my anniversary with my husband. It was truly an enjoyable stay and we even thought of extending our stay duration! The hotel is very well maintained and I love the simplicity and coziness of the room, it made my stay extra comfortable and relaxing. The hotel is a little understaffed but they tried their very best to accommodate our needs and made our stay as comfortable and enjoyable as they could. Overall, if you are looking for a short relaxing getaway in town, this hotel is a great option! The swimming pool is decent(co sharing with dorsett residences) and the gym is abit small with limited equipments.

Title: Terrible service and cleanliness of room
Review: Was told that they only allowed 2 guests in based on the room we were given. However, the way how the staff approached us was very terrible whereby they talked down to us like as if we were kids and kept spam calling our room to chase us out. Also, room cleanliness was terrible. Toilet was not scrubbed properly on the walls and literally can see stains from previous guests that uses the room. Mirrors were also not well clean and you can see finger prints on it as well. Interior of the hotel was so bad that you can see someone showering just from sitting at the bedside. Terrible and will never come again.

Address: 333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
NandA: Dorsett Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
Title: Just alright
Review: Stayed for 3 days & 2 nights. On the 2nd day, waited for more than 40minutes for make-up room. Had to make 3 phone calls for that. Not 1 but 3 staffs arrived after that. The one who made the bed was what I was really unhappy about. It is not called making up the bed when all she did was put the comforter in place WITHOUT tucking in and tidy the bedsheet and the pillows. If I had known that was it, I could make up my own bed and definitely can do it better! Checking in took 30minutes wait time. Checking out was quick but was declined of late check out due to high occupancy. Room was alright. Reminds me of some so-called hotels in neighbouring countries that are rated 5 star but more of a 3 star deserving. Needs a lil bit of refurbishment and cleaning on the carpet cause it kind of has that unpleasant odour to it. No room service obviously. There were only two pillows when I arrived so had to ask for another two. Who sleeps with two anyway? I know I don't. The two extra pillows given to me was OMG. They were huge and oh-so-comfy. At least this one thing made my stay a cosy one, or perhaps the huge windows too. Draw the curtains to the side, the outside world offers only views of health institutions and roadworks but oh well, it was still nice to have it all spacious.

Title: Value for money stay in town
Review: Dorsett hotel is a decent hotel with fantastic location and service. Check in and check out were fuss free and quick with very good service attitude. Hotel is quite old so I expected the inside to be quite worn out, but it is still acceptable for a one night's stay. I told the hotel before hand that this staycation is for anniversary and they wrote a card and drew cute cartoons on the mirror. It was a nice gesture. We felt welcomed. The only issues I had with the hotel room are the flooding of the area outside the shower and the buzzing sound from the electrical box above the wardrobe. We almost slipped and fell a few times when walking inside the toilet as the flooding was pretty bad. The buzzing sound was quite loud which affected our sleep a bit. Other than these issues, the hotel is pretty decent and value for money.

Title: Excellent
Review: Dorsett is located in the midst of a very prominent neighborhood. Among the quaint lil shophouses resides delicious food places ranging from food houses with local delights to chic cafes featuring brunches for the fancier tastebuds haha There‚Äôs also cosy bookstores, spas & gyms. The train station is barely 5min walk away The staffs were extremely accommodating; I requested for some room deco they acceded & said they‚Äôll prepare a slice of card, instead they went way beyond & very kindly got a card & an entire cake for my partner‚Äôs birthday even Our loft itself is nice, but with all the cool hangout spots in & around the hotel there‚Äôs too lil time for everything, which is really what this hotel can boasts of :)

Address: 333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
NandA: Dorsett Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;333 New Bridge Road, Chinatown, Singapore, Singapore, 088765
Title: Nice enough if you could afford it
Review: Excellent location and staff. Price was not quite value for money especially since it‚Äôs a bit expensive - I‚Äôd expect more for that kind of price. Room was small but comfy. The TV channels could have more variety and quality. The kettle was horrendous - there were brown spots at the spout. God knows what it was. Changed my mind on having a cuppa. The toilet was well stocked. Lots of towels everywhere. Can‚Äôt say the same for pillows. The toilet has no water hose at the side - probably catering to western ideals. There was a LAN or telephone port near the toilet seat which I find it to be very odd. The shower gel and shampoo were excellent (not measly). I must say that the shower door placement was odd. Water will spilled out. Perhaps realignment of how the door should be opened could prevent this. Window view was excellent. The switches were not user friendly. There was no feedback on the switches so I wasn‚Äôt quite sure whether I had turned it on or off. Aircon was excellent.

Review: The Outram Dorsett Hotel is really well positioned in Singapore, they have outstanding size rooms that more than match the rates they charge. The swimming pool is a great size to train in and you don't wait long for the lifts. Which is a pretty annoying trait to have in a hotel. All in all I'd have to say the dorsett hotel is the only thing Singapore can say is value for money in it's current trejectory (note the ridiculous SGD rate). As they think they are the Mercedes Benz of Asia (that title will always stay with Japan) but they are really a well made Honda.

Title: Disappontment from Carlton Hotel
Review: We booked the hotel in July 2020, cause the review from other travelers are good and they provide good breakfast. To our disappointment, the executive room we booked (1) 2 ceiling light not working. (2) Only 1 shower cap for 2 pax room. (3) One of the big towel got stain and hair. (4) Packet tea provided in the room is opened (5) Bed linen and pillow cover got red dot of blood. For (item 2-3)We were replaced with clean towel and a new shower cap. For (item 4), at 10pm when we about to go bed, we realized the bed linen stain with blood dot, hotel staff is kind enough to change us to another new room. We are finally settle down as the new room is super clean and we have a good sleep. There is no buffet for breakfast, this maybe due to Covid situation. The breakfast is not value for the price we pay for a "4 stars" hotel.

Title: Poor customer service
Review: We were greatly disappointed. At check in, we waited almost 2 hours STANDING in a Q. When it was our turn, the staff informed that the room is not ready and asked us to wait AGAIN. When we got our keys and went to the room only to find the room was not cleaned at all. Went back down with all our stuffs, and was given another room. Throughout the whole encounter we were only been told: ‚Äúwe are sorry, never expect the crowd on Sunday, there is nothing we can do.‚Äù I am surprise that they didn‚Äôt expect the crowd when all bookings are done prior to arrival? It spoilt our otherwise planned birthday retreat, with our ice cream cake melted before we can even eat it... I do not recommend this hotel and will not book again. This is NOT a 5 star service worthy.

Title: Good

Hotel Name: Carlton Hotel Singapore - SG Clean Certified
Address: 76 Bras Basah Road, City Hall, Singapore, Singapore, 189558
NandA: Carlton Hotel Singapore - SG Clean Certified ;76 Bras Basah Road, City Hall, Singapore, Singapore, 189558
Title: Disappointing this time..
Review: Stayed at Carlton before and thought to do an impromptu stay with a friend who lost a very dear pet to take her mind off the hurt. The only great part of the stay was the check-in. Had the most friendly and helpful staff that assisted with check-in. Unfortunately, impression kind of fell to the ground when I entered the room. It looked old and had a little old smell but once the air con came on, it felt better. View was good but room wise was a lot more disappointing when I stayed with a friend at the opposite wing. Anyway, we needed an extra towel and called for one. It took almost 45minutes before it came. Which we were fine assuming that the hotel was running on minimal staffing. On the second night, I had a cut but not at the hotel's fault. We tried calling the reception to get a plaster and bottle opener but there was no answer for the 2 times we called. My friend had to head down to the lobby to get someone. But there was no one. The great thing was a staff called our room to check if we needed first-aid or just the bandaid. Glad that they were pro-active on that part. Bandaid and bottle opener came about 20mins later. Hot water in the room was temperamental. The water will be hot for 5 seconds then revert to extreme cold for 3 seconds and slowly back to hot. This cycle went on for our stay. I really liked Carlton the last time I came, so I decided to book it again this time. But to see it change so vastly is pretty disappointing and sad. Hopefully they will get more staff to help the team and serve the guests better.

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: Brilliant Hotel
Review: It was a Honeymoon Staycation for me and my newly wedded husband who just arrived from Colombia! <3 Amazing interior and pleasant ambience that makes you feel special being in a 5 star hotel. The staff at the front door (an Indian - sorry I did not ask for his name) greets everyone with a smile and kind eyes all the time. Attention from staff, all the way starting from when you enter until the reception where you check in/out. Then you will get your own privacy afterwards in the room that is spacious, grand and well-equipped with amenities. View is great, we got upgraded to the premier king bed room with balcony on level 6 facing towards The Clifford Pier. We had to book for the pool session, which unfortunately was fully booked on the day we arrived, and since we were there for only a night, we requested from a gentleman Oliver from the concierge, sometime late at night, for a slot in the morning next day before we check out. Lucky us, we got the slot for the pool session! Service, staff, hotel is superb! Except for our waiting time to get checked in. We arrived at the hotel around 2-ish in the afternoon. We understand that the hotel starts its check-in time at 3pm, however we had to wait for our room to be ready and only got in after 5pm. For the amount we paid, we wanted to fully utilise the facility and make it worth it, but we could only check in at 5 ish which is not our fault and not given option for late check out. Nonetheless, we had a great time, wished we could stay longer! Beautiful hotel with great service and staff are all very polite and attentive.

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: Mixed Feelings
Review: We arrived on 17 Oct, after the check-in timing and was told our room wasn't ready yet. The staff asked us to have a drink at the restaurant and we ended up having a late lunch as well (drinks were complimentary so that was atleast nice). After our meal, we headed back to the reception and were once again told that the room wasn't ready yet and they needed another 45 minutes. Normally my husband and I will not be too fussy but we had a restless toddler and an infant so getting them settled in was high priority for us. Moreover, for the price we were paying and the reputation of the hotel, we were expecting top notch experience. We note that the staff was trying their best but it took a few rounds of "we will check and update you" before they decided to give us a temporary room to rest in. By the time we moved to our actual room, it was past 6pm. The room and facilities were great. All in all, my toddler had fun and that's all that mattered. But things could have been better at the beginning, which pretty much set the tone for the rest of the stay for me and my husband.

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: Great value but you need the distance to Asoke BTS as the Tuk Tuk service is not regular
Review: Comparing with the Holiday Inn Express, the fittings in the room is much better. Breakfast value, the bed and room quality scores higher. The walk to the Asoke BTS/Terminal 21 is a distance and I was hoping to catch the hotel Tuk Tuk which was not regular and found out that I had to making a booking. The hotel check in and staff was pleasant and constantly apologetic. While my sleep was very good, the aircon control was not working but I had to leave it switched on at 19 degrees Celcius or come back to a "funky" room ( typical for hotels that are quite old but trying to stay good). If they improved the feedback, I would not mind coming back to stay over the Holiday Inn Express. I would be able to find a similar quality nearer to Terminal 21.

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: Superb one-night stay
Review: We paid a fleeting visit to Singapore and opted to stay at the Fullerton Bay based on recommendations. The Bay View room was stunning and all the staff we encountered were charming, discrete and welcoming. We are intending to return to Singapore in February 2019, again for just a night or so at the end of our South-east Asian holiday. And in view of our wonderful experience in 2018, we shall again splash out for a stay at the Fullerton Bay, which hopefully will provide a memorable ending to our holiday at Chinse New Year just before flying back to London.

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: Unexpected disappointment
Review: We arrived at 2pm and were told the room will be ready by 3pm. And we wait till 3 pm then the front desk manager told us the room is still not available and we will have to wait for one more hour! That‚Äôs definitely not a 5 star hotel service to delay the guest‚Äôs check in time no matter what reasons they might have. It‚Äôs simply reflecting an obvious management failure. Furthermore, they didn‚Äôt offer any alternative option for us but said they were sorry!! Such lip service doesn‚Äôt help at all. I told the manager firmly we need the room to change our clothes and shoes in order to join tour scheduled tour at 3:30 and putting us waiting in lobby is unacceptable. 10 mins later, another lady approached us and said they managed to open a vacant room for us to change our clothes. Having read lots of good comments about Fullerton Bay Hotel, however, this is by no means a 5 star service they should provide to any guests! An unexpected bad experience!

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: Hands down best service in Singapore
Review: Booked this hotel for my parents. A day after arriving in Singapore, my moms dad passed away. They were unable to turn around and travel back so they honored their 2 night stay at the Fullerton Bay. I had called to explain the situation because I wanted to issues in their stay as they were grieving. Maria the staff that I spoke to could not have been more helpful. She bent over backwards to make my parents stay as special as possible under the circumstance. The rooms have amazing views, and my parents from the U.S were amazed at the modernity and sophistication of the hotel. Would recommend highly to other travelers for a special stay.

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: A night of luxury
Review: I'm not usually fond of large hotels as they can be impersonal and service can be patchy. My daughter and I had been travelling in SE Asia for 6 weeks & when we booked our trip decided we'd like to end it with a little luxury. We normally opt for boutique hotels so the Fullerton would not normally feature but price wise it seemed to tick the boxes compared to others in the same category. The Fullerton Bay exceeded my expectations. I had emailed to say that we required a non smoking twin room as we were mother and (adult) daughter. On arrival we were delighted to be upgraded to a Premium Twin. Check in was extremely efficient and we were swiftly shown to our superb room. All modern conveniences, spotlessly clean and a super balcony with a view across the bay . We thoroughly enjoyed our brief luxurious stay.

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: Hands down the best hotel in Singapore
Review: Even entering the lobby is relaxing. What the hell do they use for air freshener?? Probably real flowers. Or angels' sweat and tears. Fullerton bay makes it really hard for me to enjoy any other hotels anywhere in the world. The staff? Very friendly, very helpful, very attentive but NOT in a creepy, stalker-y way. The breakfast? I would eat there all day, everyday. For such a small hotel the food selections are amazing. Seriously, I'd kidnap the chefs and lock them in my basement and force them too cook the Fullerton Bay breakfast menu for me everyday for the rest of their life. PLEASE HAVE THE CROISSANT. Best croissant ever. The bed? Dont make me start on the bed. They have a vast selections of pillows, and goddamn, the pillows! I swear they're made of baby angels' butts. The sheets are so soft they have got to be made from the skin of those baby angels, too. The only downside is the price and the room availability. They never have enough rooms so you need to book way in advance for peak season. The price is definitely way up there but damn Fullerton Bay take my money!!!

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: Pricey and somewhat lacking empathy
Review: Good hotel, fantastic pool and rooftop bar, nice rooms, BUT.... at this level, things should be perfect. They were not, a few small details will keep me from coming again. First I wrote in my booking that we were coming for my wife's birthday, I hinted it would be nice to stay on the bay side of the hotel, and would even be willing to pay for it. My request and my wife's birthday were ignored. Not even a note. So much for the much advertised personal touch. Second, the pricing policy is not at all customer friendly. We decided to stay another night, our 3rd one, and had to pay a whopping 50% higher because they did not release rooms on Agoda. Now a great hotel would have given us the same rate as the two first nights. Short term greed versus long term view. Value for money is good if you have a view on Marina bay, but not so if you have a view on the skyscrapers of the financial district. It makes the whole difference.

The food is an A+ their pool & jacuzzi are clean & awesome. Their bathrobe is the softest robe I have ever came across. We had the deluxe room & there were more complimentary water, chocolate, apples & all toiletries were available. My husband & I had the best time.

Review: We've staid in different hotels in Singapore (Hard Rock and another hotel in Sentosa, Raffles in Downtown and Fullerton (Heritage) in Marina) and this is by far our favourite. Get a room with a bay view - it is gorgeous. Very easy location for any activities in Singapore.

Address: 80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
NandA: The Fullerton Bay Hotel ;80 Collyer quay, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 049326
Title: Amazing experience !!!!!1
Review: OMG, Where do I start? From our arrival at the hotel through to our departure to the airport it was an unbelievable experience.We were greeted by the door staff and bell boy with smiles as wide as the Euro tunnel. They were very friendly, chatty and cheeky. A great lift after a 13 hour flight from London. At check in, the receptionist was fast, friendly and personally escorted us to our room. When entering the room, we were greeted by an amazing bay view, whereby The Marina Bay Sands stands commanding the bay. It was spectacular. Facilities in the room were of very high standards. We dropped our bags and headed out to see the bay only to return to the room all layed out with rose petals, champagne on ice, strawberries dipped in chocolate and a card wishing us a happy anniversary. Their attention to detail was second to none. IDA the breakfast manager was very attentive without being intrusive. A great people skill !!!! Thank you IDA !!!!! An experience my partner and I will never forget at The Fullerton Bay Hotel in Singapore.

Hotel Name: Village Hotel Bugis by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 390 Victoria Street, Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188061
NandA: Village Hotel Bugis by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified) ;390 Victoria Street, Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188061
Title: Overall rating for this hotel is Fair
Review: For the amount spent to have a staycation here during the present COVID-19 situation, spent about $200++/night for a Family Room with daily breakfast. Hence, for two nights, that‚Äôs about $400++. I can say it is abit expensive. 1)The daily breakfast was not ala carte buffet or any sort. It was just a bento set served in microwaveable plastic containers. Although the set did comes with an orange/apple, a packet of Marigold packet drink and a cup of tea/coffee. The items within the bento set served for the past two days were not worth the price(as the package I paid includes breakfast charges into it already). Examples of items served in a bento set; mee goreng with not much ingredients inside), a mini sausage, a mini croissant, two pieces of toasted white bread, a small piece of scrambled egg and three tiny slices of marbled cake. 2) Family room was a bad choice I have made. The first night there was terrible. As I was given a interconnected room(so there is an interconnected door). In the wee hours of the night, I was woken by very noisy neighbours! They were talking and laughing so loudly, and worst I think they smoked inside their room(coz the smell drifted into our room and the smell of cigarette smoke lingered in our for very long). I checked the clock and it was around 02:45am!!! I tried to make myself sleep but the persistent noise coming from our neighbours were too disturbing. Hence, I have to make a call to the service desk to ask for their assistance and at the same time informing them that their interconnected door is too thin. They mentioned that they will send a security guard to check. Thumbs up for their immediate action to resolve my situation. In the end, the very next day, I requested for a change of room and they willingly acceded to my request. Thumbs up for Ratna for assisting! They changed us to another room without the interconnected door. And Indeed the changed room was better than the previous one. No cigarette smell and sound-proofed walls!

NandA: Village Hotel Bugis by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified) ;390 Victoria Street, Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188061
Title: Village Hotel Bugis (12-13 Dec 2020)
Review: Spacious room and the staff are friendly. We chose VHB because it is surrounded by a lot of Halal cafes and restaurants. You will be spoilt for choice. Masjid Sultan is just opposite the hotel, which made it convenient to join the congregational prayers. Bugis Junction/ MRT is less than 5-mins away. Finding a parking lot at the basement was challenging for us as it is a shared carpark between Hotel/Mall and we had to exit/enter the carpark 3 times before we could get a lot (during Covid period, all other floors are closed and you can only park at B1). Overall, it was a nice staycation for the family.

Address: 390 Victoria Street, Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188061
NandA: Village Hotel Bugis by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified) ;390 Victoria Street, Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188061
Title: Strategic and Convenient Amazing Hotel in Arab Street
Review: Dear Bugis Village Hotel and Team, We stayed in the deluxe room on the 11th floor facing the sultan mosque and had a wonderful stay. The room is comfortable. Aircon was good, all toiletries were provided such as robes, towels, iron, and boards in the room that was necessary for our stay. Although the counter was busy during weekends and check-in time, all the staff including the backend counter came forward to attend to all guests and we didn't have to wait long. Your staff displayed such a warm welcome to all the guests. I have another family who even decided to check-in at the last minute the next day upon seeing how comfortable the place is. The surrounding was so vibrant and plenty of foods and places to see. This hotel is the most strategic and convenient place to stay when you are in Arab Street. Due to covid, there are some regulations in the hotel such as pre-booking of the swimming pool and no room service. But it was totally fine. The price for the hotel was affordable and worth it. Thank you for making our stay so wonderful and pleasant. We would definitely choose to return to this hotel again.

Address: 390 Victoria Street, Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188061
NandA: Village Hotel Bugis by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified) ;390 Victoria Street, Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188061
Title: Good service
Review: I gave 5 star because of the service recovery they offered: - they didn‚Äôt have interconnecting rooms for our room type, therefore they gave us a free upgrade with interconnecting rooms - the swimming pool was closed for maintenance and we expressed our disappointment (we actually cancelled 2 other hotels due to their closed pools as we really want to swim with our children). They gave us a complimentary buffet dinner which was superb. The swimming pool was eventually repaired on the second day. Would have been a 4 star rating otherwise: - the windows were sort of dirty was the scenery has a yellow tint. - can smell a tinge of cigarette smoking in the toilet, probably from the other rooms. - hotel entrance was not as spacious as other hotels - room is spacious - location is near attractions like Singapore Flyer, esplanade, Marina area - easy to get Indian Muslim food at Arab street if interested. There are also other food at Haji Lane for dinner.

Title: Pluses and minuses
Review: This hotel has a nice stylish concept. Its well maintained, has a great restaurant and decent amenities. Staff and service are generally good too. However the rooms are just tiny and impossible to move around in. The toilet is so small the wash basin has to be situated in the room and the metal bed frame has sharp corners that will do your shins in as you attempt to squeeze yourself past your room mate. After travelling overseas extensively for business and leisure and staying at numerous hotels, the size of the accomodation offered by this hotel might just epitomize the general lack of space in Singapore. Value added items that you would come to expect to be included in the room rate, especially from a 4 star hotel, such as complimentary parking for guests or even free breakfasts, are also absent.

Use of Swimming pool allows max 20 people at one time and we had the opportunity to head there twice during our stay. Carpark is almost like HDB carpark rates but with very limited lots, you might end up at their foyer carpark which is very pricey. Overall satisfied. You get what you pay for. Considerably small rooms and beds. More for party goers but we are not complaining. (:

Address: 90 Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Singapore, Singapore, 238259
NandA: M Social Singapore ;90 Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Singapore, Singapore, 238259
Title: Unprofessional and cold staff
Review: we heard good reviews about M Social but our stay was quite a disappointment. yes i understand it is covid, but our check in process could have been smoother. If we are expected to check in late due to the delay, why not have a staggered timing for check in? if you can stagger check out timing and deduct 1 hour of our time by having earlier check out, why cant you compensate us with either early check in or staggered check in so that we can check in on time and pay for the rightful duration? even if you have early check out which we were requested to check out 1 hr before, why only tell us on check in day and not earlier? at least we have prior expectation and not be disappointed. and when you say we can call at 9am to ask for late check out, i called 3 times at 3 different timing (8.50am, 9am, 10am) yet nobody was attending to my call. why did you ask me to call then? might as well tell me there is no late check out available. dont deceive your guests! will not stay with you again!

Title: Not the best of service.

Frontdesk was constantly unavailable. All the times we called, the frontdesk nor the Mbassador did not pick up. Parking is not complimentary (expected as already stated in the listing, I believe) but complimentary parking would be a nice touch. Request for late check-out was also not accommodated. Lady said that rooms were fully booked. Pillows were too soft. They were actually square pillows, not the proper kind for sleeping.

Address: 90 Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Singapore, Singapore, 238259
NandA: M Social Singapore ;90 Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Singapore, Singapore, 238259
Title: It was mediocore
Review: It wasn't one of the best hotel i stayed in considering i paid $200 a night especially when the price is after a 18% discount (i paid using citibank credit card so there was a promo). The room were really small, although cosy. The sink was in the room itself which was kind of a turn off. The toilet is really small, essentially you only can have one person showering and using the toilet bowl at the same time. You can't have one showering while another use the toilet bowl because of how constrained the area was. Also there was this smell of shit throughout our stay although we suspect it is because of the drainage system? Also, one major thing that was bad for me was that the sensor to sense our room key ran out of battery on our last day! We had to stand outside our room for 15mins to wait for their security team to fix the door so that we can enter our room. This was all with time constrain as we were supposed to check out by 12pm when this happened at 11am. Thankfully the saving grace was that they allowed us a slightly later check out at 12:30pm because of what happened. The location isn't the most ideal as public transport wasn't the most convenient? Not the worst but for the price i paid , i would not recommend again. I think there are better hotels out there for the price i paid.

Title: Four stars?

Proper checks in place to entire safety and contact tracing Points to note: 1. Room had a weird stale odor 2. Weird odor in toilet whenever shower was turned on. 3. Fridge/Chiller was not functioning properly - unable to cool a can of drink to 10 oC despite being left inside for five hours. 4. lots of dust around different corners. 5. Houseflies spotted at different places, particularly near the sofa 6. Gym was fully booked even before check in (covid19 social distancing measures). 7. Breakfast was a waste of time, money and calories. It was sorely lacking in both quality and selection. A trip to any nearby cafe would be better. I booked two nights but cut short and checked out on the second day instead.

Address: 90 Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Singapore, Singapore, 238259
NandA: M Social Singapore ;90 Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Singapore, Singapore, 238259
Title: Poor Customer Service
Review: I had booked 3d2n (5/12-7/12) stay at alcove terrace for my wedding stay with my wife. Everything was okay, it was a good stay however we decided to extend 1 more night. Sadly we were informed by the recep that the room was not available and that they only had the normal alcove room. On the 7th, when we enter the new room, it was good but there was no phone to call front desk. After few hours of staying there, we fell asleep and around 7pm we woke up, the room was dark. We thought that we did not switch the lights on. However, it turned out to be a technical problem - Power trip. We had to go down and ask for help. When the technician arrived he manage to fix it but again, the power trip. It was so frustrating as we had to go down to the concierge again to inform them that there‚Äôs a power trip. The same technician came up and tell us that we need to change our room, and as I remembered it was close to 11pm! My wife & I were so exhausted after our post wed photoshoot and this was the most unexpected thing to occur to us. We had to pack up our stuffs and went down to the reception to be assigned to another room with a new key card, and that also, we had to wait! I believe that there was only 1 person at the reception, and she must have been well informed of this situation and should have attended to us immediately. When we had asked to speak to the manager in charge, the staffs told us that there was no manager in charge, and that the manager will be on shift the next day. It was a horrible experience and an unfortunate one. There was no form of customer recovery except for a late check out timed at 3pm. During check out, we had to Q as well due to the heavy check ins. As much as i believe that it is Covid, and there might have been cost cutting measures, service wasnt what we expected. The experience was what a terrible one.

However, the check in was super fast and we were in the pool in 30 mins. Staff were friendly. We got the Alcove Double Room. It was small but we were comfortable with the size as it‚Äôs a staycation, we don‚Äôt need space for big luggages. However, the bed was a size between queen and super single. May be be quite uncomfortable for some couples. Pool needs cleaning as we could see particles floating inside. We needed a short break and we had an enjoyable stay.

Address: 90 Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Singapore, Singapore, 238259
NandA: M Social Singapore ;90 Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Singapore, Singapore, 238259
Title: Cosy Boutique Hotel
Review: We booked for a 3D2N stay at M Social. The hotel is located at Robertson Quay & we enjoyed the environment around the hotel very much, strolling by the riverside and varied food options available. Other than this, the check in process needs alot of improvement. From before 2pm till 4pm, the queue for check in continues to be really long till the end of the carpark/road area. Note that there is no room for waiting at the lobby but there are 3 double seat located outside the entrance. The room is also very cosy whereby only 1 person can access the moving area within the room at any one time. The space available can accommodate a small open luggage. Note that the door of the toilet is v heavy and does not stay open. It was hard work trying to open the toilet door each time. Pool and taste of breakfast is also average with very long Q (at least 30mins or longer) for breakfast especially on weekends morning.

NandA: M Social Singapore ;90 Robertson Quay, Clarke Quay, Singapore, Singapore, 238259
Title: No service
Review: Prior to arrival, I asked for early check-in as I needed to setup the room for a surprise. Understood the policy of standard 2Pm check in and early check-in is subject to availability. I arrived at 11.30am, the kind receptionist outside put me on queue list, telling me that they will call me once the room is ready. At 1.30pm, I went up to the another gentleman at the reception to check if my room was ready, only then he went through the system to find a room for me. After check-in, I needed some hand towels to fold towel art as part of my surprise hence I went to the attendant in the corridor to ask him for 6, to which he only gave me two as he said he didn‚Äôt have enough, telling me to call down for more. I called down and ask for 4, the Runner handed me 2. As I was in a hurry setting up the room due to time constraints, I didn‚Äôt feedback about finding hair around the room. When I was back to the hotel at night, I asked the receptionist for an ice bucket but I was asked to head to the restaurant to pick one up myself. Back at the room, I called for bottle opener but the hotel could not provide me any, and when we asked for a solution they told us to go to a 7-11. Always thought this hotel was good until I stayed here.

Title: Really enjoyable stay :)
Review: This is our second time staying here. Had a staycation to celebrate my 3 year-old‚Äôs birthday this time so we upgraded to a deluxe pool view king room and she really enjoyed it! From the tent in the room to the awesome pool, beach, indoor playground and breakfast buffet, it was so easy to keep her entertained. The staff even put a small delicious cake in the fridge as a surprise for her. She was so happy to see the cake and she felt like a birthday princess throughout the whole stay. Staff were helpful and friendly as usual.

Address: 101 Siloso Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098970
NandA: Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort & Spa ;101 Siloso Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098970
Title: Great Hotel
Review: Understand there was a conrona virus case patient who was staying with this Shangri La property. The purpose for me to stay with this hotel is that I believe especially this particular Shangri La Rasa Sentosa Resort hygiene standard is the best compare to the other sister properties. I may not be a regular guest with them. But I know them very well. I find the hotel rate still a bit pricey especially during this corona virus period. Feel they should have do more promotions to bring in the staffs and the locals to come in and stay in this period so as to ease and pull through this difficult period as one. During my stay, I have met a few wonderful chefs in the silver shell Cafe. They are all very professional, excellent services, friendly and always delighting guests. I hope the property will recognise them, they are chef Desmond, chef Annie awesome noodle, chef Karen wonderful egg benedits with smoked salmon, chef ah Mui friendly awesome service. Chef Mac serving wondering food.

We really enjoy the recreational facilities and wonderful breakfast buffet. Wide selection of food choices to choose from. However if the waiting time for check out and food served in the restaurant can be shorter, service will be even better. We will definitely come back again!! :)

Breakfast is always delicious just the queue is super long. Try out the running route to W hotel (11K) or shorter one (5K), this complete the family trip with distance running training. Other hotels cannot give the same level of run like this.

Title: Only choice with direct beach access at the area

When she offered to ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù but we rather kept our room choice, her attitude even got worse. She tried to explain our room is not ready though it‚Äôs almost 4:30pm, but when we insist to kept our choice, she was disappeared and make us just stand there and wait. Title: Large Hotel with good facilities
Review: Large property, known to be one of the first in Sentosa Island. Maintained very well considering the age. Lots of activities around the beach and the pool, especially for kids. Decent food and decently spaced rooms. Presence of a private beach and view of the sea with numerous ships docked makes it interesting. I have been to hotels with better and warmer staff, but the overall stay was good. Though there's nothing immediately outside the hotel, the connectivity options (cable car, shuttle bus, taxi) are great.

During the buffet breakfast, we were seated near the noodle section, our table was not cleared throughout the one hour until we requested a staff to assist us. Was rather upset with the experience at this five star hotel, I do not think it worth the money that I have paid for.

Title: Staff and manager are NOT giving their best of service.
Review: Was there last year with family and immediate family from overseas. No problems. This year, my husband was hosting an event at the venue and thought of staying there for 1 night, treat my 4kids a overnight staycation. Upon checking in, the lady & the counter from China or Korea (can‚Äôt understand her English when she speak), told me to get another room coz I have four kids! I said is this a new rule coz this hotel have been my Wedding, Anniversary & numerous staycation held at Rasa Sentosa. Spoke to a Chinese guy manager & he too asked me to get another room. I said that‚Äôs ridiculous. Being a Singaporean & It‚Äôs such a big issue to have a lot of children now?! Pay for another room to accommodate my 2other young boys?! He said he‚Äôll give it to me this time round. What does that mean?! The next day the manager(after finding out who my husband was after looking at his profile) apologised to my Husband, myself & kids. In the email he said next time they‚Äôll make sure our stay are the best.

If we do go back again, it will be for the pool and club house.

Title: 1st Staycation in 2020
Review: Due to the global COVID pandemic, we couldn't travel overseas this year. Hence, we decided for our 1st night to be in Fullerton. The location is good since we wanted to stay till late nearby, outside Fullerton, you can sit outside the public chair to have late night talks, have a beer and snacks. It was wonderful reminiscing our dating days! The room was big and since i booked Quay Room, i could see the pool and the bridge. The food was not that fantastic, i was expecting more and it wasn't to my expectation. The selection was limited as it was served to us. Maybe it will be good if they could include more varieties from Chinese styles to American styles etc. Overall, it was a good stay but it will be good if you could include some mini bar snacks too. TV programs is average but if there is more Movie Channels such as HBO or NETFLIX etc will be good.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: A Class above the rest
Review: Many hotels have great facilities, but very few have both great facilities combined with consistently great service standards. Capella is one of the very few exceptional hotels in the world that encompasses both qualities. Special mention to Ms Sophia Kim who made our stay extraordinary with her exceptional service. She is very meticulous and remembers the small details and preferences from each of our previous visits to make sure we always look forward to coming back to Capella. Bravo to Sophia and the team for making this world-class hotel our second home!

Review: This is our 3rd time staying with Capella Sentosa and we love every minute of it. The staff are warm, friendly and attentive. They took great efforts in making our stay memorable as we were celebrating my wife‚Äôs birthday. Thank you, Capella and we will come back again.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: One bedroom Villa - Small and simple
Review: Villa interior too simple, villa size and pool are small. Standard amenities such as weighing scale not provided, only 1 tissue box in the entire villa. Bed is firm, quilt is as light as blanket hence no luxury fluffiness feel. Outdoor shower is a joke as there is no complete privacy, the wall has a big gap and the small bathtub can be seen partially standing from the road outside the villa. Honeymooners should think twice before booking. Capella Singapore tagged a luxury but really cannot expect and compare to those luxury 5 stars villa in Thailand and Indonesia.

Title: Understaffed resulting in poor service
Review: Housekeeping and front desk reception are grossly understaffed. When I checked in, there was only 1 employee in the hotel lobby. When I asked for things to be delivered to the room, I had to call housekeeping at least 3 times, only to have the wrong things delivered and only after 1.5 hours did they get it right. When i was queuing to check out, front desk staff actually offered assistance to able-bodied people behind me and one other gentleman (basically allowing them to skip queue) and serving them before us. For the amount you pay at this hotel, the service level is unacceptable.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: Wouldn‚Äôt go back again at this price
Review: I had a bill shock as I was asked to pay additional ‚Äúservice charge‚Äù of $300 upon check in (this is on top of taxes). That is clearly not stated in my agoda bill. I had to call agoda to get me a refund & agoda staff was shock to hear that too. I had to argue several times in a night with capella to get my invoice, as a manager insisted that I booked with agoda so they don‚Äôt need to give me an invoice. I only got it after agoda tell me that it is illegal for capella to not give me an invoice and I used this sentence at the staff. Also, usually a hotel will charge you the exact cost, but they just randomly round off from my room charges and pre-authorize $336.70 from my credit card for incidental charges (supposed to be $300) . It confused my whole invoice costing. I spent 3 hours from 6pm until 9pm to settle all of these on my first day of arrival. Barely got any proper rest at all. On my check out day, they even accidentally charged other room in-room dining cost to my bill. I only realize that when I‚Äôm home and had to call in and email in to complain again. As for cleanliness, their floor is somehow full of sand and bits particles, I kept stepping on it. The curtains had holes and furnitures are getting old with scratches and stains. Location is away from everywhere, I had to take a cab or shuttle bus to get out of capella. I will never come back to capella at such cost again.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: Lovely Staycation with 1 Year Old Baby
Review: We had a one night staycation at Capella to celebrate our son's 1st birthday. Upon our arrival at the hotel lobby, my son was greeted with a peacock soft toy. The parents were given lovely welcome drinks. The room was decorated with several balloons and a lovely cake was also provided. They even provide a high quality baby cot with some baby amenities in it. I like the fact that they also provide towel cover on the common stool at the sink area as well as the outdoor sofa. Overall, the room is clean and huge. Service is also impeccable. Some areas for improvement: 1. Tap knobs are very tight, not easy to turn 2. Water spatter on the floor of the shower area easily, making it quite dangerous to walk around. 3. A baby sitting service so that the parents can enjoy a spa session? I love the fact that this hotel is very baby friendly. It is our first family staycation and thank you for making it stress free for us. We will be be back real soon.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: Weekend with the dogs
Review: It is difficult to find a hotel, much less a luxurious 5-star one, in Singapore that allows dogs in the rooms. Capella not only welcome your dogs, they also make sure that your fur-babies will enjoy the stay as much as you. What caught our eyes the minute we entered our villa were the dog beds, bowls and cartons of drinking water specially prepared for us; the dog beds even came with personalised name tags. Like many 5-stars hotel, the surrounding, rooms and amenities are luxurious and the service is impeccable. What sets Capella apart from the others and impresses us, is understanding our dogs are important and reflecting that care and thoughtfulness in their actions. We have enjoyed every single minute of our stay and we are very sure our dogs have loved it too.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: They say it‚Äôs the best hotel in Singapore. They may have a point.
Review: Only one small issue with the category of room, which looked to be the travel agent‚Äôs fault. The hotel fixed it quickly and painlessly. Other than that, the rest of our stay was excellent. In particular, the Chinese restaurant was outstanding and my wife and I would highly recommended it. It feels like there is a keen attention to detail at the Capella, such as no silly card slot to keep the power and AC on in the room. No silly internet password or getting continuous kicked off. Balloons and flowers for my wife‚Äôs birthday. Lovely little touches around the room and property all added up to making the stay more relaxing and enjoyable. The room was comfy and well equipped, surroundings were lovely. The staff were friendly, attentive & accommodating to requests. Definitely not the cheapest hotel in Singapore but you always feel you can see where the money was spend and never feel short changed.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297

Enjoyable stay.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: Great Staff, 5-star mostly
Review: Like my other reviews on 5-star accommodations the attention to detail adds the finishing touches to what should be a memorable experience. The rain drenched weekend highlighted inadequate wet weather coverage along the walkways. The alfresco deck had a soaked lounger and water started to stream along the floor. The ornamental terrariums on the dining tables in The Knolls had a layer of dust and the water biscuits served during the breakfast buffet cheese corner was stale 2 days in a row. Thankfully the soft aspects of cheerful, attentive and ever present staff, good housekeeping, good food, lovely surroundings, do support Capellas 5-star standing. They have also done a phenomenal job in modernising and preserving the old colonial quarter. Bravo!

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: Cozy & comfortable as home

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: Top notch service, worthy of 6 stars!
Review: Was always a little skeptical whether a stay at Capella would be worth the high price tag, but boy, I‚Äôm now a convert after my recent stay! Staff were very friendly and attentive (rather than sooty as feared) and their service standards were truly impressive. Case in point: I had booked a premier sea view room, and on checking into the room, the hotel staff (a lovely lady called Nurul), had noticed that the pillows on the bed had ‚Äútoppled‚Äù to the side slightly, and the sheet was not fully tucked in on one side of the bed. She immediately notified housekeeping. While I was satisfied enough when the housekeeping came promptly within 5 minutes to fix the situation, the Capella staff went the extra mile and greatly impressed me! They quickly arranged for a room upgrade to a Sentosa Suite, and even arranged complimentary bottle of red wine and prepared a warm bath, complete with scattered rose petals on top for a romantic touch! So surprised! Truly 6 stars service standards.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: Amazing experience, highly recommend!
Review: Their Culturists contacted me personally before our stay to ask about how they can curate our stay experience, and upon hearing my plans, offered a complimentary romantic ambience set-up ‚Äì which included Vanda Miss Joaquim flower petals laid out in shape of ‚ÄúLOVE‚Äù, tub of ice for wine/champagne I suppose, a little bottle of sweets and water by each of our bedside tables, and bubble bath prepared with flower petals and tealights at the side for our romantic bath ‚Äì very thoughtfully curated all within a short time span of an hour when we went out for dinner after my proposal, really high-quality service. The villa was great ‚Äì well-furnished, nice central-control by the bedside, great Bluetooth sound system to play your favourite music, private plunge pool outside was great, very comfortable and nice ambience room on the overall. Highly recommend ‚Äì despite the high-price, worthwhile for the amazing service, villa, ambience, and experience.

Title: Customer service that exceeds expectation
Review: Excellent service from the time of check-in to departure. The hotel provides a nice lounge for guests to sit and enjoy drinks and snacks while the hotel staff processes your check-in. Hotel looks into every aspect to make your stay comfortable and hassle free. The in-room amenities are of good quality and the hotel even provides different repellents in case there are mosquitoes. The hotel serves you complimentary glass of juice and bottled water at the pool without you asking for them. However, the hotel should make known to their guests the things they will do and provide before the guest checks in. For example, we do not know that the hotel provides free pressing for clothes and so, we did not bring clothes that are more suitable when we went for fine dining.

Title: Excellent place for a weekend escape to pamper yourself
Review: Staycation with my wife to celebrate her birthday and the biggest compliment I can give is that I don‚Äôt think it,s going to be easy to beat a stay at capella. Started with a room upgrade and the attention to details by the staff left a lasting impression, as they made the birthday celebration truly memorable. From personally going through the features of the room to making every effort to make your stay pleasant, really a class above the rest! Positives: -Room was spacious and well equipped. Awesome amenities too -Facilities are top notch (multiple pools mean that it‚Äôs never too crowded and the pool side service makes a real difference. Gym is also well equipped and in good condition, despite the hotel celebrating its 10 year anniversary - not sure if there was a revamp) - Lounge/Library is a nice place to chill over some tea time drinks and small bites - Restaurant/Bars: a visit to Cassia for their dim sum is a Must! Applaud Bryan and his team. Great to chill in the late evening at bob,s bar over some of their concoctions - fairly reasonable priced considering the location Negatives (nit picking here): - bed sheets could be better, had much smoother sheets in other hotels - the bathroom taps are really stiff and difficult to turn especially when your hands are wet - Bfast at Knolls had the same impeccable service standards by the staff al

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: Choice Hotel for a pleasant stay
Review: Pros: Excellent and attentive service, from knolls to reception, although reception did not realise I was a multiple patron to the hotel. Good facilities. Room amenities are as always classy and above average. Cons: TV reception and channels do not match expectations of Capella - snowy channel at times, and inadequate channel options. Reading room overhead lights were faulty and not working. Bar fridge was not restocked on day 2 Basin taps are difficult to turn with wet or soapy fingers. A redesign is probably recommended. Water closet wall phone extension cord is aged and draggy, can be a hindrance and does not fit overall image of a classy room. Balcony door upper latch was loose and hindering closure of the doors. From the damage to the doors it seems to have gone unnoticed for a while.

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297

Address: 1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
NandA: Capella Singapore Hotel ;1 The Knolls Sentosa Island, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098297
Title: A modern sanctuary
Review: Not my first stay here and would definitely come back again. Room was upgraded to suite, love the living room and the view. The room was comfortable in every way. Aesop bathroom amenities. Tree pool is the best. The lower level is shallower, suitable for family, and the upper one is quiet for adults. Staff brought us water, I remember back then they brought snacks (chocolate coated ice cream balls). I always spend time at their library. They used to serve cakes. They still serve tea, and cookies. It was a peaceful place for a read. You should walk around the hotel area and you would very likely bump into peacocks.

Title: 2 days and 1 night stay at the Capella
Review: Really an awesome staycation I had! Definitely recommending this hotel to all my friends! The pros : big and spacious room with balcony, staffs were all kind and polite consistently every staff is polite and service is so so good ! Consistency is crucial ! Air con temperature at the best able to adjust ! View is wonderful. Day bed is super comfortable and clean. Our room is kept very very clean ! Went to the pool, there were staffs as well! Drinks were served to us. Cons- may suggest that it‚Äôs time to change the bed mattress.. not as fluffy as I hope it would be.. but still comfortable for a good nights rest ! Probably the pool needs to be cleaned and scrubbed a little, I had a baby nephew swimming.. the ground of the pool seems dirty for little children. May suggest that hotel kindly let us know regarding the areas where our lil fur kids are allowed at, and may kindly let the staffs at pool have more knowledge as to whether are we allowed to bring the pool towel back to our room after swimming and drying ourselves.. If u have a little doggy with u, you might need to walk/trek a distance up back to the hotel if you‚Äôre going out to explore Sentosa. (Maybe can get a buggy to drive us back up? Perhaps? ). But even if it‚Äôs not allowed it‚Äôs okay. The hotel had already made up for all of it hehe ! ‚ù§Ô∏è Overall I WOULD TOTALLY COME BACK-FOR ANOTHER STAY, this hotel is too superb to pass !

Title: Definitely on the decline
Review: We've stayed at Cappella many times and it has seriously gone downhill. I emailed the manager before my stay to let him know it was a special occasion and he never emailed back. The service was actually rude - almost non-existent; as we had to beg to be checked out while a taxi ran the meter up to $10 before we even left the hotel. The villa plunge pool was dirty so we didn't bother to use it. Lastly, we prepaid but they questioned us like we were criminals. We left and went to stay at another much better resort nearby and we won't return. It's really less than a one star hotel.

Title: Excellent
Review: This is my 4th time coming to Capella and i feel this time the standard was not what i expected . The previous staffs were so friendly and without me asking things were done perfectly. While waiting for our villa to be ready, we were at the lobby, the refreshments on the table were not cleared and the manager came over to us and ask if they can serve us second round of refreshments. We told her first of all these do not even belong to us. And during our stay in the villa, previous times we just need to call for buggy once and it arrives within 5 mins. This time i had to call 5-6 times and without confirming they assured the rider is on the way. Very disappointing staycation. I really hope my next stay will be much more better than this.

Title: Excellent service and fast recovery
Review: We booked two rooms with sea view from Agoda. On the day of check in, the receptionist mentioned that rooms are quite fully occupied and upgraded us to villa. At first we did not think much and followed them to the villa. When we check into the villa, we realised that we were not facing the sea but the forest. The villa is quite spacious and there are living room and kitchen, however, when we booked from Agoda, we had specifically chosen the sea view because we wanted to enjoy the sea scenery and the sun set. Realising that, we call up the receptionist and explained that we wanted to change the room. The hotel manager immediately helped us to source for other sea facing rooms. In the end, one of the rooms was upgraded to a bigger room and most importantly they make the promise that it is sea view. We are very happy with the service and recovery from Capella and we certainly enjoy the stay.

Hotel Name: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
NandA: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified) ;2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
Title: Very good
Review: Chose sofitel for our honeymoon as we aren't able to travel out. Was expecting some small decoration in the room with the towel swans but received none. However got upgraded to a same room which we originally took but with the garden view. Which wasn't very pleasant as you could hear the insects are frogs making too much noises. There's nothing much to do in the vicinity too. So be prepared to entetain yourself. TV channels are limited. Would suggest to have a netflix channel for future guests. Toilet had no bidet. Was quite disappointed with that looking at the price we were paying for the hotels. Overall the hotel is nice and pretty with very limited things to do.

Hotel Name: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
NandA: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified) ;2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
Title: Bad fit for a family with a toddler
Review: We were really disappointed with how far our room was and how dirty the shower area was. It had algae trapped between the tiles and some tiles were loose. It became a big inconvenience when we tried to shower our little one. The design of the room wasn't very toddler friendly either. Moreover, we chose a suite that came with a garden view but were greeted by construction instead. The breakfast selection was extremely limited to top off the many disappointments experienced. I'd advice friends who are travelling with little ones to go for a hotel nearer beach station or resort world station instead to travel out of sentosa island since most toddler friendly activities have been closed or are undergoing changes.

Hotel Name: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified)

NandA: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified) ;2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
Title: Terrible experience
Review: Check in: check-in time is at 3pm, but they could only give us a room at 430pm. Facilities: due to Covid you need to book a slot for the swimming pool. Upon check-in all slots were already taken, so we didn't have a chance to use the pool at all. Room: no in-room connectivity for your own music or Netflix. TV is not smart so you can't log into your Netflix account. Coffee machine wasn't working, the staff came to fix it and it worked once, then it stopped working again. Service: no turn-down service! In short, we paid for a 5 star experience and received a 3 star experience at best. Completely unacceptable, I definitely won't return.

Title: Staycay oct 2020

Title: Relaxing Weekend Getaway
Review: My husband and I had a very relaxing weekend at Sofitel. The hotel premise and room was clean and well maintained. All the staff were very polite and friendly which made our stay very enjoyable. We had dinner at The Cliff. Italian food was yummy. Highly recommends the parma ham and pizza. Breakfast was served in sets (post covid normal) and you could request for top-up of the items included in your set. Breakfast was filling and good! Check-out was a breeze with the express check-outs available. Overall a very good getaway!

Hotel Name: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
NandA: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified) ;2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
Title: Extremely disappointed
Review: This is my first time staying at Sofitel Sentosa, my experience was way below the price they are commanding from consumers. Here's a summary of my stay: 1) Check in time was 3pm but after arriving the property, my room was not ready till 4pm. Staff just told us to wait outside until room is ready. However, I was grateful for them to allow late checkouts till 2pm. 2) Had high tea at LeBar, there were 2 staff working. They were unfriendly throughout our interactions. 3) We had room service for dinner and requested for water. When the food came, there was no water and the staff said water is not part of his job, told us to call again. We had to call the third time for our water and it only came 2 hours later since we finished our food. 4) Had breakfast the next morning and food was decent. When I was digging into my fruit platter, I found there was MOULD on my grapes. How can you serve mouldy food at a 5 star hotel? I told the staff and was only offered a replacement. 5) While waiting for our shuttle bus at the lobby, we saw people alighting their vehicle and enter the hotel properly without safety check in via QR code and temperature checks. This doesn't make me feel safe staying at this hotel at all. For the price I paid for my stay, I was extremely disappointed with my experience.

Title: Never Again
Review: My husband and I finally decided to do a staycation for my 30th birthday at this hotel and it was extremely disappointing! We spent 1.2k SGD thinking it was going to give us the "experience" of being home away from home but the staffs were really unwelcoming. We checked in late, around 10.30pm on Friday night and the person who checked us in was like a zombie. He didn't tell us anything about the hotel, no breakfast timing was mentioned, no check-out, no facilities was mentioned. We just got our keys and went to our room. That was the start. For the rest of it, it felt like everyone was working like robots. No smile, no warmth. The term "Hospitality" was dead in that hotel. I've been speaking about my experience to many people and I feel it should be given an awful review!

Title: Above average
Review: We recently stayed for a family staycation. The room was nice but starting to get outdated. The most disappointing was the breakfast. We understand there are still no buffet services because of the pandemic, so there were only ala carte options. What was unacceptable was that it took an hour for our breakfast to be served and it was served incomplete...despite many rounds of follow up. It seems like they are overwhelmed and understaffed. We were also made to register for facilities before coming to the hotel, but in the end you have to re-book everything as they didn't connect reservations made online. A bit of disconnected customer experience on that aspect too. We expected more considering it's a 5-star hotel and we are paying a decent sum for the stay.

Title: Weekend staycation
Review: Was initially worried about the negative reviews on bad service post CB, but pleasantly surprised that our experience proved otherwise. We had a fantastic 2-night stay! We requested for early check-in since we didnt want our toddler to miss her afternoon nap, and thankfully the room was ready as early as 11am. Special shoutout to Rodel (buggy driver) who was very friendly and accomodating. We requested for transport from the Spa to the hotel since it was raining. When he found out we needed to go to Beach station, he offered to bring us to the nearest bus stop (at the golf course). This gesture was really helpful especially bec we had a toddler in tow. The spa service was also excellent. Thanks to Pearl for the great massage and customer service!

Hotel Name: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified)

Title: Alright stay but nothing really worth shouting about
Review: I've done staycations at other hotels at cheaper price point with comparable facilities and experience so I was expecting something a little different here given the price point and rave reviews, but it was honestly quite an average stay with nothing really that stood out. Could hear footsteps from the outside so sleep was disrupted. Overall a decent stay but I won't be rushing to return for my next visit. Have to commend on the safety measures though - appreciated how thorough the premises and room was prepped in view of the COVID situation, helped eased our mind during the stay here. Staff were really helpful and pleasant as well. One incident that marred the experience slightly - we had dined at The Cliff, and we understood that there was an ongoing promotion of 25% discount as we had browsed online prior. The discount was not applied in our final bill and when we asked about it, the waiter sounded slightly begrudging and responded that he will add it in. Came across as an insincere and halfhearted attempt at running a promotion.

NandA: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified) ;2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
Title: Everything is good except the restaurant
Review: They have such kind of weird operation for their restaurant and kitchen during breakfast time. Due to the Covid19 situation, we needed to book a time in advance, no buffet, they took the order and serve you. However, they're not well-prepared (well-trained, well-operated) for that. There was a bunch of people running nowhere, taking orders and some of the customers never got their food. At least, we expected food on our table (fruits or cakes in the meantime waiting for the main dishes). Some people sat there for 1 hour with just some drinks. It's really ridiculous when we already booked the time and table. And more ridiculous when they let it happened for hours without anyone who has ability to solve the problem showed up. Luckily, we got our food after 25 mins, but the food is cold, the bread is old, the omelet egg was totally carelessly cooked. Very disappointed!

Hotel Name: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified)

Title: Good
Review: Paid for a special package set up consisting of balloons, petals and champagne which was close to $300. However, when it was time for the surprise. Half of the balloons had deflated. $300 was not a small amount. There was no service recovery at all. In addition, wake up call was not given. Surely, this is not the standard and service of sofitel especially if the property is very reputable. I have stayed at other properties whereby the service recovery and staff have given excellent service. My take, definetly the first and last staying at sofitel.

Title: Excellent
Review: Highly recommend Garden restaurant. All the staff are very attentive and pleasant (both indoor and outdoor). The food is good too. Experience at the Cliff restaurant is disappointing. The staff seemed busy and some staff did not seem very welcoming. The chips are too oily. LeBar experience is average. Possibly I missed the night with live band performance. The service at Kwee Zeen is good. Though the mushroom soup I ordered was too salty for my taste bud. The room is well maintained. Love the common balcony where there‚Äôs plenty of opportunities for bird viewing. However, the tables should be changed so that they won‚Äôt collect water after the rain. Spa experience is great!

Hotel Name: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified)
