NandA: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified) ;2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
Title: Good but not the best 5 star hotel
Review: Upon arrival, we felt welcome by the friendly Bell guy, best smile during our stay. Check in was fast but not the best person to see (unfriendly), a non chinese lady with glasses just getting job done. no welcome drinks /hand towels for a 5 Star luxury hotel on a hot day? Enter into a foul, damp smell room 178. Nothing special except a falling painting swinging off side that caught our attention. Nice balcony. Bathroom is gorgeous clean, asked for more coffee capsules, service was fast , friendly & helpful chinese guy. F&B - We call for table reservation as is our anniversary, they had to return call 3 times to do such simple task. At breakfast- egg station guy is the best of the house, he greeted every single person coming for eggs, cooks with passion, as we sat nearby so observed the many lovely scene. The bread station guy was kind to help heat my crossiant in the big oven, thumbs up ! LeBar has very good service.

Hotel Name: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified)

NandA: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified) ;2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
Title: Second visit to this hotel and it is still very good
Review: This is the second time we have stay in this hotel. We stayed in this hotel around 2 years ago and we love the green environment of this hotel. During this visit, we found that this hotel is still looks very good. The only different this time is there are less Peacocks around the hotel (Maybe because we come here winter this time), we love to see these wild life walking around the hotel. The guest room is very nice and comfortable although some of the things inside are old. The room service provide a very wide range of food choice and food quality is excellent. The breakfast is also very good with the choice of indoor or outdoor seating. We visited their restaurant - The Garden, which is slightly away from the main building. We had a Christmas dinner there. The staff of The Garden provided excellent service and high level of caring to customers. Also, the food quality is excellent which I think this restaurant can be Top 10 restaurant in SGP.

Title: Acceptable
Review: 1) aircon leaking at living room- behind the couch, along the corridor to the guest room and Inside the guest room. There are many kids running ard. What if they fall! 2) water leaking in the master bedroom toilet- the cubicle to do business, not the shower cubicle 3) flush in the guest room toilet does not stop running after flushing 4) faulty magnetic door stopper 5) the Swimming pool does not have the depth of the pool indicated. It does not seem deep. One of the guest did not realise the depth. She panicked and struggled in the pool when caught by surprise! Thank god there is someone around to jump in and pulled her up.Imagine the consequences! The pool is easily 1.8m 6) flickering lights in living room and master bedroom toilet By the time we realised the number of faults around the Villa, many of the guests had arrived and settled in. Did not want the hassle to change room The other couple left w/o staying $2300 for a night- disappointed. Sent a email. No response

Surprise slice of birthday cake placed in the room while we were out. Areas to improve: 1. Hotel is actually old, but managed by Sofitel. Our room bathtub was moldy and grime along the tiles. 2. Address: 2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
NandA: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort And Spa (SG Clean Certified) ;2 Bukit Manis Road, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 099891
Title: Bad Customer Service Experience for 5* Hotel
Review: For a 5* hotel the staff don't even walk you to your room. The one-touch service experience is very bad! The staff manning the lines are not very well trained. I called in a few times to but nobody answered. When finally someone answered, I wanted to order in-rooming dining, the staff said the line was engaged so he couldn't transfer me. So he took my order from me and will help me call in ltr. I asked him how long would it take, he said "I don't know, I'm just customer service." This is bad service. I suggest for the hotel to have direct lines to e.g. housekeeping , in-room dining so guests can call the relevant depts directly rather than waiting and waiting for the one-touch line to be answered. First night I requested for firm pillows, after waiting for abt 20-30mins the pillows finally came BUT it wasn't even firm, it was the same as the other pillows that was already in the room. On the 2nd night I requested it from the front desk directly, they finally got the pillows right!

Title: Staycation
Review: Recently I stayed in Sofitel Singapore, the room is acceptable however I was quite disappointed with the swimming pool as the water is milky and not able to see the front while swimming. I also used the garden spa at the So SPA, yet again the waterfall pool is filled with dead leaves at the bottom of the pool, it shows that the SPA does not maintain. This applies to the pool located next to it too, Jacuzzi also not working. Pretty disappointed with the overall facilities in So SPA, poorly maintenance but yet charge so expensive. Not value for money.

Title: Club Room At 24th Floor
Review: Experienced the Club Room stay in Dec 2020. Check-in at Level 21 was slow as the counter only has 1 staff to attend to guests during the Sunday check-in. There was no staggered check-in recommended to the guest as well prior to check-in. Staff was friendly. Nice that staff offered drinks for guests queuing to check-in. Room was spacious but there was an unpleasant odor in the bathroom. Found a stained mug in the room but since there were two, I used the cleaner one. The bathtub had bits of plastic wrapper in it, hence didn't use the tub. Loved the minibar with complimentary drinks. The club lounge indoor area are perpetually full even if you make a reservation for it. Hence, enjoyed the evening cocktail and canapes by the poolside but it was too windy at certain point in time. Did not enjoy the western breakfast at the lounge as the bread and sausage were too hard. Scrambled egg was nice. It was self-service for coffee at the coffee machine, so there was quite a queue for that. The hotel is very near Tanjong Pagar Market/Food Centre and plenty of food options there.

Title: Exceptional

Hotel Name: Oasia Hotel Downtown Singapore by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 100 Peck Seah Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 079333
NandA: Oasia Hotel Downtown Singapore by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified) ;100 Peck Seah Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 079333
Title: Amazing Hospitality
Review: Is like a home away from home! First met with Juswanti (I think thats how her name is spelled, sorry if I am wrong) at the reception of the club‚Äôs lounge. And it was a very smooth check in. She gave a lot of details to how I can enjoy my stay. And with the seating slots for breakfast and happy hours. And she even help with booking for swimming and gym facilities! Best is she is nice enough to help me with storing of a cake for my friend! Saw her the next few days during breakfast! What I love about her, is her smiley eyes! She speak with so much experience/passion of her job! Really love my stay due to her as well! Stayed for 2 nights. So for breakfast at the lounge, was served by CY, Jiale and Alvies. They were amazing! They accommodate to all my request and even though I was very specific with my orders and quite troublesome! As I know what I want and enjoy. But they did it with a smile (I suppose as they all are wearing mask!) and they speak with very good profession! Despite some delay at the second day breakfast! But everything was great! And my friend is happy with everything as well! Thanks you for such an amazing job! Only downside, is their Asian delight breakfast. The plain porridge was really tasteless. And there should not be any expectations towards that selection at all. And was weird that Mocha was only served after breakfast. As my friend wanted Mocha for breakfast as it was good, but not available during breakfast. Next downside was, I was celebrating my friend birthday. And I was promise a card/cupcake from my request. However it wasnt there for any of the days we stayed. So sad. We truly enjoyed our stay! And would definitely go back there again! As the staffs were great! And the surrounding, has loads of good food as well!

Title: Above average
Review: Went on a staycay with my best friend for her birthday but was abit disappointed with the service received. The room itself is fine cus we booked a club room for their bathtub but if u were thinking to stay at their normal room you can forget it cus its not worth the money. U can get cheaper rates for nicer hotels. The location wise is good but u can also get nicer hotels ard there. Received an email prior to our stay from the property for our needs, replied them what we kinda expected but no action taken from them. Not that we expected something out of someone‚Äôs birthday but they didnt even go the extra mile. But whatever, that aside. We kinda get the ‚Äúwe dont like kids‚Äù vibe there cus we have 2 toddlers and their reason for giving us that look or treatment is cus of ‚Äúexclusivity‚Äù. I mean like i dont mind not getting to their club lounge cus we dont drink but pool seriously? I mean that‚Äôs what we are looking forward to. we went there on freaking weekdays and while we were there the pool were always empty so i dont see why they cant put their ‚Äúexclusivity‚Äù aside for an hr or two cus its someone‚Äôs birthday or maybe make someone‚Äôs day or something idk? Then their rooftop pool is dirty with dried leaves i think they dont bother clearing unlike their infinity pool which we saw them cleaning on that night. Then upon check out, we actually req a late check out on arrival but we receive a call like some miscom they should have like input in the system or something but ya. Also their lifts check in check out reception is all over the place so inconvenient. Thats all. Overall is 1)not kid friendly 2)not valued for money ok thanks for reading. Def not coming back again.

Hotel Name: Oasia Hotel Downtown Singapore by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 100 Peck Seah Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 079333
NandA: Oasia Hotel Downtown Singapore by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified) ;100 Peck Seah Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 079333
Title: Great crew of friendly and helpful front-facing staff, let down by minor problems that quickly piled up
Review: What redeemed my 1-night staycation with my fiance at the hotel was the staff. Friendly, courteous and very helpful. Upon arrival, we wanted to deposit our bags before checking in, so that we could go grab a bite; the staff attending to us at the door immediately made us feel welcome, taking over our bags promptly. We also enjoyed Happy Hour and breakfast at the Club Room. To the gent that helped me check on the coffee machine in the room, I am sorry I am an idiot and thought it was faulty when I didn't turn it on properly, and thank you so much for your patience! However, I cannot honestly recommend this hotel to anyone without addressing some of the little things that contributed to our (eventual) annoyance. My fiance and I felt that the cleanliness and facilities is lacking. After checking in, we went to our room, but had to wait for about half an hour before our bags were sent to us. We get that it may be a busy time for the staff, so we could understand, but that window of time made us snoop around to kill time, and we found that the room wasn't as clean as we liked it to be. There were mug water marks and coffee stains on the coffee table, bits of black stuff (plastic?) on the TV console, and the bathtub felt quite grimy. These are small issues that I could take care of quite quickly, but it just feels like more care could have gone into housekeeping. But the parapet outside the floor-to-ceiling glass window- man, they were filthy. Bits of dried leaf and caked dust I understand, but it is strewn with cigarette butts, presumably from higher floors than the one we were staying at. The sight of it is quite horrible- the curtains stayed drawn for the entire time we were there. Then, on facilities- we both felt that in this day and age, at least let us have a ready HDMI port access to the nice TV in the room. We'd much prefer to stream media from our own laptops, but we found that the port is not that easily accessible. If there is an additional HDMI port on

Title: Hotel with good location

Initially room was masked with air freshener, that means the hotel staff knew about the smoking too so why still assigned to paying customers. No doubt they had changed the room for us and arranged for late check out without us asking as damaged control. WiFi signal is poor too. Room condition is rather poor despite its not even 5 years old....

Title: Nice a new years holiday
Review: We book the deluxe room with club facility. It was a nice and beautiful hotel. The staff are nice and friendly. With the club facility, we have opportunities to have a higher floor room (from 22nd - 26th floor, we were in 24th fl.), daily laundry (1 per person), complimentary drinks (the coconut water is our fave) and the private swimming pool (really quiet) and breakfast at 21st floor. We do not drink alcohol, but if you do, you have opportunity to have alcohol free from 6-8pm. If not, free juice can be served while swimming from 10am-10pm. The hotel is beautiful because have ecological concept with vegetal mural around the building. MRT is in front the hotel (St. Tanjong Pagar), and bus 145 at behind the hotel (in front Tj Pagar Plaza) can take you until China Town, Clar‚Äô Quay and Bugis. We definitely will stay in this hotel when we go to Singapore next time.

Title: The staff who did registration for us is impolite
Review: Our flight was cancelled due to Hong Kong air port closed. I asked him weather he could find our booking when passed our passports to him. As guessed, he could not find our booking. So I told him I booked the rooms through agoda and asked if he needed confirmation no.. He requested me to send the confirmation email to him. Ok I sent. All his reply was ‚Äú u should tell me early, u are wasting me time to check!‚Äù with an impolite tune. Wow, to register guess by this sentence I was so surprised. I think staff as him is well paid for his job unless he is a volunteer to help us do the registration. I had no more energy to reply him in this manner as I used up all my energy for my cancelled flight. So I don‚Äôt argue with his attitude. I only hope the staff to be well trained. Other staffs are very nice to guests.

Title: Excellent stay
Review: My wife and I enjoyed the stay at theClub Room. The staff were courteous and friendly, giving us a pleasant experience at Oasia downtown, the food was good and room was clean! Definitely worth it to experience for yourself. Despite being in Singapore, we felt the environment was truly tranquil with nice music at the club level and a really quiet getaway which we both loved! The staff really made us feel like treasured guests and we were really surprised at the whole experience which was above what we expected. Although the infinity pool was a little small and a pity we did not get to see the full view due to plants being in the way but overall we were blown away by our stay here! Will definitely be back again if opportunity permits in the future! Will recommend the Club room for couples looking to getaway from the busy-ness and hectic ness of life!

Hotel Name: Oasia Hotel Downtown Singapore by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 100 Peck Seah Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 079333
NandA: Oasia Hotel Downtown Singapore by Far East Hospitality (SG Clean Certified) ;100 Peck Seah Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 079333
Title: Very good
Review: Booked the room to hijack my friend's staycation. It was a secret mission for his proposal, so we wrote in and liaise with them. First, I wrote to their client experience department and liaise the plan with them. They are helpful, giving feedback to ensure the plan can be execute within their manpower. On that day itself, when i met their onground manager, and discuss the plan with them, they pointed out due to their system, the plan cant work. But he's extremely helpful. On the spot, we brainstorm on what's workable. Its required the onground staff for some help, which he doesnt mind helping. As the proposal will only happen at midnight, he stayed after his working hours to ensure everything happen smoothly. He waited for at least 3 hours, which i deeply appreciate his efforts and commitment. The room is clean and with nice view. But i'm more impress with their service quality, it definitely makes a huge difference.

Title: Good service staff BUT.....
Review: This hotel has excellent service staff. From the time you check-in , to the time you check-out, you are always close to someone who prepares to give you an extra hand with a smile. The hotel facilities are, however, a little dated. The rubber trims for shower doors are worn leading to leakage of water to the basin area when you shower. The mattresses are a tad too soft, probably the springs are over-used, that cause our back to ache in the morning. The cane-look chairs in the balcony have many broken plastic strips which are dangerous if you brush any part of your clothe or skin across it. The lamps and head rest board are beautiful but hard to maintain. You can see there are cobwebs on it. The hotel needs to be refurbished before it can be a 5/6 starts again!

Title: A good staycation
Review: We stayed at the AWAY Room at W after spending the previous week at Capella's Garden Villa. Was mentally prepared for a "downgraded" experience but was ultimately pleasantly surprised. Should really have gone for the AWAY or WOW Suite but could not justify the prices that were double that of a Garden Villa at Capella - did not make any sense. Figured out why when I was there - they only had 1 AWAY and 2 WOW Suites - talking about extreme scarcity which undoubtedly drove up the price. The AWAY Room plunge pool was a tad too shallow - I would have preferred a deeper pool (like the one at Capella). However, given the hotel's location, there was a lot more variety in terms of dining options compared to Capella. Service was better than I recall (this is our 8th stay at W Singapore). Although there were no activities for the kids (unlike Capella), we managed to occupy ourselves mainly with a deck of Monopoly Deal, which has become a favourite past-time for the family since we came home.

Title: Not as spectacular as expected
Review: 1. Great breakfast to start the day! In room dining has very good and quality food selection. 2. Room deco is outdated, furnitures are run down, dusty and poor upkeeping of room and washroom/basin. 3. Pool is big but hotel doesn‚Äôt offer free floating devices for use anymore but uses current covid situation to earn quick buck by selling them at above market price. 4. Smoking corner is right next to the staircases leading down to the entrance of the pool. Sometimes more than 2-3 smokers could be smoking there at the same time and will have to tolerate the second hand smoke when passing the entrance to the pool. Feedback to hotel but we are told there is nothing they can do. 5. Check in / check out time took unusually Long. Staffs are inexperienced in handling queries. 6. Beds and pillows are not as comfortable as it should be. Can hard sleep as pillows are high and hard. Eventually we all slept without the pillows. 7. For the price offer, service standard and overall rating of W Singapore is certainly below par.

Title: A good stay but it could have been much better if there were privacy with the plunge pool
Review: My wife and I stayed in the Away guest room for one night. In addition to the bedroom and a study area, the room is elaborately designed with a private plunge pool, a bathtub, and separate shower and toilet areas. While the plunge pool is marketed as private, there is actually no privacy with the plunge pool (guests at the upper floors can see, and guests at neighboring rooms can hear). While we were there, the shower unit attached to the bathtub, and the rain shower of the shower unit were not working. While the room is meant for two guests, there is only one chair in the study area, and one in the bedroom. There is a loveseat in the plunge pool area, but it is too long for seating and too short of lying. Despite the above, we had a good stay but it could have been much better if there were privacy with the plunge pool!

Title: Away plunge pool room

Huge bath tub with in built tv in the toilet! 4 moods lightings to choose from. And the outdoor deck with plunge pool at 0.9m with jacuzzi is definitely a plus point! However as its on ground level, don't expect the view. W staffs that we came across are all friendly, serving with sincerity. Check in took quite some time but there's expr3ss checkout. The swimming pool is humongous with slides and wading pool for the kids. And its 24hrs! The pool is 0.9m throughout by the way. Complimentary parking given as well. For location wise, there's a quayside Isle nearby for dining but not much though. Nice place for a stroll during sunset and photo taking. There's a free shuttle to sentosa cove as well. Overall, the room was awesome. The W staffs are great as well. Highly recommended!

Title: Relaxing, fun staycation. Excellent staff service
Review: One of the most accommodating to customer's request hotel I've been to. eg. provided a cake for birthday/anniversary, provided kids amenities, provided ample pillows, towels, bath foam etc. You name it, you request for it, and you get it within 10mins! Very fast, very efficient. Friendly receptionist welcome desk staff Cedrick & Yin Ton. Generous with carpark coupons (for guests), and the unlimited FREE ICECREAM to kids is a very PLUS POINT for families to return. It'll be nicer if ice cream can be available from morning to evening, instead of just confining to 4pm-6pm period. Nonetheless, the staff were very nice and accommodating to offer the ice cream as early as 3pm, or 630pm. At least the kids are not disappointed. Swimming pool SLIDE is a HIT!, and the spa! Wow....it's a very good relaxing spa, combined with a 24hrs well equipped Gym just opposite the spa. And the Business area with free coffiee/tea, chest and kids DVDs, but Lacking kids TOYS in there though.

Title: Not worth the price
Review: Stayed here for 1 night for an anniversary staycation with my 2yr-old and hubby. PROS: 1. they arranged a suprise for our anniv celebration, including balloons and cake. 2. The room is spacious. 3. The pool is heated and the spa facilities are good. CONS: 1. the Whenever Wherever reception takes a loooong time to answer their calls (even at 10pm!). 2. Before leaving for dinner at 7pm, i informed the frontdesk that I would like our bathroom to be cleaned (baby made a mess). When we returned to our room at 10pm, it was not cleaned at all!! Had to wait for housekeeping to come and clean it before we could bathe and sleep üòí very appalling for a 5* hotel. 3. Breakfast was so-so. All in all, for the S$600 i paid, i would have had a better stay in other 5* hotels in Singapore.

Hotel Name: PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering, Singapore (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 3 Upper Pickering Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 058289
NandA: PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering, Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;3 Upper Pickering Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 058289
Title: Excellent Staycation Destination
Review: We are very impressed and happy with the level of hospitality rendered by the reception counter. I went down to the hotel a few days earlier and requested for early check-in. The request was granted and made known only after I make a call in the morning to follow up. If the confirmation was received earlier, we would have been able to check-in much earlier to enjoy the great and beautifully designed facilities provided. Upon arrival, the check-in was smooth and pleasant. It was very thoughtful of the hotel to provide a kind care-kit for every guests. The room is very tidy and clean. It also has a view of the sky garden, though the plants do block much of the city view. But nevertheless, it felt like being in a jungle in the middle of the urban sprawl. We are very happy that they managed to arrange for the room with bathtub as we understand that not all the room type that we reserved comes with bath tub. We finally managed to have a great soak to relax my mind. We also managed to book the use of the gym and swimming pool much earlier. The only comment is that the pool water is frigid cold. We wished they would add some hot water into the pool. Aside from that, we also noticed the pavilion base were rusting very badly. Perhaps a good time to refurbish the pool to include a water heater perhaps. The gym is very spacious and comfortable to work out too. And the Lime Restaurant food is amazing. And it is very reasonably priced too considering the 30% off complimentary for stay-in guests. Overall, We had a very nice and relaxing stay and wished for it to have lasted longer. Thank you and kudos to the amazing team of staffs at Parkroyal Collection Pickering.

Title: Great location, spacious room
Review: We are a group of family travellers with elderly. The hotel has ramps suitable for wheelchair movement and is located near Chinatown for eldery who enjoys to shop and dine at Chinatown. The urban room is also spacious and does not feel claustrophobic. The bed is also super comfy and view from the window is towards CBD, far east square area which has rows of low rise shophouses. Love that the basin is located separately from the toilet so that one can still use the basin when the other is using the toilet. However the shower area is separated by glass and hence is inconvenient for the other party to use the toilet when one is showering. Overall, am still pleased with the stay and highly recommend for a staycation.

Title: Bad Experience Hotel Stay ever !
Review: Stayed here for one night on Jan 21. Reached there about 3pm plus but only managed to check in on 4:45pm. Standing in the line for more than one hour. In fact, just about 6 or 7 people in front of us waiting in the line. Checked with one of the staff , reason given was too many people check in at the same time. Felt ridiculous with the reason given as the hotel only allowed to check in at 3pm onwards. Facilities like Swimming pool or gym need to book in advance which has not been informed during check in earlier. End up only stay inside room for whole night. The breakfast selection in the menu was so pathetic & the serving was so little. No doubt you are allow to repeat order but the taste was bland . Mcd breakfast is much much delicious! Cannot imagine how could this hotel in 5 stars rating! I would not recommend to stay in this hotel.

Title: Beautiful architecture and views!
Review: We enjoyed our stay immensely! From the comfortable beds and stunning views from our room , to the lovely pool and gazebos (unfortunately the weather was not as cooperative), to the relaxed vibe the whole place gave. It made for a very relaxing and enjoyable getaway for mother and daughter! The pool time limit is 1.5 hr once daily, which was a bit short to be honest. But also meant the pool was quite quiet most of the time. The ala carte buffet breakfast was decent. Appreciated the waitstaff who now had to carry dozens of plates around to the guests. The 1.5h dining time was also a little short but a necessity now to ensure everyone gets fed. The hotel's location was superb - short walk to the riverfront, lots of good food and malls, public transport etc. Would definitely stay there another time as and when the opportunity arises!

Title: Stunning Award winning Organic architecture
Review: This building won many awards for its one of a kind design by a local firm and it has been a real treat to stay here. We were very grateful to have been allotted a room with a good view of the gardens and enjoyed exploring every facet of the building. Next to it is one of the best Hawker centres in Singapore so you get a taste of what it‚Äôs like to enjoy the cosmopolitan cuisine that defines the island‚Äôs culinary heritage. The very act of dining in such an establishment has been elevated to a UNESCO heritage worthy activity! A modern mall with some of the best restaurants is also just across the street. Chinatown for those interested is just a hop, skip and jump across a major road. The infamous Hyde Park of Singapore named Hong Lim where locals can vent their frustrations and protest without a license is surrounded with CCTV. This Island is Disneyland with the death penalty... perhaps that‚Äôs also why it‚Äôs safe to walk the streets in the middle of the night in this police state. Too bad the restaurant‚Äôs food is sub par. The high tea was deplorable with bad jams and sad clotted cream accompanying disappointing scones. The selection of savoury and sweets was also very much a hit and miss affair which for the price you are paying is just obscene. you deserve much much better. The hall of the restaurant is cavernous and tastefully decorated but the limited tea selection is a local copy of the famed Mariage Fr√®res. Decent but still a cheap copy. Try the many others available in a real 5 star establishment around. Bed is among the largest we have seen and sleeps 3 very comfortably. For those with children or an extra adult, it is guaranteed for a good night‚Äôs sleep. The pool unfortunately was positively filthy and this is with limited number of people using it due to COVID. I expected higher standards of cleanliness. The toilets had no soap!!! The dispensers were hidden in a cabinet below the sink! Now that is cheap... despite these misses. Title: Room was great, breakfast/staff were not
Review: Room was pleasant. Staff arranged a cake for our anniversary. Everything in the room was great, except that i saw about 3-4 strands of hair on a new towel. Very limited choices for breakfast given the price we paid. One of the waitress auntie was pretty rude (the lady who bunned up her hair, serving tables near to the food counters). When we wanted to pass her our order form, she shouted at us and asked us to wait? Also, i saw that she threw new plates on the tables while cleaning the tables during preparations. I even sighted from a distance that she dropped one of the cutleries on the floor, AND SHE PUT IT BACK ON THE TABLE FOR THE NEXT GUEST TO USE YUCKS. No replacement nor wiping it clean. So we avoided her at all costs. When i requested for a cup of tea refill from the manager, he signalled to that auntie again and she served us. She acknowledged but carried on working on her cleaning and replacing new tablewares and seems to have no intention to serve us. We waited for a while before she unwillingly asked me what i wanted, before pouring the hot tea in a gushing manner into my cup. Totally ruined my morning. If Lime restaurant is understaffed, please hire more people. Perhaps that waitress auntie was just tired.. but being in the service line + working under such prestigious hotel, i dont think she can be given an excuse to have an attitude like this!

Title: Could be better...
Review: Excellent location and it‚Äôs very accessible to town via mrt. Liked the hotel for its cleanliness and view. But One thing lacking is the attentiveness of the staff. No one told us that the timing for breakfast was different for weekdays and weekends. We were only asked to choose a time slot and we went for breakfast at 1020 hrs on Monday at a 1000-1100 slot. Waited for almost 15 mins at the counter but no one tended to us even when clearly there were staff who saw us. No one told us that the last order was 1015 hrs? Or was it that the kitchen was closed at 45 mins earlier than the stipulated 1100 hrs? If the hotel staff were more attentive , the experience would have been 10/10. But because of this, I‚Äôm afraid I‚Äôd have to downgrade the rating to 6/10.

Address: 3 Upper Pickering Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 058289
NandA: PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering, Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;3 Upper Pickering Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 058289
Title: Spacious rooms, friendly staff
Review: The room was great, enough space to walk around and work without feeling so enclosed. Bed was super comfy but the pillows were a bit lumpy. Only thing is, I was on hold for more than 30 minutes just trying to reach reception. And this is the first hotel that I've ever been to that wanted to charge me for borrowing cutlery ($5++ per cutlery) We had bought cake for our anniversary and had to just use hands to eat it because I'm not paying for cutlery rental that other hotels kindly provide for free. Didn't get to use the pool as I was not informed that I have to book for a slot. Even when the pool is empty (we can see from the room), even just for 5 minutes and willing to go as soon as people come in, but still no. I understand social distancing but who am I distancing when there wasn't anyone in the pool? What a waste. Book a pool slot as early as they allow for lesser disappointment. Staff were very friendly and breakfast was good. Would only book again if I need a good room to work. Other than that, other hotels have more flexibility hence more worth the price.

Hotel Name: PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering, Singapore (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 3 Upper Pickering Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 058289
NandA: PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering, Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;3 Upper Pickering Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 058289
Title: Would we return? Maybe once in a long while...
Review: Booked the Lifestyle room for a staycation to celebrate a special occasion with my partner. The hotel exterior and interior looks fab as an urban jungle, but customer service and facilities can be better. Issue with slot booking for usage of swimming pool: - Before the stay: Was informed by the hotel that reservations for usage of the pool was required during this period for safe distancing measures and they asked me for my preferred time slot 2 days prior to my stay. I replied within 8 minutes and was shocked to be informed the next day that all slots were taken up, leaving me with time slots that were either before my check-in time (3pm), too early for me to swim (6-7am or 7-8am) or after my check-out time (12pm). Called in to clarify and was told that I could only use the pool facilities as a staying guest, meaning I was only left with early morning slots which I didn‚Äôt wanted... Eventually they managed to make arrangement and booked a slot for me at 3pm on my check-in day and 7am on my check-out day. - During my stay: During checking in, I double checked with the counter for my pool slots and to my shock, they weren‚Äôt able to find my 7am booking for the next day but that‚Äôs ok. We headed to the pool immediately after checking in (luckily we reached earlier for check in - the queue for checking in is damn long and we managed to get to the pool by 3pm), they stopped us from entering the pool premises as other patrons were still using the pool. We were informed that the patrons inside were from the previous time slot and while it‚Äôs past their allocated time for usage of the pool, they continued frolicking in the pool as no one was there to control and facilitate the crowd as the next wave of patrons arrive and waited outside for their turn to enjoy their time at the pool. Sanitary needs much more improvement: - New pool towels reeked of sweat smell, super off-putting as the stench was so bad - No sanitizing of pool facilities like the sun loungers and benches in

Hotel Name: PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering, Singapore (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 3 Upper Pickering Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 058289
NandA: PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering, Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;3 Upper Pickering Street, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 058289
Title: Long waiting time to check-in
Review: After room was booked, i asked if there were staggered time for check in due to covid, and the answer was yes and that an email will be sent to me when the date is nearing. Also need to book time slots for the pool which i did for 2 days: 4-6pm, 9-11am and they confirmed my slots. A day before my check in, i emailed them as there is no email from them regarding the staggered time and they didnt reply so i called directly to the hotel‚Äôs reservation line and the staff told me to check in after 3pm. So i went at 3pm and shocked to see the long queue to check in and i queued 1hr to get my room and guess what, the staff said no pool slots were made under my name and that pool was fully booked for both days and asked me to try my luck by going down to the pool to see if theres any no-shows. Ridiculous. So i texted agoda in the chat as i was really disappointed and agoda replied saying there is a slot booked under my name for the 2nd day. So before i go for my dinner i decided to stop by the pool and check the list. MY NAME IS ON THE LIST FOR BOTH DAYS. So i guess it wasnt agoda‚Äôs fault but the hotel itself becos the hotel staff told me as i requested it on agoda, they cannot trace back who did the reservation for me. The hotel staffs‚Äô service was overall quite pleasant, their attitude and all is good. But the whole system is just so wrong? I dialed for housekeeping using their room phone and i was put on hold music for close to 10mins like as if im calling a customer service hotline which was strange as i‚Äôve stayed at so many hotels before i didnt experience this before. The buffet at lime restaurant wasnt fantastic too. Food came warm not hot which feels like they just left the food on the counter waiting for guests to order and the service staff to collect it and serve it. They changed it to alacarte buffet so i thought food should be served hot? But okay, at least the room is decent. Clean, spacious, awesome blinds.

Title: Good
Review: No more buffet. They gave menu n will serve it to u. We need to book for breakfast slots and its 1hr. The drinks came in after 45mins. Called for the staff to ask bt some looked away pretending not to see n some just show a wait hand sign. If u try calling the service line for in room dining or queries, be prepared for long wait, or keep trying cos no one answers. Queried a ques in the morning,staff say will call back once check. I waited till night no one got back. When i called back after many attempts, staff said they forget as she was bz answering alot of incoming calls. I took the junior suite and im not exagerating but when i checked in the pillow case smelled like sweat. I didnt say anything till my son pointed it out as well asking why was there a stench on the pillow. Ask for the rm to be made, no one came and 8hrs. Had to call again(another few tries)

Title: Magically out of reality experience, a real get away
Review: The ocean view is just wonderful, magical almost. Managed to surprise my partner when the blinds were drawn up. The Management is sweet enough to do up a pair of love swans towels, accompanied with some rose petals laid out in a heart shape for our anniversary, and provided some free gifts as well to welcome us. The Butler, Gurvin is professional, nice and friendly. He volunteered to carry our luggages and introduce us to the 2 level suite. The butler service are generally great, but could take awhile to respond at nighttime (think they have knocked off), and sometimes the person turning up might be different. Kevin is nice enough to offer us some b&j ice creams at our doorstep upon knowing that my guests had arrived. The only downside might be the maximum capacity allowed is 5, including you and your other half, leaving you to only be able to invite 3 more guests for a 2 storey suite. If only they would increase it to 8 max capacity including the hosts. And yes, they are very strict about it. Love the pool, it‚Äôs huge, and not that crowded. You could totally let your hair down and enjoy the loving moments with your partner. You could also get the butler to help you book a swimming time slot there. Buggy ride would also be offered when you wish to travel around RWS, just give the butler a ring. My guests and my partner really enjoyed chilling out at the outdoor jacuzzi. There is an indoor jacuzzi as well, which is directly under the ocean view. My partner and I can‚Äôt get enough of it, we were constantly being drawn in by the wonderful marine animals, swimming freely and some playfully, in the tank, while we enjoy our jacuzzi. I would recommend this suite if you want a true get away, trust me, I could stay in the room and watch the fishes, stingrays, manta rays and sharks etc swimming. At times some stingrays would take a ‚Äúpeek‚Äù at you and slide off the partition. Really adorable. The staff are professional and respectful to people from all community, reg

Title: Unlikely to return
Review: We are a couple with a young child and was given the middle suite - 908 - which the hotel claimed has the best view (being in the middle) and was a room specially designed by a Japanese designer. The room had black walls and mirrors, animal print sofas, tacky looking chandeliers...not really the kind of place for a family with young kids. There is also very little furniture for us to put our belongings on. It's more like a honeymoon suite (if you fancy dark walls / minimal lighting). Fittings and furniture were also worn and dated... the experience was not luxurious at all. You are basically paying for the aquarium view, do not expect the rest of your experience to be premium.

Title: 5 Star All Around if you can afford the cost.
Review: OceanSuites at Resort World Sentosa definitely provided us with an experience for a lifetime. Room amenities are top notch, toilets are clean, beds are comfortable and the rooms are much larger then they appear to be in the photographs, definitely fulfilled all expectations but at a hefty price. The view of the S.E.A Aquarium from your room is probably the best experience for marine enthusiasts and kids. Complementary Parking as well as the car park lots are located just outside the line of suites. Overall an outstanding and lavish place to stay with a memorable view only at a hefty cost.

Hefty sum to pay per night but it is worth it to do so even if it would be only once in a very long while. My kids love it and so did my spouse and I. Dining facilities in Resorts World was very accessible because of the free bus shuttle services. I would recommend this experience.

Title: Proposal at Ocean Suites RWS
Review: Hi I am writing to extend my compliments to the staffs at RWS and I want to shout out to our Butler Mr Willy for leaving us with unforgettable memories for this special occasion. Upon check in Mr Willy approach me to help me with my many luggage. As I'm planning a proposal I brought many decorations , I got a giant bouquet of sunflowers, macaroons were delivered earlier then my arrival. RWS handles my collections and deliver the items to my requested room swiftly. As compare to other hotel in my experience I got rejection from the reception to accept the delivery as I have not check in and the poor delivery guy have to wait until all is sort out then he can carry on with his deliveries. Once Mr Willy buggy me to my room, I was brought to a room tour by him. He showed me around and is very informative. He told me that if I need a buggy ride I could call this number. I felt very luxurious and well taken care off. He even took care of our breakfast , queries, picking up my guest from lobby to our room. Thank you for being part of my important day. You really can't complain trust me . As its a stay for a couple I feel everything really meets and even exceed our expectations. If I must find fault it will be the closure of forest restaurant and thats it. We feel very pampered. In a romantic place like sentosa In a romantic under water room She said yes. Thank you rws for being with me through my important occasion. After this I need to check out and check in to equarius hotel. I found out that they actually notice my reservation and have set a room with perfect view up for me. So there's no hassle to check in for me , I just collect my new room key and set off excitedly to equarius. Im leaving a review in equarius separately. Thank you RWS. Constantly following up with me checking out if there's anything you can help. Keeping me updated and setting aside that specially assigned room for me.

Title: Not worth it at this pandemic times
Review: Booked a Suite for 1 night to celebrate my wifes birthday. It was expensive, but the rigidity of the staff to not allow guests beyond 8pm. Reason: Covid. . Okay, can you decorate the room a bit? No. Reason: Covid. Ok, I made booking for 2 guests but can I add two more quests since the room is big enough for 5. No. Reason: you made booking for 2, cannot add. Ok, is there room service? No. Reason: Covid. (Ok, valid. Acceptable). Can we check out late? no. Reason: Covid. It was just a short one night stay to celebrate my wifes birthday. It was pricey for the ocean suite, but its not worth it if you need to book a time for swimming, you dont get room service, you cant let guests stay longer, you cant add guests, most of the restaurants were closed. So I am guessing things are awesome when everything is okay but for this pandemic time, during this low guest volume, and enhanced safety measures, the price is certainly not worth what is shown.

Title: Complete Rip Off
Review: There is no in room dining at Equarius. None. You cannot even order a bottle of water. The alternative is the food street by Universal with a number that doesn't work or (I kid you not) Deliveroo). Despite Covid, no other hotel has this as a policy and for $1000 per night, it is appalling. We suffered broken air conditioning as well as a broken refrigerator. The hotel breakfast was woeful. 3 tray options. Like dining on an airplane to remember the glory days of travel. The staff who were there tried their best but there seemed only 2 people for the entire hotel. That Genting can get away with charging these prices without at the VERY LEAST informing guests about their policies is daylight robbery. Never again.

Title: A One-time Experience
Review: I booked the ocean suite to celebrate my husband's birthday. Booked via Agoda for an attractive rate. I requested for a simple deco, pre check in via phone and for Room 0907 or 0908. Staff called me about 3 weeks before our stay and acknowledge all of my requests. She did a pre check in by asking for our particulars via the phone. You have to still go to Equarius Hotel reception to verify the check in, credit card holding charge and to get a buggy to bring you to the room itself. There were not many guests therefore our check in process was speedy. Durai, our butler showed us the room as well as the room facilities, amenities, how to operate the indoor/outdoor jacuzzi and storage areas. Buggies are available 24 hours so you can visit anywhere within Sentosa. I requested for Durai's name card to call when I need a buggy to return back to the room so do request for the number! Great and sufficient toiletries & amenities. coffee/tea making avail. Amazing View!

Title: Solo birthday staycation
Review: I chose this location because I wanted to host several groups of friends to celebrate my birthday. I am so glad I booked this place. My guests and I had an amazing experience, and most told me it was truly unforgettable. Of course, the star of the stay was the aquarium view. I floated to sleep watching schools of fish swam past my window. I was half expecting that I wouldn‚Äôt see much after the aquarium lights went out at 10.30pm, but the view of the aquatic animals was still very much visible. Soaking in a bathtub in front of the window was a real dreamy experience. I couldn‚Äôt thank the butlers enough for their wonderful service throughout my stay. They were prompt with their service, even when I made requests at 11+pm. They were always polite. The butlers I talked to were truly passionate about their jobs, as evident from my brief conversations with them. I am also touched by the little gestures. I was so relieved to find the anti-mosquito supplies so that I could use them when I‚Äôm outside the room (eg at the outdoor jacuzzi pool). I also love the ample amount of hidden storage, so that I could stow away my luggage without compromising the roominess of the space. Adore this place, and I would definitely consider this venue for my future escapades.

Title: Just go once in-a-lifetime-experience
Review: Room: Great size, suitable for party or family. Outdoor pool was a nice touch, with privacy. Could look up at cable cars going above us. Amenities were amazing! Not sure if its because we won't be able to see as well or to protect the marine life from harsh lighting. Overall great experience, but once is more than enough!

Hotel Name: Resorts World Sentosa - Beach Villas (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 8 Sentosa Gateway, Resorts World, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098269
NandA: Resorts World Sentosa - Beach Villas (SG Clean Certified) ;8 Sentosa Gateway, Resorts World, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098269
Title: For that window to the aquarium, you have to put up with poor services, rude bellman and bad food
Review: We travelled with our 3 year old. We arrived the hotel around 1pm and nicely asked the front desk to let us check in earlier if possible. After waiting for 2+ hours and several follow ups, the answer is still NO. There are 11 Ocean Suites and how hard it is to have a room ready just a bit earlier? Our three years old got tired and even a few mosquito bites during waiting. The front desk clerk still looked indifferent and not trying to help until I asked to talk to the manager. We finally got into our room by 2:45pm. For this price, I believe I deserve a better, warmer and more helpful service. Any in and out of Ocean Villa needs butler service. Don‚Äôt even compare their butler service to any other resorts with butler service. In room dining menu is very small. Food is far from tasty. I would rather eat McDonald. Bellmen are rude and functioning as if they are rushing prinsoners to their cells. The only valuable part of this place is the window to the aquarium.

Hotel Name: Resorts World Sentosa - Beach Villas (SG Clean Certified)
Address: 8 Sentosa Gateway, Resorts World, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098269
NandA: Resorts World Sentosa - Beach Villas (SG Clean Certified) ;8 Sentosa Gateway, Resorts World, Sentosa, Singapore, Singapore, 098269
Title: If you only wanted the view..
Review: Mentioned that we would be checking in after our ROM (marriage registry ceremony) and even came in my gown but staff did not offer any congratulations, which I would have expected from a hotel of such rating. Confusing directions to the lobby. We drove to the entrance of the suite, which is at basement carpark level, but there were nobody to help us. There isn‚Äôt a guard or anybody to point us in the right direction. Turns out the hotel lobby is at the other side, on ground level, sharing the same lobby as Equarius hotel. There were some miscommunication as well. We did not need a buggy ride to the suite entrance as we had drove over to Equarius hotel, but we DO need an introduction to the room. Saw some burners in the room but no candles or matches, not sure if the staff is supposed to have set up the place. Need to request. Couldn‚Äôt find the bathtub as well (hidden under the floorboards). Thus, we could definitely do with a room introduction. The pro is the spectacular view of the aquarium. I could just lay all day in the room watching the fishes swim by. But we feel that the service is not worth the amount we paid. If you are looking for a night to remember the most important day of your lives with, there are other hotels which can do better. Some went over the top for just wedding anniversaries. We got, instead, confusions and passive service for our wedding day, albeit the awesome room view.

Hotel Name: Resorts World Sentosa - Beach Villas (SG Clean Certified)

One thing to note is to select your villas diligently as some villas are of easy access to inconsiderate and illiterate hotel guests who end up using the private jacuzzi and outdoor lounge chairs, despite the signs about them being exclusive to the villa.

Probably the best equipped gym of all hotels I have stayed at. The only thing I could suggest on improving would be the pool area. It is quite dark and not that welcoming. Address: 7 Raffles Avenue, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 039799
NandA: The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore ;7 Raffles Avenue, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 039799
Title: Above and Beyond Service. THANK YOU!
Review: We have to admit that each time we return for our anniversary celebration, Ritz Carlton has always up their game, never ceasing to amaze us with the warmest of welcome and the most heartfelt sincerity to take care of all their guests. We certainly are very touched to tears at the Ritz Carlton team's effort and sincerity. Initially we were caught off guard by an unexpected renovation which disrupted wedding anniversary celebration and long awaited break from the daily grind of new life as parents. But the team responded very quickly to save the day. I especially thank the MoD Naki San, who immediately offered an alternative room away from the noise and because this was a very special date for us, he upgraded our room and offered us complimentary breakfast as well. A big shout-out to Aunty Lee Lee at the Colony for treating us like her family and taking great care of us. We look forward to returning!

NandA: The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore ;7 Raffles Avenue, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 039799
Title: Flawless hotel with some very minor e-flaws
Review: Our stay at the Ritz was 99% awesome. The room, view, amenities and staff were absolutely amazing. However the in-room electronics ‚Äúseem‚Äù to be modern additions but didn‚Äôt work. The qi wireless charging clock ended up draining my phone from repeatedly dropping charge every 3 seconds on loop. This was an inconvenience to find out as we were leaving for dinner with an empty charge. And looking up instructions or compatibility issues online didn‚Äôt help the connection whatever I did. We brought our own wireless charger which worked later that night. It could be Apple being dicks blocking other brand‚Äôs standard qi from working but the XS max works on any other wireless chargers qi or not, so the clock should be checked. The reading lights above the bed also did not work as the LED was dead. Again minor inconvenience when we wanted to read in bed. Everything else worked wonderfully except for these two issues. It won‚Äôt deter us from returning but I hope the Ritz will correct them to meet the usual great standard. Thanks!

Title: Standard drop
Review: 3rd times staying in Ritz Carlton. The standard and service drop with each stay. I remember during my 1st stay which was a 5 years back, the service and amenities were super and exceeded 5 stars. This stay the service and amenities are normal 4 stars hotel standard. The furnishings are old and worn out, the wooden flooring even turn black at certain area (suppose to he brownish wooden color). When i washed the kettle trying boil some water, but I saw black residue keep coming out. When I show to the housekeeping, his reply is these are from the exterior of the kettle not the internal so it is ok. Overall I feel that based on this experience I will not select Ritz Carlton for the next stay as the price we are paying we are expecting a much more higher standard of service

Title: Par excellence!
Review: We cannot fault our stay even if we tried very hard. Everything was above expectation, in other words, beyond perfect! You have to experience it to rationalise the cost of staying at this hotel. This was our second stay and will definitely be back to be pampered!

Address: 7 Raffles Avenue, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 039799
NandA: The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore ;7 Raffles Avenue, Marina Bay, Singapore, Singapore, 039799
Title: Exceptional!
Review: Our stay with RC was to celebrate our anniversary and daughter's birthday. Upon checked in, the front desk offered us a complimentary upgrade from a kallang view rm to marina view. We went out for our meal and came back to our rm. To our surprise, they delivered a cake together with an anniversary and birthday card which was nicely placed on the table. What more can we ask for? Unfortunately, the bathtub was faulty as we cant drain out the water so the maintenance guy came within 10 mins to check it out. He informed that we might need to change our room and alerted the front desk immediately. We received a call from the front desk and was told that they will upgrade us to a suite rm which had magnificient view of the marina as well as the Sg Flyer from the bathroom. They also offered us late c/o at 3pm due to the delay. We have been to a few hotels in Singapore but this was by far the best and pleasant stay we 've ever had. If my husband do not have to return to work we would definitely extend our stay. Thank you, RC team. Everyone of you deserve to be complimented.

Title: Sincere, always improving
Review: This is our second staycation at Ritz Carlton. What impressed us deeply is not merely the excellence they provided for us. But that they take all customers feedbacks seriously. We noted that the issues we encountered previoisly were specifically addressed and we are very happy with the sincerity shown. Ritz Carlton demonstrates that their team are always looking to improve their service to provide the best care for their customers. We also noted at how RitzCarlton empower their staff to make decisions to improve the Ritz Carlton brand. Because it was a birthday celebration, i believe they were preparing the room to include a birthday cake, we were treated to a very scrumptious high tea. The turn down service was greatly improved which shows us that customer feedback are taken seriously. The rooms are very clean and spotless and even our phone charger cables were neatly tied up. We commend their spirit of excellence in doing their job. All minute tasks are done with passion by staff

Title: Luxurious surroundings and incredible staff
Review: Our family (two children 11,9) spent one night in a club room at Ritz Carlton during a stopover in Singapore. We arrived very early and were greeted warmly, welcomed to the club lounge for breakfast, given great advice regarding nearby activities. We were checked in early to our room (around 11.30) which was greatly welcomed after an overnight plane journey. The architecture, design , fittings and ambience of the hotel is truly great. We also loved the service at the club lounge and enjoyed drinks and delicious snacks through day. The views over Marina Bay and surrounds are incredible and we all felt relaxed and pampered during our stay.

Address: 75 Airport Boulevard (Terminal 3), Changi, Singapore, Singapore, 819664
NandA: Crowne Plaza Changi Airport ;75 Airport Boulevard (Terminal 3), Changi, Singapore, Singapore, 819664
Title: Staycay was fantastic ..
Review: With Covid19, the only place close to traveling is Changi Airport...its good to feel as if we are walking around in the transit hall, especially with all the travelators :) And listening to the occasion sound of the airplanes. For a hotel to be right in the middle of the airport, sound proofing was good as we barely hear any noise from inside the room. The walk from hotel to Jewel or to the other terminals was a breeze and we walked 2-3 times each day during the 3D2N staycay! Jewel's selection of various eateries and shops were without any doubt, first class. Hotel's check in was efficient and good, Mustafa gave good advice on my queries. Room cleanliness was superb, asked for extra towels and were promptly delivered. Very accommodative team and good service throughout my stay. Only downside - No complimentary parking, but hotel offered a discounted parking ticket at $25 for 36 hours. So that was quite good. No more buffet breakfast, but ala carte, however the selection was quite limited. But again, staff serving us during breakfast were super attentive and helpful. Good job to all the staff at Crowne Plaza Changi Airport!

Address: 75 Airport Boulevard (Terminal 3), Changi, Singapore, Singapore, 819664

Title: Friendly Staff & Great Staycation
Review: Stayed here for my husband's birthday and we had so much fun. They gave a delicious complimentary cake too! The staff were really friendly and helpful. The location is exceptional. However, we still could hear the aeroplanes taking off (obviously!) even though our room weren't the runway room. So if you are light sleeper, I suggest that you request a room further from the runway. The room is clean and very comfortable. It gets really cold at night even though we've switched off the aircon. The swimming pool was awesome, its on a first come first serve basis with a max pax of 20. I would definitely stay here again, no doubt. :)

Title: Helpful staff, clean and large room
Review: The staff was very helpful. There was a queue when we were checking in and one of the staff offered us cold mineral water and ushered by mum to the sofa to rest while I completed the check-in. Another staff who assisted me with the check-in patiently explained the breakfast arrangement and how to logon to the free wifi. We stayed in the King Bed Premier room which was very clean and spacious. There are usb charging outlets at the desk and next to the bed. Breakfast was good and the staff checked that we were all right and if we needed more coffee or tea. We enjoyed the dim sum, cheese platter, fresh fruit, eggs benedict and scrambled eggs.

Address: 75 Airport Boulevard (Terminal 3), Changi, Singapore, Singapore, 819664
NandA: Crowne Plaza Changi Airport ;75 Airport Boulevard (Terminal 3), Changi, Singapore, Singapore, 819664
Title: ANNIVERSARY STAYCATION
Review: Hi I am writing to extend my compliments to Crowne Plaza Changi Airport for making my stay exceptional. I want to shout out her service, Miss Grazel was our first point of contact. She attended to our check in, swift and professional. Explained to us breakfast , room service , pool and gym reservation and some services that we may experience differently as compared to before Covid. Upon understanding its our special day, she set us up for late check out got us a room upgrade. We really appreciate what she did, we enjoyed our late check out by soaking in the hot tub until the last minute. When we were inside they set up a little surprise. A little cake for us. Thank you for this gesture. Thank you for recognising this special day with us. We got so much more room amenities like 8 bottle of water in the room , extra towels. As there are reduce house keeping frequency to encourage lesser contacts. Everything is comfortable trust me. From the shower pressure , hot water heating , Bedding , pillows , bathrobes , aircon temperature , shower amenities from this world smell exceptional. Sofa , clean carpet flooring in the room. Breakfast is ala carte and super nice . Really hands down to their breakfast. Qr code menu ordering , unlimited. We tried everything on the menu. Really top notch Will visit again Make me forget covid is around. I feel so safe eventhough there are flight attendants crew around. As some may worry the imported cases of covid. In crowne plaza there's nothing to fear. Thank you for this experience. Thank you Miss Grazel.

Address: 75 Airport Boulevard (Terminal 3), Changi, Singapore, Singapore, 819664
NandA: Crowne Plaza Changi Airport ;75 Airport Boulevard (Terminal 3), Changi, Singapore, Singapore, 819664
Title: Hospitality amidst a pandemic
Review: We were so tired and weary after arriving from a delayed flight. We arrived in Changi Airport at 10pm and picked up some food to take to the hotel. It was quite a walk from the terminal we were coming from but Elkes the youngman waiting for us in the reception was so cordial and considerate. I think he saw the exhaustion on our face and so he upgraded our room to the suite and offered to give us a wake up call in the morning if we would like to have breakfast before we hop on a plane again. The location was right out of the terminals so it only took us a few minutes to get to the gate for our next flight the next morning with a few more minutes to spare. I hope to come back to this hotel next time and promise myself to enjoy my stay.

Title: Dont book if you are driving
Review: Because of its location (where it is not anywhere near/accessible by train within 5 minutes walk), we had to drive. One night stay cost us in total up to $60 worth of parking charges, that alone after we try to exit (and not park there) most of the time. And under the Safe Management Measures it is understood the limitation that is set for the use of facilities but for a considerably good sized pool they only admit 10 pax max at one 2 hour time slot. I feel it is not maximising probability that each guest can go at least once of the 2 hours. For a staycation, if not for the use of the pool, I wouldnt need to pay to sleep at any other bed except my own. And to not be able to use the pool and pay a huge sum of parking is utterly disappointing.

Title: Wonderful staycation
Review: Did a 3d2n staycation in Westin‚Äôs Grand Premier room (sea view). Pros - Room was spacious even with a baby cot, bed was big and comfy (am even considering getting the same bed for my own place). View was gorgeous! Just have to keep remembering to lower the blinds so that the office staff opposite your bathroom does not get free show. Staff was friendly and helpful. Pool looks great but didnt get a chance to use it. Cons - Only 1 complimentary parking coupon per stay (plus you have to be a member). If you do drive out of the hotel, you will have to bear the parking fee. Their reason for this-Westin does not own the carpark, it is under Managment of Asia Square. Toilet floor tends to have puddles of water after showers, even though the shower door was kept tightly closed during showers.

Title: Great Stay
Review: I booked this hotel for a couple‚Äôs staycation - was celebrating my partner‚Äôs 21st. The service I received was very professional, all the staff were friendly and courteous. Room was beautiful, facilities were great. But I do have one gripe with the service I received from room reservations over the phone - unfortunately I did not catch the name of who I was speaking to, but when I called one or two days before my actual reservation to ask if I could come see the room so as to better prepare for my partner‚Äôs birthday, I was told in a very condescending tone that although I‚Äôd booked a Deluxe King room on Agoda, they could not guarantee it - the only way to guarantee the room was through their website directly, so ‚Äúnext time I should book on the website instead of through Agoda‚Äù. I understand that the special requests such as view are subject to availability and cannot be confirmed, obviously, but the room type is one that should be. Further more there is no need for such condescension.

Could not take out those drinks inside as they had sensors on. Requested a bucket of ice, half a bucket was given only. Swimming pool area is nice to chill, with awesome views. Pool area had some nice spot for jacuzzi. Nearby to MRT and walking distance to food places.

Address: 12 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 2, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 18961
NandA: The Westin Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;12 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 2, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 18961
Title: Luxury business hotel
Review: I chose to stay here because it is close to my meetings by Raffles Quay and Asia Square as well as around Tanjong Pagar. The quality and service are good and what I would expect for a Westin. But it is not for tourist, as it will be quite far away from any tourist attractions, or restaurants etc, as it is in an office building. The one thing that bugged me was I had to switch lifts to get from my room to ground so it can take up to 0 minutes to get downstairs if one has to wait for the lift.

Address: 12 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 2, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 18961
NandA: The Westin Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;12 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 2, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 18961
Title: Great facilities impeccable service
Review: Although not as central as some hotels, this property is only a 5 minute cab ride (less than sgd $10) from marina bay and other major attractions. We stayed on level 45, which included the executive lounge access. This entitled us to free cocktails beer and wine every night, free afternoon tea and free cooked breakfast and eggs cooked on demand made any way. Staff were very friendly and made an effort to undestand our regular preferences. During cocktail hour (2 hours 6-8pm) canapes and hot food were served buffet style aka all you can eat! You could in fact have the canapes as dinner. Gym was quiet and well fitted out with the latest life fitness gear, plus the spa was great, not crowded. Very modern and opulent. We never waited more than 2-3 mins for a taxi, the staff order your cab then let you wait inside in the cool a/c rather than out in the heat. I recommend this property to anyone looking for a more personal service experience.

Address: 12 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 2, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 18961
NandA: The Westin Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;12 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 2, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 18961
Title: Not worth the buck
Review: We‚Äôve stayed at many hotels and so far Westin is the most lacking in service for a 5 star hotel. Firstly, for a executive club lounge, the staff on duty had no clue about anth. He didn‚Äôt know if valet parking was multiple entry or not, no clue if our room was ready or how long it‚Äôll take to be ready. We came in with multiple pieces of luggage and no one even offered to help us carry any of it, I had to ask him if he could send the luggage to the room, of which he said he‚Äôll send it up when the room was ready. However, I reached my room way before my luggage and had to call them to remind them to send my luggage up. Secondly, there was an very unimpressive spread of food for their aftn tea at the lounge. I‚Äôm not sure if they didn‚Äôt top up what was finished or what we saw was what they had, which was just dried fruits and 2 jars of cookies and some drinks. We were offered late check out, but we got locked out of our room in our wet swimsuits because the keycard deactivated at 12.

Address: 12 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 2, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 18961
NandA: The Westin Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;12 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 2, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 18961
Title: Grand
Review: Facilities are good but wish the infinity pool is longer. Bed is super comfortable you'll struggle to get out of it. Wifi is free if you're a starwood preferred guest. But wifi for public (anywhere within the hotel) is good enough. The hotel is 3-5min walk from downtown line MRT, 5-10 min walk from Lau Pa Sat(local food court). At the ground floor of the hotel is Daily Eats which serves sandwiches, muffins, cakes and coffee/drinks at reasonable prices. Outside is food garden which is open during weekends only. The best thing about this hotel is the staff. Cleaning staff is respectful and efficient. Special mention to Kevin Cheong who patiently showed me 3 rooms till I found what I wanted. Note though, that rooms with King bed had better view than those with 2 dbl beds as the latter are normally placed at the other end which is farther from the harbor. Overall, our stay was great and restful. To those who want to shop, malls are farther away but just a few MRT stations away

Title: Very sloppy service, don‚Äôt expect 5* standard
Review: The hotel is basically running at full capacity, or understaffed, because concierge lines are always engaged. You can‚Äôt get their attention quickly enough, and when you do, they fumble on your requests or take ages to execute. Room service and housekeeping are the same. Hotel Name: InterContinental Singapore (SG Clean Certified, Staycation Approved)
Address: 80 Middle Road , Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188966
NandA: InterContinental Singapore (SG Clean Certified, Staycation Approved) ;80 Middle Road , Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188966
Title: Dated, tired, with poor processes. Disappointing 5* service
Review: Firstly, before I even booked our weekend staycay, I called them to check if the suites have doors separating the bedroom from living area, and was thoroughly assured they did. Upon booking 3 rooms via Agoda, I made explicit requests through Agoda (no response from hotel), then through the hotel concierge via the phone (couldn‚Äôt get through for 2 days, they took another 2 days to call me back, but finally did) for interconnected rooms and baby cots to be placed in 2 rooms. I was assured they‚Äôd be taken care of. Upon arrival, I waited more than 20 minutes to check in. It was a crowded Saturday, granted, and the lines were long, but I was standing there pregnant with bags, and the nice Caucasian manager who was walking around failed to notice and offer me any consideration or help. Not 5* service. Or maybe just not nice people. Checked in, got to our suite, there was no sliding door where there should‚Äôve been to separate the bedroom from living area, which means I couldn‚Äôt let baby sleep in the bedroom while we were in the living room. WHAT GOOD IS A SUITE WITHOUT A DOOR? Phone lines to front desk were so busy, another 20 min later I got through and kudos to them, they managed to get me another suite with a separating door 20 min after that. Bad start to staycay. Room service took 1 hour to deliver dried up $18 hokkein mee. Housekeeping was average but slow to respond. Checkout was crap, took 30min just to check out cos again, processes, staff, were just poor. Displeasing. Only upside during the stay was: the suite came with club intercontinental privileges and complimentary breakfast/tea/canap√©s were pleasant. Wouldn‚Äôt come back here.

Hotel Name: InterContinental Singapore (SG Clean Certified, Staycation Approved)
Address: 80 Middle Road , Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188966
NandA: InterContinental Singapore (SG Clean Certified, Staycation Approved) ;80 Middle Road , Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188966
Title: Disappointed
Review: I am still in the hotel while writing this review. From the start to the very end i dont find any enjoyment staying here. We stay here for 3 Days 2 nights. The moment we enter in this hotel, there is no one to escort us in and direct us to the counter, mind you, we came in quite late at 4.30 pm and definitely there is no one in the queue. My husband was carrying 3 luggage and 1 baby pram while i was carrying my baby, there is this staff, pass by us and just ask, " Do you need help?" What type of question is that?! My husband straight away say "NO", and she just walk off. I can't believe it! Than comes the check in process. A guy by the name of Zulfadli attend us. Not even looking in the eye. Just proceed everything without explaining a clear instruction! I am not sure if he have a problem with us or what. We asked for an upgrade and we don't mind paying it, and his response was, '' Its fully booked ". I'm really curious, on weekdays and its is fully booked? Are you sure? And he is not even a smiling at us nor look at us. Is smile really expensive here in this hotel?! For the room, there is nothing special to us. We have been to better hotels than this. Breakfast, I'm not sure why only this place allow 1 set each person whereby other hotels allow unlimited orders. Worst part, the first day of our breakfast, one of our breakfast did not reach to our table. Do we call for it? Nope. Whats the point. Mind you, we are a frequent ''Staycationer'', so we know what is service call like. Overall, service here is terrible, and I guess they need to treat everyone equally. Its not that we stay here for free and we expect nothing much but a smile. We were soo disappointed that we check out much earlier than expected. And the worst part, its our wedding anniversary.

Hotel Name: InterContinental Singapore (SG Clean Certified, Staycation Approved)
Address: 80 Middle Road , Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188966
NandA: InterContinental Singapore (SG Clean Certified, Staycation Approved) ;80 Middle Road , Bugis, Singapore, Singapore, 188966
Title: Very good
Review: Personally, i think the hotel suits more for a vacation stay rather than a staycation since it's located in the middle of busy spot in Singapore. It's rather close to some hot places in SG such as orchard and MBS. But in my case of staycation, the priority is about staying indoor and enjoying the facility inside. Their facility is a bit average, with a small and not so beautifull view pool, you can only amuse children. The jacuzzi is not hot at all, the main pool is so small, and the big cute round benches are closed (idk why, maybe due to covid? but the pool is open). Their gym also very standard (i didn't come there, only my hubby). He's not a picky person, but he said that there wasn't many types of machine. I love their room since it's big enough. But their bathroom is a bit small, and i feel really stuffy especially in the bath tub. Most of recent hotel has a open area bath tub, but the bath tub in this hotel is located behind your bathroom door, in the corner. But, i love their tub. It feels sturdy. The morning breakfast is delicious, but so little option to choose. Maybe it's due to covid, but it was not a buffet so i can't choose whatever i want. And when i asked for more bacons (which i LOVE), they said that the portion is fixed and i can't have more.

Title: Very comfortable & memorable stay

Title: Great Service
Review: It was a memorable time staying here. The location was great, it was accessible to everywhere. The highlight of the stay would be the service of the staff, Aloysious. I would love to thank him for the great service. Upon checkin he has upgraded me to a bigger room, however i didnt fancy the room that much so I rang him up and ask if I could get the room Ive requested. He offered to bring me around and show me the rooms before i decide on one. He was a really nice chap. He amended my room keys and came back up to deliver it. Thank you for an amazing service, all of the staff has indeed made it a memorable staycation.
