NandA: Oakwood Premier AMTD Singapore (SG Clean Certified) ;6 Shenton Way, OUE Downtown 1, CBD, Singapore, Singapore, 068809
Title: 4-star Staycation
Review: Didnt know the existence of this hotel until I came across it while looking for a staycation during this pandemic. Price is quite mid-range approx about $300 per night including taxes. Location: Just a short walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT and Lau Pa Sat. Pretty quiet location - located in the middle of CBD! 10 mins to the nearest attractions - Merlion Park/MBS Hotel: Selected 1 executive bedroom as a choice of my accommodation. Pleased with the size and cleanliness. However, there‚Äôs a sewage smell coming from the toilet - complained twice, housekeeping only managed to keep it smell free for 10mins. The front desk couldn‚Äôt the change room for me due to full occupancy. Would give them 5 star in this review if they could provide alternatives since the problem couldn‚Äôt be solved by cleaning. Facilities: Managed to use the swimming pool only. 15 pax allowed per hour and you will have to book your slot in advance. Food: Did not try the food at the restaurant but couple of affordable fast food/restaurant available on delivery app. The front desk will help you to deliver the food to your door. Service: I would rate the service a 8.5/10, with the front desk being attentive to my needs (except the toilet issue). Everything else was pretty smooth, check in and check out takes about 10-15mins. Would stay again but will avoid room 1503.

Title: Spacious and welcoming
Review: Oakwood hotel was impressively good! We took a one bedroom executive apartment for two nights; with all the mod cons of home including a Samsung bluetooth speaker (well-used), two wide-screen smart TV's (never used), rice cooker and toaster, high-tech oven that needed a degree in astrophysics to use and complimentary wifi (no degree required). The apartment was filled with light and space. Staff were impeccably polite throughout. Oakwood is almost perfectly sited - a brisk walk up to Marina bay (and the Gardens, if you wish), and another brisk walk to China town and the joys of Ann Siang Hill and Amoy Street.

Title: Pleasant stay at OUE

Title: Classy Serviced Apartment
Review: Oakwood is well appointed, with quality finishing and equipment. While a serviced apartment, it has a hotel licence and offers both short- and long-term options. Check-in facilities are designed for a serviced residence with low cadence, so it can get a little slow during busier times. The one bedroom unit (series 8) was comfortable with fairly large kitchen area (for this type of unit), full-size fridge, washing machine (some have a dish washer too), separate bathroom and toilet, and a small sitting area with TV. The bedroom is large with ample storage space, but a very small, shallow "desk" area - not conducive to working. at all The bed was comfortable, with a tendency towards firm. Bathrobes are wonderfully luxurious, but designed for minus 10 degrees, not equatorial climes. Gym is good. Pool is nice enough. Shenton Way is not the best tourist location, but it's good for business in Raffles Place, Marina Bay and Tanjong Pagar (a short walk from the MRT station).

Title: Nice and spacious hotel
Review: Hotel is new. Rooms are spacious and comes with great view. Location is in the heart of the CBD area. Staff are helpful and friendly. However, the furnitures are not child-friendly. Chairs and tables have sharp pointed edges. Unfortunately, my stay was also not all a pleasant one. Small pieces of broken glass were found in the shaggy carpet and sofa which did cause minor cuts to both me and my daughter. This lapse may be an isolated case but it did leave an unpleasant experience for me and my family. Informed the staff about the incident. They were apologetic and offered free room upgrade and late check (subjected to availability) if we decide to stay with them in the future. They also offered me and my family free brunch at the restaurant which was unfortunately not halal for us. That is all.

Address: 41 Seah Street, City Hall, Singapore, Singapore, 188396
NandA: Naumi Hotel Singapore (SG Clean Certified and Staycation Approved) ;41 Seah Street, City Hall, Singapore, Singapore, 188396
Title: Not worth the money
Review: It felt like a ghost town in the hotel as we did not see any hotel staff anywhere except for the front desk. Even the cafe at the lobby is closed. Also, we had to book a slot to go to the pool at a designated timing, but noone was manning the pool to ensure this is really the case. Anyone can basically go to the pool anytime... Furnitures are a little worn down in the room we stayed in (designer camellia, which was supposed to be one of their most expensive rooms). The bath tub was dusty too. We were informed that there is complimentary mini bar for us - but there is only 2 cans of cokes and 1 sprite. This isn‚Äôt really a mini bar we expected. Been to other hotels with way better mini bars. Some of the items in the toilet like the body lotion was already opened when we got into the room. Not sure if the staff did not change it to ensure such items should be new. The check in process was really slow too as there is only one person attending to all of us. We were informed that we had to arrive at our designated check in time of 2.30pm to avoid delays. However, we still had to wait and we could only check in at about 2.50pm. The only good thing was there is apple TV. So we could watch Netflix easily. Overall, i did not find it a satisfying stay. Rather it is a waste of money.

Title: Great room with poor hospitality.
Review: Stayed here over the Christmas weekend with my wife for her birthday. Firstly we were not greeted upon entering and we were the only ones there. Did not feel welcome! We asked for a possibility room upgrade to the oasia room for which was available but was told that it would be chargeable though we‚Äôve gotten this several times at many other hotels. Secondly and most importantly was that the swimming pool has to be booked in advance because of the covid precautions. Understandable but never was this mentioned on the booking site. We never managed to get a slot as it is a fist come first serve basis on a 90 minute block. This dropped the value of price paid as you can get similar hotels with no pools at a way lower price. Lastly and not being too petty on this but we were slightly disappointed that nothing special was arranged for the wife though we mentioned it was her birthday in the booking. The room was nice and clean but we would never stay here again.

Title: Larger boutique-style hotel in a quiet location with modern rooms and a great rooftop pool
Review: Naumi is located off a street in a quiet part of Singapore. The room was nice but we did not have any view at all- it looked down on an alleyway. The bed was comfortable, the wifi was strong, and the shower /bath amenities were great. The pool on the roof is awesome. Incredible views from the pool day and night. Pool is open late too. The only complaint we had is that Naumi gives a "free drink" card on check in (with a giant Singapore Sling cocktail on the front of the card). Turns out these drink coupons are only good for a wine or beer in the lobby bar and not at the pool bar, even though they just bring the drinks up from the lobby anyways. Why put a giant picture of a Singapore Sling on the card if it's not included? I get that this is a small gripe and it didn't take away from the overall stay, but they shouldn't even give these coupons out if there are so many unclear restrictions with them. We enjoyed our stay and recommend Naumi!

Title: Super friendly staff and great location
Review: We recently stayed 5 nights at Naumi and absolutely loved our time there. The staff were so friendly, especially the lady that checked us in! She even escorted us to our room to show us how everything worked and was super friendly and helpful. We stayed in the habitat room on the 8th floor and had a nice little view of the city skyline. The room was cleverly designed and very comfortable. The rooftop pool is wonderful. Really beautiful view of the skyline and nice deck to relax on! The only downsides were that the pillows were too high and firm and the hotel gym is very, very small and split over 3 floors, not ideal but we still managed to get a few workouts in with the limited space and equipment. Other than that, we would definitely stay here again. Really central location with lots of eateries and shopping (raffles city, Fushan, Bugis mall) within walking distance. Plus late checkout at 12 and under $300 per night which is hard to find in Singapore for a decent hotel!

Title: Weekend birthday - Patio
Review: Early check-in and a late check-out was requested; and was fulfilled. (Checkout was only extended by 30 minutes) Staff by the name of Nari was courteous and patient in explaining room layout and various details. Was promised a special arrangement for the birthday celebration. (i.e Cake/card) Check-in process was seamless, but was informed that the room could be occupied by only 2 pax after 11pm and must include the registered guest. This was not mentioned previously and caused a little bit of inconvenience (birthday gatherings usually last a little longer...) Room was spotless but the space was smaller than expected. Walking areas rather small to accommodate 5-6 pax. Outdoor area adequate. Bed was very comfortable. Smart TV was not working so they upgraded us to another room after attempts to remediate. Complimentary drinks/snacks were good. They forgot the cake :( Note to management: Do provide your check-in counter staff with a chair. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Title: AMAZING STAY!
Review: Second time staying in HFC for my birthday & my experience only got better! Location is slightly inconvenient but worth it for the environment & ambience away from the city. We were early for check in but the process was swift & easy. Refreshments were provided in the lobby. Guest relations went the extra mile with a complimentary cake too! The garden room is situated on ground level and close to the lobby but the environment remained peaceful and serene. Room was clean & well-furnished. Tub was big & spotless. The patio does not offer much privacy from neighbouring rooms and passers by from the hotel walkway as it is only separated by potted bushes. Expected the air-conditioning to be affected as I had some guests over in the evening and left the patio doors open but coolness of the room remained unaffected. Housekeeping was quick & efficient. Also huge thanks to Ivena from front desk for providing sanitary products from her own stash. Very satisfied & will definitely come back again!

Staff at check-in forgot to return passports to us, when we asked, he immediately said he did return them to us, but when we insisted, he found them at photocopy machine. When asking for umbrella , it took 15 minutes to get the, even they are placed right behind the reception counter, as he needs to put data in computer and made us sign a book. At restaurant, I asked for a spoon, an aging staff replied that I can get it myself at the buffet line. At the concierge, I asked door girl to book a taxi for me @10:45, she replied that I should go to reception @10:30 to request taxi. We may get spoiled by hotel staff in Thailand when we pay even much lower rate.

Title: worst hotel ever
Review: The worst hotel ever. If I can give zero stars I would. Made a booking, and I got into an accident, had been admitted to hospital, requested for a cancellation. But instead, the hotel charged my card even before I reach the hotel. After charging my card, they called me 30mins later and tell me no cancellation but only allowing me to shift the dates. Please use your head to think, the date of booking is for a purpose and if I can't make it, there is no point in returning to your hotel on a later date. You are officially the most money minded hotel ever. To charge the card even before I check in. Rest assured, this is not the only platform I am posting to. You can expect more news to come from here.

Title: Pleasant hotel
Review: Had a great stay at Hotel Fort Canning. Having lived in Singapore for several years, I did not even know this hotel existed, until we stumbled across it on Agoda. Staff were great, we arrived into Singapore after midnight and by the time we made it to the hotel it was past 1.30am, but had no problems checking in. The hotel itself is beautiful, surrounded by a lot of greenery. The only downside was that the room layout was very strange. A king size bed smack in the centre of a perfectly square room, with only about a meter walking space on each side of the bed. There was barely also any room for our suitcases. Probably ok for a solo traveller, but was quite restrictive for a couple.

Title: A decent hotel, but well past their glory days.
Review: Amari hotel used to be a solid 5 star hotel, but maintenance of the rooms have changed. Upon arrival, I opened the blinds to get a view of the city and to my surprise, the window was tinted with dusts and dirt. The trash bin in the shower room was not cleaned, it was full of used tissues from the previous guest. The shower wall had a lot of grime built-up. Essentially, the cleaning person just changed the towels and made the bed. Location and reception staff was the only thing positive I have to say about the hotel. I will not be staying at this hotel in the future, it's not worth the money.

Title: Executive lounge food and beverages need to be improve
Review: The staff working at the lvl 32 lounge counter, those wearing coat is efficient and courteous. Especially a slight plump lady with below ear hair length and roughly about 40yrs old. Sorry didn‚Äôt get her name. But those waiter or waitresses is so so only as always see them chit chatting only and not as attentive to the guest needs. Food and beverages at lounge is not appealing at all. Imagine only 3 to 5 pieces each variety on display. Location of hotel, view from lounge and ambience is good, Majority of staff is courteous, breakfast spread and taste is reasonable and tasty. Room is clean but for light sleeper can be slightly abit noisy at night if living in the room facing the main road.

Title: The location and service of staff is great.
Review: The location is fantastic, easily accessible to shopping malls like pratunam mall, central world etc. The room is big especially the 2 bedroom suite which has 3 toilets which is great for ladies‚Äô trip of 4 who need to use toilet for make up and changing etc. The lobby is grand looking and staff are very helpful and friendly. Breakfast buffet has great variety too. We had access to club floor lounge which gives nice evening cocktail drinks and snacks with nice ambience too. Will definitely go back there again! Thumbs up :)

Title: Exceptional

Address: 847 Petchaburi Road, Pratunam, Rachatavi, Pratunam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Amari Watergate Hotel - SHA Certified ;847 Petchaburi Road, Pratunam, Rachatavi, Pratunam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Not worth the money
Review: It has the best location. So if you are going after location then this is one of your choice. Below are the pro and con : Pro: 1. Bell boy are helpful and friendly. 2. Lobby design and look are very modern and place are quiet. 3. Location is one of the best, you can walk to Pratunam fashion mall, city mall and big c market. Nearby also have alot of food for you to choose! But bts is quite far. 4. Lift is fast and security is tight. Con: 1. Toilet is never wash just change towels and arrange everything nicely. 2. lift is fast but when guest walk out, it will leave some smell behind. 3. Room design are wall too old, like 10 to 20 years design! 4. Front office are not very friendly, talk like robot and smile like robot too. Anyway, overall not worth the money to stay such a 5 stars hotel. There are lot of choices in Bangkok. You should be able to get better for the money you paid!

Title: Great Breakfast
Review: I loved the room, the breakfast but had a family emergency with the sudden death (plane crash) of my husband and besides losing my entire cost of reservation I also had to pay over $250 USD to try to speak with QATAR AIRWAYS to make a sudden and quick reservation change to get home quick and the phone charges were terrible! Some employees did try to help me in this tragedy but hotel policy went beyond what they were able to do.

Address: 847 Petchaburi Road, Pratunam, Rachatavi, Pratunam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Amari Watergate Hotel - SHA Certified ;847 Petchaburi Road, Pratunam, Rachatavi, Pratunam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Weekend in BKK
Review: Stayed here for 3 nights. Spacious room with big bed at 27th Floor. Just that the pillows are very soft. Hotel has great location, in-front of the hotel is the Platinum Fashion Mall which has a bridge link to R-Walk that connects to lots of shopping malls nearby (Central World, Market, Siam Paragon & Siam Centre) and do a bit of walking to Siam Central - BTS stations. Breakfast was good, lots of varieties.. There are Many stalls selling Muslim food Just in front of the Platinum Fashion Mall. Overall our stayed was good and we really had an enjoyable vacation in BKK

Note that the portion for the side orders on the room service menu is quite big for 1 person.

Title: Staff were Awful
Review: We were booked for exclusive but when we arrived reception first floor was awful service. And also in the restaurant , I was feeding my kids a hotdog from 7-11 and staff came to me and said. Not around to eating here!! But I looked around some they were eating also but they not Thai people like me! I went to the exclusive reception and ask they said yes sir you can if not a big meal, and reception on the first floor was changed my money 2 times or double from normal and I have to wait for a couple weeks to get my money back! We always stayed here when we come to Thailand but no more from now.

Title: Convenient to major malls and a famous street shopping district.
Review: Convenient to major malls and a famous street shopping district. But a bit "70's" in its feel and odd choices in layout and steps. A bit far from night life.

Address: 847 Petchaburi Road, Pratunam, Rachatavi, Pratunam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Amari Watergate Hotel - SHA Certified ;847 Petchaburi Road, Pratunam, Rachatavi, Pratunam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Poor room, even after upgrading the "Deluxe"
Review: Public areas: The lobby, pool, gym and dining room are very well maintained and deserve a 5 star hotel. The room, even after upgrading the "Deluxe" room (higher level at the original), can only be considered as a 4 star room. The room is old, the bathroom is small and dark. The shower cubicle is very small. The toilet is very very small !! And not worthy of use. When the door is closed you cannot sit normally. In the 24th floor room you can hear the noise of the vehicles on Main Street. Housekeeping is not good. There were no bathrobes at the first entrance to the room. They were brought in later. The towels to wipe the face were not brought once. In the first two days, only one set of shampoo, bath gel and the like was renewed - it wasn't enough for two people. The breakfast is very good, impressive, varied and responsive to every taste. Excellent service from all staff there, also in lobby. As for the room, the feeling is bitter.

Title: Great staff, great location
Review: Stayed in a Grand Deluxe King room for 3 nights from 4th to 7th October. Was impressed with the service of all the staff from front desk to the restaurant (Oh. Except one of the chef from the egg station, who was non responsive, like he was reluctant to serve his customers). Hotel is kind of newly renovated, so the rooms were still new and nice. Location is great for shoppers who wants to shop at Platinum mall and return to drop your bags.

Title: Good
Review: I arrived on a rainy evening and I didn't have enough cash to pay the deposit. The reception really wanted me to go out of the rain just to withdraw money. Could they be flexible with QR code payment as it's widely used in Thailand? My room was clean, big, and spacious with a very comfortable bed. The location was a walking distance to the BTS. But I think it's quite pricey compared to other hotels in the area which has the same offers. The pool and fitness are located in the next building. Yes, you 'll get wet just to reach there if it's raining.

Title: Good Value, Good Locatioon
Review: I was looking for an accommodation providing and convenient access for a few days' business in Bangkok. A friend recommended Bless Hotel. It was suited my requirement precisely. I could walk to some destinations, and, for others, BTS and taxis were close by. The staff were efficient, courteous and helpful. The price was very reasonable. The ground floor restauarant provided efficient, tasty and inexpensive food delivery one evening when I didn't want to go out. This is not a five-star resort, but it certainly exceeds basic standards of convenience, cleanliness, efficiency and value.

Title: BED BUGS
Review: I have previously stayed at this hotel and it was pleasant, but this time I was located in room 301. I woke in the morning feeling a little itchy around my ankles, but by mid afternoon my left leg was covered in hundreds of bites from bed bugs, that could of only come from the room I had slept in. I contacted the hotel regarding this matter, but even after 3-4 days they have given no response. I only want them to acknowledge the situation and clean the room, so another customer does not have to share the same unfortunate fate.

Title: Very good
Review: I have stayed at the Bless Residence many times. The rooms are large and modern, and the hotel is located in a quiet alleyway. With the crisis caused by COVID-19 rooms are ridiculously cheap right now, but I was not happy with the service this time. I had a rude experience at Reception, and the breakfast -- which is never above average -- is very poor because of the lack of guests: the fruit plate was almost empty and the cooked food (apart from eggs freshly made) cold. Also the internet was quite slow. Because of the room-rates it is still a good bargain.

She was busy with calling guests yo check out the room. How can I know that? She speaks like shouting at guests. A foreign guest came out from elevator to the front and she suddenly asked him to check out. That man asked her to say "Good morning" to him. Lol I almost clap my hands.

I even took some of the food back to my place to have for lunch. Highly recommended. The room we stayed in even has a bath tub. It was lovely. We had an amazing time! Easy and simple check-in and check-out.

Address: 10 Sukhumvit Soi 33, North Klongton, Wattana, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: The Bless Hotel & Residence ;10 Sukhumvit Soi 33, North Klongton, Wattana, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: Blessed?
Review: Bless residence We were put in a room in a new building. The rooms were new an clean. The construction noise was loud during the day time but it didn't affect us as we were out during the day. The breakfast was very limited and poor by the standard of the hotels in Bangkok. We also requested for airport transfer which we we quote a fare double compared to Grab taxi. So don't use their airport transfer. The check in was ok but the staff was not particularly friendly. The staff asked about our departure time which we said was 6am because we had a 9am flight to catch. We didn't know we could request for packed breakfast. They didn't even inform us or offer to pack the breakfast for us even knowing that we are checking out at 6am and that we would missed our breakfast which was only available at 630am. They told us 6am at first. During check out, they wanted to charge us for a pair of room slipper. By the way don't use their room slipper because they were used by many other people and very unhygienic. We told them we didn't take the room slipper and it might have been moved to another room of ours. 2 or 3 of their staff frantically went upstairs to look for the missing slipper. They found it in another room and told us check out was ok! most hotels provide new disposable slippers for guest. If the hotel wants to charge the guest for the slippers, they should clearly lable it or mention it somwhere. I thought it was pretty that 2-3 on grown adults on walkie talkie frantically looking for a pair of dirty slipper during check out. My feeling is that the management and staff of this hotel lacks integrity and honesty. From the very start trying to rip us off with the airport transfer, the not letting us know about the packed breakfast and finally trying to charge us for a pair of used slipper. Communication was poor from the outset too. Took them a few days just to reply an email. Location was fine - it is a good 10mins walk to the BTS. Other that that, I wouldn't wholehea

Address: 10 Sukhumvit Soi 33, North Klongton, Wattana, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: The Bless Hotel & Residence ;10 Sukhumvit Soi 33, North Klongton, Wattana, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: Dont come here
Review: Hi, First of all if you come with your family, dont stay in this area. Bangkok is big and beautiful and this place is surrounded by sketchy massage places and bars with prostitutes. I checked in and the room I got was big but very very dark. I couldnt even properly see in the shower, with the dim lights and small windows. I complained and got a bigger room. In the next room was a very very strong chemical smell. I told them right away and they said "There is 0 smell, I know smell". I made the mistake to stay. When i came back to my room the smell was so bad that I got a crazy headache. Two more staff came and confirmed this room hadnt been used for long and something was probably very wrong. I had to change rooms at 11pm. The next room was again big. Also there were soiled pillows on my bed and no hot water in the shower. I could go on. Just do yourself a favor and dont come here, especially if you got family.

Title: Fantastic resort. You will enjoy a really great relaxing holiday at Sunwing.
Review: Fantastic resort. And absolutely fantastic for families with children. This resort has EVERYTHING you need to enjoy a really great relaxing holiday. The resort is even better in real life than in the pictures. Staff, cleanliness, location, on the beach, 5 clean and well-designed pools, beachside dining at Piak Restaurant, everything is superb. I will be back with my family and my kids are missing being there. This resort deserves more star rating....like a 6 star! Thank you Sunwing for a great vacation and I look forward to going back soon.

Title: Great Hotel ... but
Review: Centara is a great hotel and we were very impressed with the measures in place for Covid. Unfortunately service problems detracted from our stay: 1. We ordered Eggs Benedict (room service) for breakfast - what came to the room was a single poached egg on a very dry bun (not an english muffin) and with no hollandaise sauce. Clearly the staff messed up on this. 2. My wife went to the spa for the special advertised in the elevator (buy 1 hour and get 2nd hour free). She was billed much more than the quoted rate. When we questioned the charge at the front desk it took 45 minutes to get a refund, even though the concierge who booked the session was there and supported our claim. In a nutshell, we'll happily stay there again but you need to be prepared for a lower standard of service (most likely due to the long closure)

Hotel Name: Centara Grand at Central Plaza Ladprao Bangkok

Title: Deserve extra credit with attention to details with everything
Review: More than satisfied. Breakfast buffet was better than any hotel breakfast buffet, we've experienced, e.g., JW, Ratchprasong, Courtyard, Berkeley. Wife reports that soups are filled with meat (unusual!) Room was perfect. Skytop restaurant was move than excellent. Attention to details with room, cuisine including the butter (not packaged), lobster from Boston?! ... We're from New York. I gave the location a 4 star only because we had unplanned business in Silom and it was hard to get a cab back to the hotel. I know that's not the hotel's issue. We also had taxi issues at the hotel. Perhaps, this is a system issue. BTS though incredibly convenient, a short walk.

Title: BEST CITY LOCATION
Review: Centara Grand has the best location for transport by MRT and BTS. It's in the centre in Bangkok and yet maintains a beautiful garden with truly ancient trees and sunlit swimming pool. Breakfasts are wonderful, staff are polite and attentive and the price is excellent value. Just a short walk to marvellous department stores. You will love it - I have stayed several times and will be returning.

Hotel Name: Centara Grand at Central Plaza Ladprao Bangkok

NandA: Centara Grand at Central Plaza Ladprao Bangkok ;1695 Phaholyothin Road, Chatuchak, Bangkok, Thailand, 10900
Title: Troy from Perth
Review: The rooms are clean, the pool never seems crowded, having Central Plaza next door gives you a range of budget eating options (plus there is a supermarket in the basement of the shopping centre). Easy walk to Chatachuk Park which is an unexpected green expanse amongst the multi rise buildings Minor faults- the gym is small and dingy. It is a traffic filled journey to the heart of the city.

Hotel Name: Centara Grand at Central Plaza Ladprao Bangkok
Address: 1695 Phaholyothin Road, Chatuchak, Bangkok, Thailand, 10900
NandA: Centara Grand at Central Plaza Ladprao Bangkok ;1695 Phaholyothin Road, Chatuchak, Bangkok, Thailand, 10900
Title: Great Location and Nice Rooms
Review: I had a small procedure at a Hospital near this Hotel, so I decided to stay overnight before flying home. I'm glad I did. It is a nice large Hotel with a variety of rooms. I took a suite, and it was spacious and clean. It is a smoking hotel, and the room next to me was a smoking room, but I could only tell from the entrance and not in my room. I didn't get to work out in the gym or swim in the pool, but the grounds are beautiful, and there is a short walk to the Central Plaza Mall. Great Mall!!! It was a lot of fun spending time in the Mall and then relaxing back in my room. The Mall is one of those classic 'have everything' Malls so you'll spend hours looking around or going to the cinema. Breakfast, wow!!! It's one of those 'old school' buffet breakfasts that has something for everyone. There is a Japanese, Indian, Chinese and Healthy corner plus Thai and Western selections. You could go crazy if you wanted to. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Review: City view or Riverview both 60m2 rooms and both have great views of city. Have been to Chatrium many times now being local. Breakfast buffet limited currently but still good value. Mozzies in breakfast lounge being next to the river so take repellent spray or cream with you. Gym/sauna sadly was not open. Room showers takes 5 minutes to get hot and water pressure not great, shower in Gym super strong & super hot so go there (when it opens again). Wifi good. Convection oven if you wish to buy food/snacks from family mart front of residence building. Will book again soon.

Title: Our most frequented Bangkok Hotel
Review: Stayed Chatrium many times now being local. Room 2514 Best time to book a hotel deal book 2 nights only cost 1 night + breakfast, booked day before. Riverview Room but minus usual kitchen, guessing the room was a 50/50 Riverview/City View Room facing Taksin Bridge but can't complain room size only slightly smaller and price we paid. TBH it is a better room for views. BTS Saphan Taksin (exit3/4) then short taxi to hotel. Ferry shuttle not operating. Breakfast we don't normally have but having saved 1 night made sure to incl. B/fast. Buffet very good variety, 3 chefs ready to cook you up something. Used the gym & sauna first time, nobody there late night. 4th floor keycard access, sauna 20min to heat up. Con's: showerüöøwater pressure rooms weak (go to gym shower for 20√ó better) Check-in Slow + without looking voucher reception staff said City View Room? For river facing riverview room (with kitchen) numbers ie. 2510-2513 guessing 2509 faces up river.ü§î Book while you can bargain Bangkok hotels won't last.

Title: Excellent service!
Review: The service is really superb! Every staff in this hotel shows a smiling face all the time, and they really do their best to provide an excellent service. We encountered some problems in our room. We just thought that it was due to covid, but they were kind enough to compensate it by upgrading our room to a 1 bedroom suite with one of the best views we had and even gave us an option to check out anytime we want. The food is also excellent. We thought that we will only have an a la carte breakfast for two days, but due to higher number of guests, they provided a buffet breakfast.Thank you so much, Chatrium Hotel Riverside. We highly recommend this hotel. We'd be glad to stay here again.

NandA: Chatrium Hotel Riverside Bangkok ;28 Charoenkrung Road Soi 70, Bangkholame , Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
Title: Disappointed with lack of response, after a great few days.
Review: We enjoyed our stay, the staff were very welcoming and being able to have breakfast by the river was very special. we arrived with another couple(Cousin and his wife), who had never been to Asia before, I had booked the hotel based on the location, feedback and reviews. My husband and myself visited and work in Asia regularly over the last twenty years and both love it. Unfortunately we booked for the Valentine meal to celebrate my 60th Birthday, we had only eaten in the hotel prior to the event, we feel the meal made my husband and my cousin very ill during the early hours of the morning and the following day, his wife and I had only vegetarian food. We reported the problem to the hotel and haven't had a reply or a further response. Sadden that this happened especially as it was the most expensive meal we had during our whole holiday. A sad event at the end of an excellent stay. If we had eaten elsewhere during the day or the night before, this review wouldn't have been written.

Address: 28 Charoenkrung Road Soi 70, Bangkholame , Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
NandA: Chatrium Hotel Riverside Bangkok ;28 Charoenkrung Road Soi 70, Bangkholame , Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
Title: For the Superb Stay @ Bangkok by the river
Review: The experience we had was most memorable. Apparently writing this nearly a year later but is fresh in our minds. Staff was so helpful and kind they helped us with early checkin with upgrade to really good rooms with the view. The upgrade was worth every penny. We liked the ferry ride and took that quite often to all places in town. The hotel provided taxi and ticket for zoo/safari was bit costly I was bit late in planning early through other platform so had to choose the hotel one but it was very good experience as we could take the same vehicle for safari ride as well. Very much liked the breakfast. Being vegetarian the options were limited but they were good. View from room infinity pool all are superb!!

Address: 28 Charoenkrung Road Soi 70, Bangkholame , Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120

Title: Great hotel and staff
Review: Perfect hotel for our short stay in Bangkok. Lovely rooms with fantastic views. Food and drinks were reasonably priced for a luxury hotel (obviously expensive compared to other options in the city). Child friendly, our daughter made several friends on our short stay. We will definitely stay here again.

Address: 28 Charoenkrung Road Soi 70, Bangkholame , Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
NandA: Chatrium Hotel Riverside Bangkok ;28 Charoenkrung Road Soi 70, Bangkholame , Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
Title: Always been our choice in Bangkok but.....
Review: On this occasion we were disappointed. The room had not been properly cleaned. There were hairs on the carpet and wooden parts of the floor, shower with smears from soap etc. Simply inexcusable. . Changes to the complimentary drinks voucher now excludes beer. A fruit cocktail must take longer to make and cost the hotel more than a simple small draught beer. So why do it? The garden, paths and fish ponds to the side of the hotel were not being swept daily as in previous years so that dead bamboo leaves were everywhere. The staff are as helpful and pleasant as ever, the breakfast extensive and the hotel ferryboat to the shopping area dependable. We just got the impression, sadly, after visiting the Chatrium on a regular basis for the past 6 years, that standards have slipped and perhaps the ownership has changed, but not for the better. One pointer that this may have occurred is that many trusty and familiar faces at the front desk and among the porters are nowhere to be seen.

Title: Very good
Review: If you are planning to spend most of your time near the river, this is quite a good location. If your plans to visit the shopping mall downtime (reference Polygonsiam, Platinium etc..), it is quite challenging by cab as you are likely to be caught in the notorious traffic jams. If you are comfortable with their city rail shuttle, then it will work out well. International breakfasts had good selections. Room are clean.

The only thing is that the neighbourhood isn‚Äôt that lively, no market and not too menu restaurants or food stalls close by. But then take the Chatrium boat and you will find those things at Saphan Taksin. Or take the BTS to go to other places. I don‚Äôt fancy Asiatique that much as it is a bit too artificial for my liking but it has some dining options too. I highly recommend the Chatrium Riverside.

I will definitely book Evergreen Place Siam again.

Title: Wonderful room and great value

The Japanese restaurant on the first floor was superb.

Title: Nice hotel with good location
Review: This is the second time I spent at Evergreen Place Siam by UHG because I was impressed with the polite, helpful staff and a nice stay from the first time. The hotel is located near the Ratchathewi BTS station and has a 7-11 convenient store at the entrance. The bed was comfortable and I enjoyed the city view from the room.

Title: Best position for business
Review: Not much to say as this is my favorite accomodation is Bangkok. Staff always friendly and helpful. Considering we are in full Thailand lockdown, they still do an excellent job in providing good accomondation to visotors.

Address: 318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Evergreen Place Siam by UHG ;318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Great value and location. Easy to get around from here.
Review: Located close to MBK and Siam Shopping Center. Also, close to the MRT line where you can get just about anywhere in Bangkok for a reasonable price. Though, the Bangkok meter taxi's are reasonable as well. I had 3 good stays at this hotel, I just kept coming back for more!

Address: 318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Evergreen Place Siam by UHG ;318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Good place.
Review: Good staffing team.

Address: 318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Evergreen Place Siam by UHG ;318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Nice Experience
Review: The room was clean and well maintained. Even though the room was quite small, the space was managed very smartly and it didn't feel very small for us as a couple and our 4yo. The location of the hotel is perfect, just walking distance from the metro station. The breakfast and lunch menus offered decent variety with many many options for vegetarians. The swimming pool, gym were clean and inviting. I liked my experience and we would love visiting the place again.

Address: 318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Evergreen Place Siam by UHG ;318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Good location
Review: I got a free upgraded and the staff was very nice. hotel is only 1 minute walk to BTS, there is also parking for free as well. i love my stay here

Address: 318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Evergreen Place Siam by UHG ;318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: One good thing is location
Review: Staff not friendly, after booked the room, the rate immediately go down and cheaper than you book before. Staff not helpful at Front Desk but Housekeeping is good service.

Address: 318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Evergreen Place Siam by UHG ;318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Good location, good value
Review: If you want to be in the Siam area of Bangkok, the Evergreen Place is a good choice. Rooms are good sized and clean. Wifi is good and bed is comfortable. Everything works. Breakfast is "ok" but not special. Good value for the money.

Address: 318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Evergreen Place Siam by UHG ;318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Reasonable in price but would not stay again
Review: The air condition created very bad smell and after asking to change and some negations, we finally got a room, which was a bit bigger and better smelling. Strangely the floor felt a bit uneven. Overall cleanliness is not their skill and priority. Some of the staff were very friendly. The best thing was the pool, which offers a nice and lazy environment. Also the gym was good. The location was a bit off. The lobby reflects the low quality of the hotel, which i would rate rather of a 2 star then 4.

Address: 318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
NandA: Evergreen Place Siam by UHG ;318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Lack of hospitality, so I would never go back here.
Review: I have been here for several times but the last time would be the last time to stay with them. I sent the official complaint and feedback by e-mail but there is no proper apology or any reply so I am leaving this review here. There were 2 facility problems while I stayed there with my friend. (1) AC did not work at night In the day time when I checked in, it seems AC had working though it was weak. But after we came back from outside about 10pm, I felt AC did not work well. And we had uncomfortable night to sleep. Could hardly sleep. (2) Window lock was out of order I stayed at 15th floor room, there was a window can be open but can not be locked. The room is located at 15th floor so it might be safe but it is not so comfortable to know the window is always unlocked for security measure. Once again, I had been staying at this hotel several times and this is the first time to encounter these fatal errors. And even after they knew it they never say ‚Äúsorry‚Äù for it. Lack of hospitality, so I would never go back here.

NandA: Evergreen Place Siam by UHG ;318 Phaya Thai Road, Ratchathewi, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10400
Title: Lack of hospitality, so I would never go back here.
Review: I have been here for several times but the last time would be the last time to stay with them. I sent the official complaint and feedback by e-mail but there is no proper apology or any reply so I am leaving this review here. There were 2 facility problems while I stayed there with my friend. (1) AC did not work at night In the day time when I checked in, it seems AC had working though it was weak. But after we came back from outside about 10pm, I felt AC did not work well. And we had uncomfortable night to sleep. Could hardly sleep. (2) Window lock was out of order I stayed at 15th floor room, there was a window can be open but can not be locked. The room is located at 15th floor so it might be safe but it is not so comfortable to know the window is always unlocked for security measure. Once again, I had been staying at this hotel several times and this is the first time to encounter these fatal errors. And even after they knew it they never say ‚Äúsorry‚Äù for it. Lack of hospitality, so I would never go back here.

Title: Great Hotel and location.
Review: While I have no complaints about the hotel and staff, someone somewhere does need to listen. I stated quite categorically 3 times that a room with Twin beds was required. The hotel came back and said "we don't have a twin befded room at that price, only a superior!" My response was that I didn't care about the price, give my wife and son a twin bedded room.! I might as well have been "shouting into the wind", they still gave my wife and son a room with a king bed. But the room was great, updated and modern, and a great hotel for value. Just pay a little bit more attention next time please. And yes, will still go back. Location cannot be beaten.

Title: Hidden Jewel

Address: 155/23 Sukhumvit Soi 11 Near Nana BTS sky train, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: Grand Swiss Sukhumvit 11 ;155/23 Sukhumvit Soi 11 Near Nana BTS sky train, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: Downtown Bangkok
Review: What a pleasant surprise. A hotel that is actually as listed and pictured. After many years of disappointment at the hotel selected, vthe Grand Swiss lives up to expectations. Newly refurbished, the rooms are a pleasure. Bright, clean, brand new, modern. Great showers, and we appreciate the availability of different coffee and teas. A mini fridge with mineral water also available. Unfortunately our air conditioning decided to give up, but the staff upgraded us to s room higher up, which was also very good. All within minutes. Location of the hotel is great and right close to Sukhumvit. I say close because it's "off" of Sukhumvit. And quiet, very quiet. No noisy motorbikes and Tuk-Tuks. The location is an 11 minute walk from Pier 21, the same to Bumrungrad Hospital, 10 minutes to Nana Soi 4, for those in search of nightlife, and the little Soi outside is saturated with bars, restaurants, message parlours and street food vendors. We finally, in all these years coming to Bangkok got it right. The icing on the cake was that the prices are very good. We will return.

Title: Disappointing
Review: Me and my wife stayed at this property for 2 night in March-2020. The only good point about this property is the location and it's proximity to Nana BTS and the market. The hotel has two wings. The first wing has restaurant, some rooms and swimming pool.To go to the second wing you have to get down to the ground floor, cross the street, go to the main lobby and take the other lift. The second wing where we stayed has superior rooms. These rooms are like a matchbox and good only for business travellers who don't have much luggage. There is no luggage rack and keeping the bags on the floor is the only option. The bed is placed in a corner so you have to get down from other side only. Although the other side also doesn't have much space. During the stay we never felt like coming to the room, I think that sums up the stay.

Title: Not a great stay this time

I reported the room to the reception and was given a room change. The attitude of the room boy spoilt the stay from the beginning. I had to wait in the lobby for a while one evening and was bitten by insects, I assume it was from the lobby if not it was from my room. Rooms are not cleaned properly dust every where and the cigarette ash was not good to see. I have stayed here on several occasions in the past but will think twice in the future....sorry

Title: ‚ùóStay away‚ùó
Review: Stay here only if you must stay close to Nana BTS and can't find any other hotel. The photos on Agoda are completely misleading. I have been coming to Bangkok since 2014 almost once a year and this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Upon check in, the receptionist informed us that we have been upgraded to a Deluxe room. Despite our repeated request for a room with view and at a higher floor we were allocated a room in between the 4th and the 5th floor. Getting to our room from the elevator was extremely challenging and they didn't have the courtesy to send a bell boy with us so that we can find the room easily. Our room number was 509 in the building adjacent to the main building. Never stay in this room. The hotel is not friendly for elderly people or people with disabilities. The toilet stink so much that we had to buy our own air freshener to get rid of that. Our room had windows overlooking the garage next door. So, no sunlight at all. The one star is only because of the location.

This rooms are not up to standard of Grand Swiss and not anything like the rooms in the original hotel. The rooms in the new building look cheep and many are inside rooms with no window. Sorry, this time i was not happy at all.

The room is clean but too small size, almost knock my hands and legs easily. Light design is no good, couldn't leave a small dim light on while sleeping. With tight and small room size, I have to leave bathroom light on while sleeping to prevent any accident to talk at night time. Hence, when I leave bathroom light on, it is too bright to sleep as bathroom is glass. Overall, this hotel is clean and convenience, worth for money. Travellers may consider to book a higher grade rooms, but then I wouldn't comment is worth for month. Higher price will have more choices of other hotels.

Hot water in the showers was difficult to deal with. The plus, quiet surroundings, privacy. 7Eleven near by. Close to BTS station. Breakfast at Elefin was good, beyond expectation. All around service was good, friendly .Value for money is a bit high. Could be better. Seems a bit understaffed or maybe due to Covid'19 period, equals less occupancy.

Title: It's ok
Review: Location is fantastic. Heavily reduced as per everywhere right now with covid recovery underway. Would I recommend the standard rate? No. Staff were very good as expected. We were in the residence wing of building but couldn't use the lift there. Had to walk back to hotel side. Not a huge deal but added to the confusion of where's reception, where's breakfast and initially where's our room. Room was large with massive bathroom. Water temp up and down soured the shower experience. Bed super comfy (for me) as were the pillows. There seemed to be a lot of dust on the duvet but the rest of the room seemed very clean as was the whole building. Breakfast is ala carte but you can order as many as you want. I don't share other rave reviews of it and the coffee. Each to his own I guess. Carpark is spacious and plentiful. Gym is well equipped and will satisfy most if not all guests. Swimming pool is a swimming pool But the main reason to stay here is location. Can walk to Siam square if you want. If you don't, Ratchadimri bts is a little more than 100m away.

Other than that, a really nice hotel that I will stay at again.

NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Not a real 5 star hotel
Review: I started coming here ten years ago when it opened. It is probably my sixth time. This place went downhill faster than the stock exchange following the covid-19 outbreak. Don‚Äôt stay here. Breakfast buffet is more limited than Rainman. Rooms have molding on the ceiling and are poorly patched up following water leaks. Furniture is simply finished. And they charged us 3,000B for an early check-in when the first morning, the ¬´ manager ¬ª told us at breakfast they were shutting down the buffet because the entire hotel only had 10 guests. I‚Äôll never come back. For the price, you are better off staying at the St Regis, the Siam Kempinski, the Okura Prestige, Waldorf Astoria or the Rosewood.

Address: 3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Good stay at classy hotel
Review: This Hotel has a very nice modern and successful design ,and situated very conveniently close to Rachadamri BTS station. The reception is very competent and friendly and most helpful. The room was of good size and design with nice bathroom with separate toilet. The bed comfortable with quality linen. Breakfast was good and the display very attractive. They have a very nice swimming pool and steam room. The only downside was the bit of wall- to -wall carpeting in the room that allergic persons find very unpleasant. I can fully recommend this hotel but beware since the price can vary from quite reasonable to very expensive.

Address: 3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Older Boutique 5 start
Review: Great location by the BTS- super Easy to get you down to the river quick and then go anywhere from the river. The hotel staff is 5 star. The hotel is wearing a little so you can see where it used to be 5 star, but there is some wear and tear more corporate chain 5 stars wouldn‚Äôt have. They make the cosmetic repairs, but there is only so many times you can pain over chipped or rusted paint for it not to be noticed. Soon a more in depth repairs will need to be made to maintain 5 start status. That being said it‚Äôs clean and have great amenities and facilities and is beautiful. It is a little on the expensive side, but for the location and general overall quality, it‚Äôs a good value. Ultimately, you will be pleased with a stay here.

Title: Enjoyed my vacation but my partner and I ran into a few problems during our stay.
Review: Ive been to bangkok more than 20+ times for business/holidays and wanted to try a new hotel; Upon arriving, we had to assist ourselves with our luggages as there was no one by the valet or concierge. I really dont mind but of course after a long day of travelling, youd want to be greeted with good service. Secondly, when we had an in-room massage, our masseuses were falling asleep on us. This too was the first time I experienced this in Bangkok. One of the days, we visited Pattaya and this is usually a 1.5-2hr drive; however, the driver that was assigned to us couldnt find his way and took us approx. 3hrs to get to our destination. Nevertheless, bangkok is a lovely place to visit. Great people. Great culture but I would not recommend this hotel.

Title: Third stay in this hotel but will consider going again.
Review: We were actually fans of this boutique hotel and have stayed a few times already. This time however, there were a few issues which really don‚Äôt justify the daily rate: clogged toilet (happened a few times during 3D2N stay, water temperature of the shower went high and low and it was never a pleasant consistent temperature (especially challenging when you want to shower your kids).

Address: 3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Very good
Review: Overall we were happy with the hotel - large, clean room and good breakfast. The only thing we were disappointed about was being charged nearly $100 to check in early. It would be understandable if they had to prepare the room especially for us but it was ready because of a cancellation. For comparison, we have checked in early at two other comparable hotels in Bangkok free of charge when they happened to have rooms available. This sort of thing builds good will and Hansar ought to think about this more rather than just trying to squeeze as much money as possible from customers.

NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Nice hotel but..
Review: Great hotel in terms of location. Literally 200m from the BTS station and one stop away from Siam (siam paragon). Walking distance to pathumwan (erawan shrine, central world, platinum fashion mall) is approx 10 mins, 15 mins and 20 mins) respectively. Free mini bar, two cokes, one sprite, two bottled water and assorted chips. Breakfast was actually very good in my opinion in comparison with many hotel buffet breakfasts. Room & bathroom exceptionally big. Few things to note however, bathroom (bathtub) was not as clean as there were some kind of stains underneath the bathtub. Room smelt mouldy when we walked in like noone has stayed there for a while.. Hallway to our room (as we had the double standard or what they call luxury suite) was opened air (why why why?) made it look kinda cheap.. and the area in which where our room was situated looked like we were living in some kind of cheap apartment.. i mean its meant to be a 5 star hotel.. Would i stay again? Yes but not for the price..

Title: Favourite hotel to stay in BKK

We will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting BKK and we will definitely stay here again in our future visits.

Address: 3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Vertigo Suite
Review: This has probably by far one of the best stay in Bangkok! The location is amazingly and strategically convenient, and yet away from the main buzz where I could seclude after a Long day. What is most commendable are the consistent service at Hansar from the concerige to front desk. Simply amazing experience! I need to compliment Sherry in particular cos I left my ear piece on the room and she has been very so patient and responsible to arrange for the eat piece to Novotel Pratumnum where my Sister was residing. Everything were seamless and I will definitely revisit again. The only improvements to be made are the bed/pillows should be better support for a more comfy sleep.

Address: 3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Excellent
Review: Location: Less than 5min walk from nearest BTS. Walking back to hotel from the 4-faced Buddha area would take about 10mins. There is a massage place just in front of the hotel. Breakfast: What I love is the unique way of how breakfast buffet was served as you order, and came nicely presented. The drinks are nice! Service: I've forgotten to bring my contact lens solution and case. Am amazed when hotel staff helped me use an application to place an order to purchase from a pharmacy and have the item delivered right to the hotel to me at a reasonable delivery fee! So much hassle saved! As the hotel staff knew we had to check out early before their breakfast buffet starts, they breakfast set prepared early for us. Downside was the sandwiches were not warm and it's quite hard. If they could allow us to enter the restaurant to just have quick toast done, that'll be great. Room: Room was very spacious.

Address: 3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Top Notch
Review: Went on a last minute short vacation to bangkok and chose the huge Suite at Hansar. Excellent personalized service from all their staff. Only complaint was the WiFi which dropped strangely in my room (1411) no less than 3 times in the first 3 days of my stay. Credit to the duty manager Jay who went out of his way to finally resolve the issue. Would highly recommend staying in the suite which is both spacious and luxurious (great value) in comparison to numerous other much older though even more pricer hotels in the neighborhood.

Review: I love the hotel breakfast. Clean room and the bed is so comfortable. Good choice and will go back again.

NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: The best stay ever in Bangkok!
Review: I have been visiting Bangkok every year, and this hotel is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in town. The location is beyond perfection; the service is second to none, from the front desk staff to the cleaning team. If any of you are looking for a topnotch service in Bangkok, I highly recommend this hotel!

Address: 3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Hansar Bangkok Hotel ;3/250 Soi Mahatlek Luang 2, Lumphini, Pathum Wan District, Bangkok 10330, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Incredible hotel, now only great
Review: Hansar is unique in its design. Lots of wood and plants and silks. When new, it was stunning. Sadly, it has not been well maintained. A lot of the wood is fading and needs to be re-stained. Doorways on the pool deck are grubby & need cleaning or RE-painting. The flower boxes in the light wells are old broken plastic things, which look tired and ugly. The silk sofas in the lobby are dirty and coming apart. Silk wall coverings in the breakfast room are grubby and stained. Some silk panels in my room same. Really?? In a 5 star hotel? Breakfast is ok, but severely lacks variety. After the third day I was able to get eggs ‚Äúover, medium‚Äù (as per the menu) rather than cooked on one side only. My friend was also, on day 3, actually able to get ham inside his ‚Äúeggs Benedict with ham‚Äù (as per the menu), rather than just spinach (which wasn‚Äôt on the menu. The toast cooker is trash, and you have to put the toast through 4 times for it to be toasted. All this let‚Äôs Hansar down.

Secondly the room is large with separate living and bed rooms. It comes with free mini bar that‚Äôs replenished daily. Third the breakfast is good. You choose the main courses (yes, you can eat as many of the dishes as you want), and from a buffet spread of salads, fruits and bread and pastry. Surely worthy of repeat visits. Great place !

Title: A hidden jewel and perfect hotel
Review: The Hansar is not famous nor full of the super rich, it doesn‚Äôt show off and then charge you 250$ a night, you might want that but I do not. What the Hansar does do is give you a great breakfast after you spent the night sleeping well in a large well furnished room which is so comfortable you feel sad to leave it. Little things it does well? There is a pillow menu!! You can choose the type of pillow you desire, the breakfast is served properly in a restaurant style, you are greeted and sat and then asked what you would like to eat and the food is sublime. The staff are friendly and helpful and their service is perfect the barman makes a great range of cocktails, I‚Äôm sure that in one of the super expensive fancy hotels you can experience the same but despite having the money to do so since staying here I have never felt the urge to spend even more. An excellent welcoming luxurious hotel, I recommend you try it.

Review: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Next to the shopping district of Bangkok. BTS sky train station right at the front of the hotel. Reach all fancy restaurants and famous cafes with walking distance. The convenient store on the ground floor offers everything you need. However, IBIS style, the room is small and not soundproof. You probably can hear the room next to you talking and showering or noise from the corridors in the morning. Overall it's a nice place to stay if your aim to Bangkok is shopping. But if you can pay more still some choices around the area.

Address: Rama 1 Wangmai, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Ibis Bangkok Siam Hotel ;Rama 1 Wangmai, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Excellent room at reasonable prices
Review: Booked ibis Siam for 2 nights as I had just finished a conference and had stayed at another highly rated hotel, but was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable the stay at ibis was. The room was decently sized, the bed was comfortable, and all the details in the room were well thought out - eg. I loved how there were sufficient hooks in the toilets for towels, hangers in the cabinet and a location to place my phone while it was charging near the power socket. It‚Äôs the attention to details and functionality that wowed me. Breakfast was decent and there was variety over the 2 days I had. Hotel location is great, right beside National Stadium, with escalator access which was up-riding. Only downside is that I don‚Äôt think there was a down riding escalator or lift from the BTS station so I had to carry my luggage down a couple of steps. Loved how the hotel pays attention to their guests and placed an informative notice on how to travel to the airport at the front desk and in the lifts. Thank you ibis, for the lovely stay!

Address: Rama 1 Wangmai, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Ibis Bangkok Siam Hotel ;Rama 1 Wangmai, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Great location and excellent service from the staff
Review: This hotel location is one of the best, directly located beside the BTS National Stadium station. Shopping is no issues where MBK, Siam Square, Siam Paragon, Siam discovery are just within 5 minutes of walking distance. The 7-11 located right at the ground level is an added bonus. The room is spacious and clean and I would recommend it for one to two person staying together but the bathroom is relatively small but decent. The only small complaint that I have is the water pressure and temperature for the shower. It‚Äôs hard to get the desired water temperature without lots of trial and error when showering.

Address: Rama 1 Wangmai, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Ibis Bangkok Siam Hotel ;Rama 1 Wangmai, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Exceptional
Review: I stayed only one week, but was very impressed by the helpful and friendly staff, the way they greeted and talked me , made me feel comfy, and feel like I stay at a friend's house, instead of feeling stay in an cold hotel. I would like the say thanks to the following staff, they have been giving me extra effort, helping me a lot, made my stay in Bangkok very comfy and happy. in fact the staff at IB is are all excellent, but I still want to give special thanks and credit to the following staff: Teanz, Mo, Pear, Thee and Sek Hope I didn't spell their thai names wrong, Actually, I already planned to come back to IBIS next year.

Review: the room is a bit dark

Title: Great location
Review: BTS station right in front of Hotel , 7-11 at ground floor , a lot of eateries places any many shopping malls around

Address: Rama 1 Wangmai, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
NandA: Ibis Bangkok Siam Hotel ;Rama 1 Wangmai, Siam, Bangkok, Thailand, 10330
Title: Returning Customer
Review: I'm a fan of the hotel. It's easy, convenient, and it totally suits my stay in BKK. Siam is within walking distance (5-10 min). BTS station is right at the door step. And the 7-11 at GF lobby is incredibly convenient. If your plan in BKK is out shopping & sightseeing all day, rather than staying-in for hotel facilities, this hotel is for you.

I live in Thailand for almost 10 years and this is my top hotel experience so far. Breakfast was amazing too. I felt I got a lot of value for the money I spent. The playground is also convenient for the families with children. If I have to find one thing that is not five star experience, it would be the parking. It‚Äôs very small and busy. If you come by car you may look to park elsewhere.

The hotel will pay for the taxi back to the hotel for you, but not when you go to get a car by yourself. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. Room is very clean and new.

Address: 181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Kokotel Bangkok Surawong ;181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: It was a great stay!
Review: I stayed at Kokotel twice. The location and the price make this place a hidden gem in the heart of Bangkok! I did not use much of service from their staffs, but as I can see they are very friendly. The wall is pretty thin. I can hear people walking and yelling in the morning. It got me a little anxiety sleeping and hearing people walking. And this stay, I found out after I took a shower that a towel they gave us was pretty old. It was threadbare. I called to ask if we can change, they insisted we have to go to the receptions. We didn‚Äôt because I was just finish shower. Everything you need in the evening, you need to go to the reception, I suppose. But overall was splendid.

Address: 181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Kokotel Bangkok Surawong ;181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: This hotel is strategic and the staff is very helpfull
Review: This hotel near from center city. Near from BTS chong nonsi station, and seven eleven. If you tired for walking to hotel from BTS chong nonsi you can go by taxi or Tuktuk. Hotel staff is very kind and helpfull. Thank you so much for helping me ‚ù§Ô∏è The hotel is clean, comfy, and pretty silent.

Address: 181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Kokotel Bangkok Surawong ;181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: clean hotel with reasonable price
Review: Room is small however it is clean. I booked standard room just nice for solo traveller like me. Price is reasonable. The bed is very comfortable. The room equip with safety deposit box which is a plus for me. The only downside is tooth brush is not provided in the room. We need to go to receptionist and ask for it. Same for slipper and shaver.

Address: 181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Kokotel Bangkok Surawong ;181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Exceptional
Review: I stayed in standard room in the new building. The room was good looking. Design was well-planed more than room in the old building. The location was great. Few problem were hot/cold water in the bathroom, which was very difficult to adjust and inadequate parking lot.

Address: 181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Kokotel Bangkok Surawong ;181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Good for the price, but a lot to improve
Review: Reasonable price for the value. There are a lot to improve. Staffs need to be trained better. Now they are just like student level without enough knowledge and professional attitude. Clean enough. OK location if you do not have a lot of luggage. If you have a lot, this is not the one to choose. If I only carry one backpack, I will come back to this hotel.

Address: 181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Kokotel Bangkok Surawong ;181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Good value but not suitable for tall person
Review: Clean hotel with comfortable bed as they have several layers of linen products on it. The ceiling is very low. If you are above 1.8m in height, you will bump into smoke detector and can easily hit the false ceiling. Shower heads are not high enough also for tall people. The room is designed efficiently and satisfy all basic needs. Corridor has low ceilings too and the rooms are very close to each other, so you can hear sounds from corridor and next door if they are all occupied. It‚Äôs good value for me for a comfortable yet budget stay.

NandA: Kokotel Bangkok Surawong ;181/1-5 Surawong Road, Suriyawong, Bangrak, Silom, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500

Title: Relaxing
Review: The hotel is well located. The entrance is easy, by car. Upon entry, the staff are like personal guides, professional, courteous, and well spoken. Appearances of foyer, lobby, and associted areas are immaculently clean. The lounge, located on "M Floor", usually has a nice breeze, and there is an indoor lounge. The lounge, pool, and fitness center are located in the same area. The fitness area is scaled back due to COVID. None of the restaurants serve alchol due to COVID restrictions. There are several convenience stores that do. Finally, this is Lebua. If something is not right. They go out of their way to correct it. At the moment, it is like you have your own hotel and staff.

Title: A great stay with a few hidden surprises
Review: Outstanding service and amazing food, we opted for the tower lounge experience and it was incredible. High quality food with exceptional service. We stayed with our young daughter (13 months) who loved the ongoing amounts of food and attention the staff paid her. The only disappointing element was we weren't aloud to the sky lounge for a photo when the sun set because of her age. While I understand and respect it is an area for adults, we only wanted to show her the twinkly lights and take a photo of the skyline (5 minutes). I felt given the nature and history of the Lebua this would be allowed but it wasn't.

Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Above average
Review: We are residents of Bangkok and know the city well, having lived here for 2 years. We booked LeBua for a staycaution and time to relax and unwind. We called LeBua on Friday 18th March, the day before we traveled and just before we booked the room on Agoda. We asked if the swimming pool and facilities were open - we were told they were definitely open until the end of March. We also asked and double checked with the reservation team at LeBua that our room (Tower Club City View Suite) came with Club Lounge Access and were told that it did from 06:00 until 18:00 each day with complimentary snacks, small meals and drinks. We arrived at the hotel to be told that the pool was closed and had been for 3 days (we only called yesterday) and that our room did not include club lounge access. What a waste of money, we would not of booked the room if we knew about both of these issues. We ended up having to pay more money to access the Club Lounge. We will not be back.

Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Second time at Lebua, amazing stay again and will definitely be back!
Review: This is amazing hotel with excellent good old fashioned and flawless customer service. Rooms are huge well equipped and amazing balcony... breakfast is second to none! Locations is great, unlike many of the 5* it‚Äôs not in the major tourist areas so is a nice retreat from the chaos of Bangkok. Sky train station is 2 minute walk so getting around is easy and very easy to get a taxi or Tuk Tuk to get to other parts. Recommendations: - Book Tower Club for best views. - The sky bar is extremely expensive for drinks, it‚Äôs open to all with no entry fee so this is understandable if you tell them you‚Äôre a guest however, they do not pressure you to buy drinks. - under no circumstances miss the breakfast - best I‚Äôve had at any hotel ever! - in the evenings there can be a queue for the lift due to the sky bar being open to all... show your key and they won‚Äôt make you queue.

Title: Decent at best
Review: The staff and service are fantastic! However, the rooms are over priced and mediocre. For how much they charge, the rooms need to be updated. We have seen more stylish Best Westerns. And what is the point of a kitchenette if there is no functional small wares to use it? It is just a huge waste of space. Lastly, the floor with the "smoking rooms" which we didn't book, absolutely reeked. Completely invasive. We literally held our breath from the elevator to the room. The room smelled horrible too! The only reason to visit this place is for the skybar and views. For this price range there are several nicer, better options.

NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Honeymoon travellers.
Review: Amazing deals to stay at this fantastic hotel or so we thought. Free minibar in the room only contained coke,lemonade and iced tea. NO ALCOHOL. The free club lounge access is great. Food and alcohol is free but what they don‚Äôt tell you is it‚Äôs only open 6-6pm. Also if you want a drink late into the night You will have to go outside the hotel as ALL bars close at 1am. The breakfast is outstanding. We ate at sirocco bar on the 65th floor. The jazz band are the best and the female singer was just beautiful. The menus light up so you can see what you are ordering just a shame it‚Äôs so dark you can‚Äôt see what you are eating. The food was a taste explosion and I loved it. The other 3 people at my table were not blown away and at the cost of 36000 baht(roughly ¬£1000) I wanted them to be blown away. Overall I think you are paying that price for the service, surroundings and atmosphere which does blow you away. Yes I would stay again I would just go outside for food and drink.

Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Be prepared to pay for the view on top of the hotel!
Review: Everything about the hotel was great, but if you are planing on going to the top of the State Tower for the view that they so heavily advertise, be prepared to pay a pretty penny for a drink at the bar or a meal at the restaurant. If you just want to go to the top and check out the view but not pay a lot of money for a drink or a meal, don't bother. They herd you up there like cattle and have about 10 staff for every one person who goes up there, which is annoying in and of itself. And if you just go up there to check out the view, they are everywhere telling you, "You cannot stand here, you cannot take pictures here," etc. etc and the whole experience will leave you wanting to throw one of them off the roof. My wife and I were up there for 3 minutes before getting the heck out of there. That said, if you want to have a drink at the bar with a bunch of snobs (not our scene) then you could enjoy the view without being hassled. Otherwise, the room, gym and staff were great.
