Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Pretentious
Review: Stayed one night at the hotel and it would appear from the outset you are judged on looks. Visiting what the staff make you think is the sky bar you buy a drink and they can't wait to get rid of you. The bar you are actually in is not the sky bar. It's not until you query it having bought a drink they offer to take you there. Unfortunately they treat people staying at the hotel the same as the public that can walk in and visit the hospitality areas. The fridge leaked in the room, there was no iron/ironing board. Small things but when you are paying to stay in a five star establishment you would expect to be looked after just that little bit more. Stayed in many hotels throughout South East Asia, I can say I have no ambition to return to this venue.

Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Beautiful beyond words, could be more affordable
Review: We stayed at the Lebua for a night for our friends birthday and the place was beautiful. The Feng Shui - 10/10. We were ballin on a bit of a budget so we couldn't afford all of the amenities.. they do ask for a 5000 baht deposit when you get there. The sky bar on the top floor is without a doubt breathtaking but the cheapest drinks were well out of what we were willing to spend as well. Five-star service for sure though.. They even sent a happy birthday cake up to the room because the reception heard us talking about it or saw on his passport. It smelt like coconuts and vanilla everywhere.. Amazing, the views and cleanliness of the place really make it a place you won't forget. The Foodpanda delivery guy couldn't find the place though and the grab driver had a hard time too but figured it out. It's very tucked away in the state tower. Overall I would recommend if you have the money to spend!

NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Really good 5-star hotel experience
Review: 1) Facilities really good - large bathroom, lots of space for gathering 2) Location - good if you are not first time coming to Bangkok. Just a bit away from Saphan Taskin BTS station. Not recommend for first time visitor. But it is not that far away from station, around 6 mins to walk. Very close to Asiatique and IconSiam (Brand new for shopaholic) 3) Lots of local stores nearby - you can find local cheap stores but they are really tasty and Thai-style. 4) Customer Service - really really good there. They can provide detailed advice to us. The lobby and room service are good. Special thanks to Chao! 5) Swimming pool - have not tried. But not good idea to swim in the morning, except you wanna show your body to all people having breakfast 6) Only 1 thing not good - Breakfast is not recommended. Quite many choices but quality.....not that good for a 5-star hotel. We added 1 day breakfast and well..... You can have a lot at the nearby food stalls at 1-fifth price T_T

It used to be more "international", i mean it used to cater also for european and mediterranean. This time it was mainly catering for asiatics (japanese, chinese korean...). Not saying it is wrong, but Lebua used to be more generous, even if europeans/mediterraneans are fewer in number. Still Lebua is one of the finest hotels i know.

I also found the breakfast area a little bit too small to accommodate all guests during crowded hours, but still a great place.

Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: A bit disappointed this time
Review: My second stay here, felt that the hotel was not as good as before. Breakfast was still spectacular but other things have been a bit deteriorated compared with my first stay about 4 years ago. I could not get hot water for my shower at all during my entire stay-3 days although I reported the problem to the reception. I heard all the noise from the next door including the sound of shower and flushing toilet and the guest conversation till 1 am in the last night of my stay, it was really disturbing particularly because I had to get up early morning next day. I would not go back there again for my next visit to BKK unfortunately.

Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: The hotel itself is amazing. However the service was a great let down...
Review: We were only there for one night prior to catching our flight back to London. We booked the room through Agoda.com. We were meant to pay on arrival at hotel, but to our surprise when we got there (after some confusion) we realised the hotel had already taken our payment. When we got to our room, we were told that we would not be allowed to open our balcony, and everytime we wanted to go out we needed to call reception for someone to let us out...this was (in there mind) due to safety of our baby. Now, as much as I am all for safety and totally appreciate where they are coming from, no parent in their right mind would let their child out on those balconies. However, I don't think us having a baby should impact our stay with regard to the freedom of opening and closing the balcony, as we are responsible for our own child's safety. Also baby not allowed in rooftop bar? Would have been good if all this was stated during booking process as we would have stayed somewhere else...

Title: Great View from balcony
Review: We got upgraded from floor 21 to floor 59, room get more spacious too. We got foyer room, kitchen, and more amazing view from 59‚Äôth floor. The View is really really amazing. Staff is nice, our staff name Chao, he is good. Sky bar is awesome, but because every night is raining so the place is not crowded. Breakfast is great, sushi, meat, dimsum, everything! Location : you need to walk 10 minutes to nearest bts and river.

Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Worth Every Penny
Review: Pros: + All-you-can-eat & drink lounge at 6 am - 6 pm [Impressive!] + Continental Breakfast buffet *Be sure to check if the features above are included in your reservation* + Swimming Pool right next to a cafe/bar + Bilingual Staffs with excellent service + Birthday cake [or drink] surprise in the evening + Beautiful Suite Room with Amazing View + Great location to enjoy riverside [Traffice is a bit heavy though] Cons: - Rooftop bar's staff are quite pushy and not as good as the hotel staff [They won't leave you in peace if you have a half-empty glass] <I got up from my seat to use a bathroom and the waiter took away my half-empty glass[About 3000 baht].> - Some of the Rooftop Bars are quite pricey [Expect cocktails price of 1000-5000 baht for start] [Be sure to check before you order and don't be shy to walk-out and change the bar if everything on the menu is too expensive,] Conclusion Overall I enjoyed my stay so much and will definitely go again.

Title: Our favorite hotel in Bangkok
Review: We visit Bangkok quite often and always come back to Lebua. We love the location mainly because it is close to both the river and the sky line. The rooms are huge and comfortable, the staff is very polite and helpful. Breakfast, wow what a breakfast. We travel a lot and we never found something like the Lebua's breakfast. The check in process used to be very slow. It is now better. Still slower than in other hotels but you get your chance to ask for your preferences.

NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Not the best
Review: Stayed at the hotel for 8 nights. I will start with the positives first. The staff were first rate and couldn‚Äôt do enough for you. The location was pretty good for. Visiting the Grand Palace and various temples. Now the bad. The hotel is definitely not a 5 star hotel, it is a very run down building. The rooms a large but need modernizing and you can hear the people in the next room as the walls are paper thin. If you want to take pictures up on the 64th Floor be prepared to take your cheque book with you as the prices for drinks are ridiculous

Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500

Title: Over attention to service is pretentious and unnecessary.
Review: They attend to you with personal care but its all a bit over the top and pretentious . Worst part was Chef's Table which cost me over $640 for 2 people. Most all the elegantly prepared and presented courses had the same unappealing flavor. They kept trying to appease me by offering complimentary alcohol despite the fact that we told them we didn't want the wine pairings due to me being diabetic. Pairing would have brought cost up to like $1000. I can't see how this Chef's table gets the great reviews they claim it does.

Address: State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: lebua at State Tower ;State Tower 1055/11 Silom Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Strange policy
Review: This hotel location is very good and most of the staff service is very good and nice... room fee is not expensive reasonable. First night I have dinner in there restaurant, view and service is very good of course is not cheap but for that kind of hotel is reasonable. But the hotel policy was hard to understand! When you check in normally need to pay the deposit it's okay, but if you want to sign the bill to your room better don't spend more then the deposit because they will ask you to increment the deposit if you stay at this hotel a week and spend money in the hotel every day you will be busy for the top up!! This is my first experience have a five star hotel will do that. When I discuss with the front desk manager why the hotel have this policy he said because have some guest spend over there money when check out they cannot settle there bill! I think if the hotel don't trust the guest why they don't ask the guest to use there credit card don't sign the bill to your room!!

Title: Can be recommended with some 'deltas'
Review: Staff is very friendly,competent and helpful. Hotel is overall ok, but too crowded and busy. Pool area is for this massiv hotel too small. Rooms are very spacious(huge), very well equiped and the interior is very stylish, with a nice view from the balcony. Best breakfast buffet we've ever had with a huge variety of ethnic food, even an excellent Sushi buffet, however, due to the size of this hotel, breakfast was kind of 'busy'. Prices at the hotel are outrages, especially at the famous roof-top bar; for 2 small beers 2000(!!) THB , ok but the view is spectacular. If you have to pay the regular roomrate with breakfast, I think the price/value ratio is a bit off balance

Title: Sour Taste
Review: Booked in for five days for what were mainly nostalgic/personal reasons. But upon arrival met with a demand that have not experienced for I don't know how many years. Five nights, AUD100 (B2,000)per night 'room deposit'. Had I not already paid on a non refundable basis would have walked out there and then - there are many other Bangkok hotels of the same rating as the Lebua. So, paid this on the credit card which was debitted. So, there will be bank fees for both a foreign transaction and a loss on the exchange rate which will be doubled with the transfer back of the B10,000 (total) (AUD500). This is not a hotel I will stay at again - nostalgia does not warrant insulting behaviour which I consider has been inflicted by the Lebua.

Title: An amazing place...

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Quite disappointed this time
Review: I have used the Mandarin before and I love this chain. This time I booked a room for a very good friend in desperate need of privacy and relax. When I went directly to the hotel one day before his arrival, I found that the main building was under renovation, so most of the restaurants and the swimming pool were not available. There is no mention of that on the hotel's website, nor I was told during a couple of telephone calls I had to make some special arrangement. I was actually tempted to cancel. Then I asked for a limousine service to the airport, and I was told they would contact me in the morning of the following day to confirm. As nobody called, at around 2pm I called them and they answered quite rudely that the service had already been booked - kind of, why are you bothering us with your call? For the rest, the restaurant service was good and my friend was impressed with the morning breakfast. But I found the total lack of information about the renovation very unprofessional.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Perfect
Review: This is the best hotel. Mandarin Oriental Bangkok has a huge staff in order to provide truly exceptional service to their guests. They must have an extensive staff training program and a very rigorous personnel screening program as the staff is, without exception, absolutely dedicated to making their guest ‚Äòs stay as comfortable and pleasurable as possible. Every aspect of my stay here was perfection. From the warm reception to the wonderful restaurants, the spacious, spotlessly clean guest rooms to the hassle and wait- free checkout this hotel knows how to do it right and has the management and staff to make it happen. Going forward, any where I travel - if there is a Mandarin Oriental, I‚Äôm staying there.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Among the best hotel experiences EVER!!!
Review: Bangkok's Mandarin Oriental is among the best hotels in the world - for so many reasons, but the reason I most enjoy staying there (just had my twelfth visit,) is that this hotel does more than any other to make its guests feel special. It's more expensive than any other, but you get what you pay for, and here, you get a lot!

Title: Great Hotel Even for the Price
Review: I had an amazing stay. The breakfast was great and the staff was very helpful. We ate both nights at the great restaurants in the hotel. The only problem I had was with getting taxis. The first time, they gave the taxi driver the wrong location which caused me to be late to a meeting. Then at the end when they got me a taxi for an early morning flight, the driver tried to significantly rip me off and when I told him about it he was very rude. I felt like the hotel could have definitely prevented these instances.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Fantastic stay in a great hotel
Review: This is really one of the best hotel in the world. We felt so good during our whole stay, thanks to a great staff, always helpful and pro-active for anything. We could really feel that they were always here for us as their ratio is 3 staff for 1 guest. The buffet restaurant is one of the greatest buffet I have ever tried (try the duck, so delicate). Location is nice if you like this quiet location by the river, but a bit to far from Sukhumvit area if you like there too. They have a very good driver organization from the airport, do not hesitate to book it.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Excellent honeymoon in 1505
Review: We spent the first part of our honeymoon here from 15-19 Nov 2015. The hotel did not disappoint and truly lives up to its world class name. We took the BMW 740i shuttle from the airport and were greeted with fresh sented towels, water and a luxury ride to the hotel. Didn't have to touch our bags again until they were set out for us in the room. Check in was completed in the comfort of our room and the staff walked us through the amenities and location of everything in the room. We were pleased to learn the floor had dedicated butler service that could be called from a button on either night stand. Another button was also dedicated for do not disturb. The staff went out of their was to show us kindness and meet our every need. They always knew how to anticipate. A great example is when our floor butler noticed my Allen Edmonds shoes were a bit dirty. While we were out for the day he took it upon himself to clean them and had them waiting for me when we returned. Very impressive! The room was appointed with quality that any audiophile would enjoy - denon sound system and Samsung tv with premium programming. The desk was multifunctional and the bedding was deluxe. Shower water pressure was great! We participated in the spa for a traditional Thai message in a private suite and did the Thai cooking class. Both experiences were excellent! Upon leavin we again took the bmw to the airport and staff walked out bags through check in all the way to security! Total professionalism. Only thing I would recommend is upgrading the toilets as they required the handle being held down for a long time to flush.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Fantastic Hotel
Review: Even though I only spent one night at the Mandarin Oriental, it was one of the best nights I've ever experienced. From the outstanding customer service to the very lush spa- this hotel has the best of everything. The only downside was the lack of free wi-fi. At this standard of hotel, you would think wireless internet would be included!

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: A Great Hotel
Review: As far as I am concerned the Mandarin Oriental Bangkok is in a class of its own. In a good hotel you are lucky to find one or two good staff ,but at the Mandarin I can think of many I encountered. This includes Su who is a most wonderful lady that serves tea in the stunning lobby and who has a most positive attitude towards life. Also in the lobby they have a great piano player who is blind. I was touched at the kindness and respect shown to him by other members of the staff who graciously help him to get around. At the Bamboo Bar you will find a great barman who will make you one of his signature cocktails . Then kick back and enjoy the truly talented Jazz singer from America and the equally impressive saxophone and piano player all genuine professional musicians. When I arrived at the hotel I was unwell .No problem ,the Hotel has a fabulous nurse and a Doctor on the premisses .They gave me a test and had the results three hours later and supplied me the required medicine as well.Try that at another hotel,or anywhere for that matter. There are many more notable people not least is the lady who gave me a splendid massage at the hotel spa. Best I have ever had. Need I go on. This hotel has what is desperately lacking from the hotel industry.and that is genuine hospitality ,efficient and kind service. Few hotels take care of guests better and make them feel more welcomed and comfortable. Finally a tip of the hat to the good folks at Agoda who's great rate and easy to transact system made it possible for me to afford staying at this last bastion of luxury.To borrow the line of the the great actor Peter Ustinoff, "when I am leaving ,I am already planing my trip back"!.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Poor value for money
Review: Hugely disappointing. Stayed 1st 3 nights of Bangkok visit at a 5-star hotel in Bangkok downtown and then mover for 2 nights at 2x higher cost to MO for the "experience of a life time" and MO suffered on all counts. far from happening locations in the city, smallish lobby, unimpressive check-in, smaller room, trouble after check in as power fuse for room kept blowing out as one of the power outlets was defective, buffet breakfast had limited choices of mediocre quality and plagued by high noise pollution due to non-stop operation of hotel's shuttle boats operating on Chao Prya river at the adjoining pier. The shuttle boats' operation is an environmental disaster in terms of high noise and exhaust emissions as shuttle boats continue to arrive and depart continuously at the pier and 2-3 MO shuttle boats can be seen in the river at any given time with 1 or evn no customers on board. Hotel should operating shuttle boats at lets say 15 minutes interval to the frequency of boat operation and also the adverse environmental aspects associated with it. Will not stay at the MO again.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Spectacular, elegant, and friendly
Review: For me, the hotel is the foundation for an international trip. I've stayed at some of the best hotels in the world, my standards are very high -- sometimes a little obsessively so, and this hotel has to be at the top of the list in every conceivable respect. Just as a small example, each day a tray of a different tropical fruit appears in the room, accompanied by silverware, linen napkins, a small orchid, and a printed card with information about that day's fruit. Apply that attention to detail to every aspect of the hotel, and that will give you a picture of the Mandarin Oriental in Bangkok. Sometimes, at a hotel of this caliber, you'll feel a stuffiness and pretentiousness. Not so here. The elegance is accompanied by an easy warmth and casual comfortable feeling.

NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Old World Luxury
Review: This hotel has wonderful and attentive staff. A lot of amenities. Great views watching the goings and comings on the river. An opportunity to be in a historical hotel with the Crown Prince coming for a special ceremony added to the charm. Guests coming for fancy weddings and parties were dressed in beautiful Thai and western clothing. The whole experience here was worth returning for. On the negative side, Thai dinner on the riverside terrace had excellent dancing for entertainment and delightful views of the river, but the quality of the food was very disappointing. Ordinary corner restaurants had much better quality food. This "Grande Old Dame" as it is known could also catch up with the times for some tired carpets and furniture, as well as catching up with most hotels that do not charge an exorbitant hourly WiFI rate.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Classic river gem with old world charm
Review: The Oriental is a classic old world river hotel. While some may say the place is a bit tired with older elevators, rooms and style that hasn't really changed for decades, it's probably still worth it. The thing that makes the Oriental special is the life that passes through. The hotel still has people sitting for tea, eating in the well-known restaurants, enjoying Jazz in the Bambu room, or just hanging out in the lobby. The service is best in class, and you will feel at home and have every need attended to. It is easy to access the Skytrain (BTS) at Saphan Taksin and also pick up a boat from the dock anywhere. The spa across the river is indulgent if you don't care about the price tag. If you want to be on the city side of the river in a classic best in class luxury, and still feel like you are in the scene of a 1960s movie, you can't really replace the Oriental. There are newer over the top hotels that are most beautiful, more extravagent, but none with the same activity that you find at the Oriental. If you want privacy and exclusivity, then there are other options better. But, i do love this hotel and there is something truly Bangkok about it. This is the only top end hotel at the river that can work if you need to go into central.

Review: entering the flower filled foyer of the mandarin oriental in bangkok for the first time is an entrancing experience. if you arrive in the early evening, a string quartet will be playing, perhaps vivaldi. the staff is genuinely concerned for your well being and the ambience of the surroundings will ensure you leave feeling relaxed and restored.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Great service; Quiet Location
Review: wonderful services from all departments. the only slight disappointment was the breakfast buffet. much pricier than other hotels that i've stayed but the quality and selection is average.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Traditional hotel with excellent service
Review: This is a traditional and stylish hotel. The swimming pool is superb. Excellent SPA and restaurants. Service is of the highest standard. I would say that the hotel lives on its reputation and there must be in town more modern hotels at better prices. The view from the room was one of the best in town.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Great service
Review: Best service and amenities. Great location. Excellent service for English speaking clients.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: One of the great hotels of the world
Review: I think that this is one of the greatest hotels I have experienced, Everything worked, The rooms had some charm and grace which more modern hoyel seem to lack. The food and service in the resturants was outstanding but not cheap. If you want a quality experience in Bangkok this is the place to stay.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Ultra high-end service and amenities
Review: From the hotel agent greeting at the airport to our midnight departure for an international flight, the Mandarin Oriental was all about service. The hotel staff's attention to our every need astounded me. On our last day we checked out at the usual time but had 12 hours before our flight left. The hotel staff made us feel at home in every way possible, including the use of all hotel facilities and even a room to shower, change our cloths and rest before leaving for the airport after a long day of shopping. The price of our room was probably near the top of the range for Agoda's special offers and it was worth every penny.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Great Experience
Review: I certainly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff was very helpful. The facilities were outstanding. I had heard that a trip to Bangkok was incomplete without staying at the Oriental. That certainly is true. I will probably stay there again some time in the future. I did not have enough time to use their swimming pool, but crossing the river on a barge for dinner was great. All is well with this hotel.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Beautiful Hotel, though a bit isolated
Review: the mandarin oriental bangkok is a great hotel, and has some great features like pool and shopping, but you have to take a taxi everywhere. for the money, if i stay again, i would go to a hotel more central to downtown and the sights to avoid the isolation and having to take a taxi everywhere.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Outstanding and very expensive
Review: beautiful and super delux. delightful staff. good location.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Every bit as good as we had hoped or
Review: Just loved the hotel and the location. Only disappointment was our meal in the Sala Rim Naam, which was sad as previously we had considered this to be the best Thai restaurant we had ever visited. Beds also very hard

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: 5 star hotel with 5 star service
Review: The concierge people are the best people to know whats good around Bangkok. They have all they hook ups and they definitely deserve that tip. Best place to mix business and leisure stay as the they are many areas where you can have informal meetings. Food there is excellent. It is definitely a nice feeling waking up to the view of the river and the bustling of the city.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Beautiful hotel and staff
Review: impeccable service. staff are awesome. attention to detail. love it!

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: A fabulous experience
Review: this is an exceptional hotel with so many memorable features and surprises. our deluxe room had a fantastic view from the ninth floor overlooking the river and in the direction of the city centre. orchids are a feature of the hotel decor and our room had three to admire each day. we were also treated to a daily surprise fruit bowl of exotic tropical fruit with information card and instructions for eating. our spacious, marble bathroom was particularly well equipped and our dressing area thoughtfully had both a his and her storage areas. the public areas provide interest, comfort and variety to satisfy all types. at night the lobby features a string quartet while after dinner you can enjoy jazz in the bamboo bar. the many restaurants offer a wonderful variety of dining experiences. nothing is too much trouble for the staff. for example on our last night we wished to dine in lord jim's seafood restaurant. we ere on a tight schedule but the staff arranged for us to see the menu late afternoon so that we could make selections and then at dinnertime have time to enjoy our meal without rushing. outside the swimming pools have been well designed. there is a shallow rectangular children's pool with comfortable seating all around for close supervision by parents. separated, the main pool area is obviously designed for adults.within its leafy surrounds, bangkok seems a million km away.

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Superior Hotel with more than helpful staff
Review: this is my second stay with the mandarin oriental and it felt like coming home. this time, i brought my husband along and he to was blown away with the beautiful surroundings, fantastic staff, perfect sized bath for a male over 6 foot and most importantly "that humungous bed". i felt like i was showing him "my place" and we also made use of the gym and facilities and i managed to make it to a yoga lesson, which i really enjoyed. thanks again to all of the friendly staff!

Address: 48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
NandA: Mandarin Oriental Bangkok ;48 Oriental Avenue, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10500
Title: Wonderful hotel with a fantastic service
Review: We were happy to stay there and had a great time we will come back as soon as possible and will use the spa and book the cooking class. It is an excepional feature "the check in". The staff is very tastfully dressed. all the bell boys were extremly polite especially one of them at the lift.

Do I have to drive back home and wait when they will finish the renovation?) She said she can offer upgrade to better room but finally no action on this. (Why saying its? but offer additional ABF that I haven't ask for) Not friendly Bellboy. It should has optional way to say "No valet parking service". While other 5 star hotels can handle better. Diiner time, waiting to be seat, but 2 staffs ignore me and talk to Western guest first who come later than me. Refurbishment is better word than Renovation coz many things still outdated and not functional such as the small basin.Only one side power socket for bedside. Poor breakfast.

NandA: Millennium Hilton Bangkok ;123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: Currently has Renovations
Review: This is great hotel in a great location, the staff were very friendly and professional. With the COVID crisis going on, we got a very nice room for an excellent price. However, be warned the hotel is currently undergoing renovations. The entire downstairs lobby (ground floor) is a construction site. However we didn't hear any noise in our rooms (the view is excellent). The outdoor rooftop bar was also closed which was disappointing (even though it wasn't raining at the time). So, if you go at the moment, please understand the hotel is currently under renovations (due to finish in November apparently). We also recommend the spa in the hotel, we had a very nice aromatherapy massage.

NandA: Millennium Hilton Bangkok ;123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: Good
Review: 1. Normal guests are made to feel too inferior to "executive guests". 2. Pool opens quite late ..... 10am. 3. Sink not draining and hotel could not repair over 3 day stay....difficult because had baby and needed working sink. 4. Turned off fountain in foyer when fewer guests. 5. Cancelled shuttle boat service to Taksin pier....quite a hastle and causing more expense. 6. Reheated bacon and pancakes for breakfast. 7. Baby cot dirty 8. Would not collect bags from room for check out. This hotel has a 5 star look but a 3 star feel. There are too many facilities only available to "executive" guests. Strongly advise people to book somewhere a little more unique. "THIS IS NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL"

NandA: Millennium Hilton Bangkok ;123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: As fun time, but...
Review: The staff was kind, helpful and friendly, but the hotel was definitely affected by construction and Covid. The check-in process was extremely lengthy and time consuming and The facilities were mostly closed (3 of 4 restaurants). The pool which had stunning views, had mildew caking the bottom. It would be an easy clean, but it was a bit unsettling. The room service was extremely overpriced and had a very limited menu, but again, that might change for the better when Covid becomes less of a threat. The snacks and drinks in the mini bar were fairly reasonably priced.

Address: 123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
NandA: Millennium Hilton Bangkok ;123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: Great infra and views but with bad mgmt, pray you won't come at peak hour or need service
Review: As they put on their site the hotel lobby is largely under renovation. However note that their roof top restaurant is also closed for service. Their spa service is outdoors only. Do Not check in between 2-5pm. They do not know how to manage pre-booked reservations will be a 1-2 hour wait while they process each applicant 10 minutes per room. Avoid breakfast peak hours too. But great views and room. Had a problem with cold water in the room strangely but hopefully you won't be as unlucky.

Address: 123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
NandA: Millennium Hilton Bangkok ;123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: Premium King Room was great, amenities not so much
Review: They are still renovating the place. First thing you'll notice when you enter the lobby. Food: Flow restaurant was not available. The Chinese restaurant was full during dinner time when we inquired at 3.30PM, so if you're planning to have a nice meal call a day or two in advance to make a reservation. The Picnic Hamper at 360 rooftop was great though. The Lantern pastries were great. The breakfast buffet was fresh. Overall, the food was great. POOL: The pool was a bit outdated, the tiles were worn out, the roof as well. It needs renovation too. The beach/pool bean bags and seats were not that clean. We needed to turn the cushion over because there were bird poop on it. Room: King Premium had enough space for two. It was well taken care of, and cleaned. Except the mini bar had dust on it so did the side table and phone. The bathroom was huge with a separate shower, and tub. It was clean. I had asked for the river view room, and they granted it. They also let us check out late at 2pm. Spa: You can opt to have a massage in the Spa or by the pool. I had it by the pool. It was great. Fresh air, and the masseuse was good too. Location: Its a bit hard to go there if you wanna go around Bangkok as its by the river. If you plan on doing a staycation (living in Bangkok) and just want to stay in the hotel, then it's a good option to be in. For one night it's a good deal, however, I feel the whole hotel was outdated. They really need to renovate everything. The rooms are good to stay in though.

Address: 123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
NandA: Millennium Hilton Bangkok ;123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: Executive rooms are well worth the money
Review: My boyfriend and I wanted to have a resort experience, and booked this hotel. Although not quite a resort experience, we chose the executive king room and the additional services exceeded our expectations. The room wasn't oversized but could easily accommodate four people. Privacy is their priority and we felt it. Room service and cleaning was available 24 hrs and very prompt. The hotel staff were eager to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Our first room was next to a family with a screaming baby and the staff moved us within 5 minutes with the same amazing window view and amenities. We only left the hotel twice in three days to explore the area, but the hotel had everything we needed. Food was great in the common area but the rooftop bar experience and executive lounge is where we spent most of our time (aside from the whirlpool bathtub in the room and pool/gym downstairs). The exec lounge had free snacks throughout the day with evening drinks (all you can drink wine/beer).

NandA: Millennium Hilton Bangkok ;123 Charoennakorn Road, Klongsan, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: Good base to enjoy Chao Pra Riverside
Review: Pros. Very convenient just next to Icon Siam to enjoy the wonderful fountain show. Has its private boat shuttke that leaves for Central Pier every half hour to transfer to BTS or boat shuttke including Asiatique. Chinatown, Khaosan Road ir can go Iconsiam to other free shuttle boats. A VERY good base to enjoy riverside and save lots of tine from jams. Quiet, nice view. In house spa is good . Relaxing breakfast area and lobby. Wifi very strong. Got steam bath, sauna and a small jacuzzi. Nice pkace to sip coffee and tea in afternoon to enjoy the riverside CONs. The hotel Chinese Food is overally rated and over priced. Breakfast spread is suffice slant towards common food nothing premium expected from 5 star. Spa rate is quite stiff.. Hotel is in exclusive location, so you have eat and enjoy outside before return as hotel itself nothing much. Surrounding become quiet after 10 pm wgen Icon Siam shuts Pool is very small and shallow, no lap pool no pool landscape.

Title: Modern Japanese-style hotel
Review: I stayed there for one night but I was happy. The place is beautiful and my room was very modern. The design makes the room look simple and smooth but there are many drawers and cupboards hidden all over the place. The staff were very professional, polite and serve you well. The fitness room has many modern work-out equipment. The Japanese breakfast set was delicious and the restaurant has a good atmosphere and good staff. I would suggest that it should have its own business center, more power outlets in the room and the curtain to cover the glass window of the bathroom in case that the people who stay in the same room are not couples. Overall, highly recommended.

Address: 27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: Hotel Nikko Bangkok ;27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: Do not stay at the Nikko Bangkok
Review: I just spent 2 days there and it was terrible. They advertise all the usual things you would expect from a 5 star hotel but don't provide them. I understand the covid situation is difficult, but they should update the website to show what's actually available. They advertise multiple restaurants but only 1 is open, so your dining choices are Japanese or Japanese. When I checked in I was informed there was no room service, no buffet breakfast. They do provide a set menu breakfast but apart from the toast it was inedible. Cold coffee and bad food. They advertise afternoon tea, but that's not available either, in fact almost none of the things you would expect. This hotel is operating with a skeleton staff and it shows. I went downstairs to try to talk to a member of staff at 9pm and it took me 10 minutes of searching before I could find one single staff member. To be fair, when I complained about the lack of facilities they 'upgraded' me to a better room, however the room was not significantly different. It was ok, but the toilet was so small you could not even turn around (no exaggeration). Finally, I had a small accident that left some blood on the sheets and 2 small spots on one of their bathrobes. I soaked the sheets and the blood came out, I didn't even notice the blood on the robe. However, they claim the bathrobe cannot be cleaned and tried to charge me 5,000 baht for a new one. I could buy that robe (minus the Nikko crest) for 1000 thb in Home pro. We eventually 'agreed' I would pay 2,000 thb. I am a retired Airline Captain and have stayed in 5 star hotels all over the world but have never had to deal with anything like this. Overall this was a miserable experience. There are many wonderful hotels in Bangkok, so do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else.

Title: Would not honor meal inclusion deals
Review: I booked this under meal inclusions of breakfast and dinner, for 2 nights. As you would expect, we should be entitled to 2 breakfast meals and 2 dinner meals as per the conditions listed. However, when we arrive at the hotel and check-in, front desk informed us that we can only have dinner once, and not two times for the two nights booked. Mind you, this condition was not at all listed in agoda when you book. After that situation, staff treated me terribly. All in all, I didn't get what I paid for - what a disappointment.

Title: Comfortable and conveniently located
Review: Can't beat this location easily. Literally next to BTS sky train station and in the famous neighborhood full of restaurants and bars. The hotel itself even has a restaurant/spa/service floors called Ginza Thonglor. The room is crisp clean with high-quality bathroom amenities from an upscale Thai spa brand. Love the rainshower next to a bathtub. Pillow, bedsheet, towel are all clean with mild nice fragrant. An extra bed, if you ask, is so strong and comfortable that it can be a good bed at other hotels! This is what I'm impressed the most. Really unexpected.

Title: Wonderful!

The breakfast was delicious, as was the cafe, and the Japanese restaurants on two of the levels were a welcome discovery. The neighbourhood was wonderful but above all, the staff and service were top notch. We will definitely be back.

Title: Wonderful hotel
Review: I stayed in more than 20 different hotels in BKK, overall I give the highest score for Hotel Nikko, excellent location, the breakfast is the best among the others. Price is reasonable. In room decorations and facilities are new and well-equipped. I ordered room service as well, foods was delicious too. The only thing not perfect is the small swimming pool.

Address: 27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: Hotel Nikko Bangkok ;27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: UNEXPECTED
Review: The staffs are very welcoming and courteous, working efficiently, provide luggage storage service and shower room is also provided after check-out if you need some refreshment before going to the airport. The hotel room is very clean and comfortable, and there is an option you can choose your own pillow, this is fantastic. The toilet is clean and the water pressure is good. Option to have breakfast in different restaurants, either Japanese or international breakfasts. Very close to the BTS station with elevator, there are many Japanese restaurants and massage centers, coffee house around the hotel and a must-eat mango sticky rice. Will definitely stay at this hotel on my next trip to Bangkok

Title: Good location
Review: The pool was ice cold, so the kids couldn‚Äôt enjoy it. Neither could the adults! The pool was closed for 2 afternoon/evenings due to functions. It would have been helpful for the staff to inform guests of this upon check in. The rooms were clean, the floor of the pool deck and terrace was filthy. Our shoes were sticking to the floor and the kids bare feet were black. It seems like the outdoor area needs a good clean. The buffet and Japanese breakfasts were great and so were the staff on duty. There‚Äôs a juice bar at the international breakfast that was a nice touch, and the coffee was good. The hotel is located next to a subway station and several 7/11‚Äôs, so it‚Äôs very convenient. The street is filled with Japanese restaurants. FYI: the massage places all around the hotel are 4 times cheaper than the Just Relax spa on the 3rd floor. Overall, the hotel is nice, friendly staff and delicious food.

Address: 27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: Hotel Nikko Bangkok ;27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: Average
Review: The hotel is clean. Some staffs are amazing and very kind to children. But some of them are clueless and unhelpful. Not value for money, because the location is not good, a bit rough nearby, not good for family with children. And we saw a lot of rats along the road! Avoid the cafe and restaurants at Ginza:( Moreover, the facilities are not good, the pool and the guys are so small and the pool bar closes early even on new year even and new year day. The room is clean and good. But the housekeeper just clear the rubbish bin everyday but never refill all amenities and bottled water properly. We always need to call and ask for them. One night, the power went off at 2am and all sockets didn‚Äôt work. Thank god they sent someone to fix it. Breakfast is just ok, overrated. We go to Bangkok very often, this one is just average. Overpriced for everything.

Title: Great stay with a with a somehow unfortunate ending
Review: Nice, super clean rooms, delicious breakfast, very nice located at the very beginning of vibrant ThongLo. My stay was five nights, after check out I was asking if it would be possible to take a shower at the evening because my flight was after midnight, when I returned after a long day in the city - fitness area was already closed 10pm and I couldn't take a shower anymore - reception confirmed me in the morning that showers are open till midnight. So I was told I could change in the restroom, what for a five star hotel is just embarrassing.

Review: Good location just 5mins walk from BTS Thong lo station. Lots of choice for massage and food nearby. Staffs were super nice and helpful. Room was spacious. Delicious breakfast with Western, Japanese and Thai styles, the fresh juice bar was wonderful. Although Gym room was fair, 24hrs open was a highlight. We enjoyed the swimming pool, it was clean and not crowded. But one of the morning swimming pool was closed without notice in advanced, a bit disappointed cause we woke up early and dressed with swimming suit but only realised when reached the pool. Overall, this hotel is highly recommended.

Title: New hotel with v good staff
Review: The hotel is conveniently located within short walking distance from BTS station. The room is spacious and clean. The toilet seat is installed with automatic cleaning system, like that in Japan. The buffet breakfast has large variety of food and acceptable taste. The Chief concierge Mr Sompob is extremely helpful with good English and manner. He has volunteered to find information related to Thailand immigration from official website for me, which is well beyond his responsibilities. I have not encountered such great hotel staff like him. I will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Address: 27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: Hotel Nikko Bangkok ;27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: A little disappointed...
Review: Booked 1 high floor corner room (higher priced), and 2 regular rooms. Check-in at 9p.m. The front desk told me that the hotel is fully booked so they put us all on the same 11th floor for our convenience, even when I paid more for the higher corner room. I was unhappy but I accept what he did and went up to my room. My room, and one of the other room are fine, but one of the regular room the staff did not know it still has other traveler staying in the room. So my family member went back down to the front desk. The same front desk that told me the hotel was full, and my high floor corner room is not available, fix the problem by upgrading their room to a higher floor corner room. I was speechless... too hungry and tired to argue with the hotel.

Address: 27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: Hotel Nikko Bangkok ;27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: A little disappointed...
Review: I have purchased 2 regular priced rooms, and 1 higher priced high floor corner room for me and my family. 2 people per room. When I check-in the hotel around 8p.m. the front desk told me the hotel is fully book, they placed all 3 rooms on the same floor. I told the front desk that I paid for the higher price for the higher floor. The staff said they could not do anything, they do not have any more rooms available. I was too tired to argue, so I just accept the room and went to my room. For the regular rooms, 1 room is fine, like it was described online, my family does not have any problem with it. And the other regular room, the staff said they accidently placed them in the room which still have other traveler inside. To solve this problem, my family's regular room was upgraded to a higher floor corner room, which they told me in the first place that the hotel was fully booked and the one I purchased was not available. I was too tired to go down to the front desk to ask for refund.

Address: 27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: Hotel Nikko Bangkok ;27 Soi Sukhumvit 55 (Thonglor), Sukhumvit Road, Klongton Nua, Wattana, Bangkok Thailand 10110, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: Staff extremely polite and helpful
Review: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights because of its good location, close to BTS and have plenty of good restaurants nearby. On one afternoon, I left my backpack in the ground floor public sitting area, and totally have it forgotten. Only on the next morning, I found I have my backpack lost somewhere. It was fortunate that I got an envelop with a memo inserted inside my room, informing me that my backpack was found and have been stored in the reception counter, and safely kept by the Manager. Many thanks to all staff hotel staff of Nikko. If they didn't picked up my backpack, identifying it was mine, and tell me to get it back from the Manager, my trip in Bangkok would have been a nightmare. Once again, many many thanks to all staff in Hotel Nikko Bangkok.

Title: Lack of hospitality.
Review: Well, The hotel itself is new but far from 5star Hotel.disappointing receptionist.They are very rude for customer. No smile, They don't know even the proper way of greeting.This hotel is operating by Japanese right? Teach some omotenashi attitude for Thai staff. They are arrogant except one male receptionist who handled my checking in process.Morning buffet also disappointing. room is super small. water pressure is weak. the water doesn't come out very well. No minibar, it's order style. overall, I hate this hotel. My stay in here, it was not what I expected. it disappointed me.I will never ever stay here again. AVOID!!

Title: Great Service, strongly recommend
Review: It's my boyfriend's birthday while we were staying at the hotel. The hotel has prepared birthday card and mini-cake for us without any additional charge, such a warm greeting! Very clean room and superior service. The buffet breakfast was very nice that I'd strongly recommend to try at least once. The only thing that can be improved is the hotel facility (as I remember the gym room was not free-of-charge and the spa was quite expensive). The hotel is located at another side of the river that you need to take hotel's shuttle boat to-and-from the pier. Waiting time is 10-20min, which I think it's acceptable. All in all, it's a very nice hotel and I'd recommend to stay.

Title: Exceptional
Review: Good service. Staff are very polite and help. Free activities such as Thai boxing, stretch & Stress relief, Boot Camp Exercise and morning Yoga. Boat services to BTS station, Iconsiam, Asiatique and River City. Overall is worth money to stay.

Address: Siam Chaophraya Holdings, 333 Charoennakorn Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
NandA: The Peninsula Bangkok ;Siam Chaophraya Holdings, 333 Charoennakorn Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: Beautiful hotel on the Chao Phraya River
Review: We spent a weekend at The Peninsula in Bangkok. The hotel is on the west side of the river bank and has a free ferry that can get you to the other side or to other boat terminals. The rooms are classic and views (at least in the corner rooms) are panoramic. The service is attentive, and the employees are very welcoming. We ate breakfast there each morning and appreciated the plethora of more unique breakfast options (from beet juice to goji berries and everything in between) but would have loved some more Thai dishes.

Title: Enormous rooms, attentive staff. [NOTE - half of pool is closed until end of May 2019]
Review: The rooms of this hotels are exceptional. They are are enormous, with space for a sitting area, work desk, walk in wardrobe and bathroom that fits two with space for more. Each room has an angled nook with long views over the river and city. Food is tasty - expensive - but lots of options and enjoyable flavours. Spa and Gym are extensive. Gym has steam and sauna, with plunge pool next door. Big warning. Half the pool is closed for re- tiling until end of May. There is still a sizeable part of the pool open. But on busy days it gets hard to find an open deck chair. Especially if you have a group.

Address: Siam Chaophraya Holdings, 333 Charoennakorn Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
NandA: The Peninsula Bangkok ;Siam Chaophraya Holdings, 333 Charoennakorn Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: The pool alone makes it worth it
Review: It's one of the nicest pools I've ever seen and the setting, right along the river surrounded by tropical plants and trees, is pretty fantastic. Rooms are fine but a bit dated (technology in the rooms feels like late 90s/early 2000s) but the views are great. At $200+ a night, they are certainly not a bargain by Bangkok standards, even amount 5 stars, but worth the splurge for pool and location. Also, Mei Jing, their Chinese restaurant, has some of the best dim sum I've had anywhere in the world, and Thiptara, designed around an old wooden Thai house, with candlelit tables right on the river, is one of the most magical dining settings I've ever seen.

NandA: The Peninsula Bangkok ;Siam Chaophraya Holdings, 333 Charoennakorn Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: Very good service but it‚Äôs getting out-dated
Review: The staff were very nice and helpful. We arrived at around 12:30pm, supposingly the check-in time is 2pm but they let us take the room right away. They also asked proactively the time of our departure flight and extended our check out time instantly, very impressive. The staff and service were extra-ordinary. It was good from asking for toilet paper, late night drinks and in-room dinning service, they were all very nice. Just that the building itself is getting out, we could smell the bad smell of wooden floorboard and furniture right after getting into the room. There‚Äôs WiFi everywhere in the hotel but the setup in the room made us felt it‚Äôs getting out-dated. But for those who missed the setting of 80s-90s, Penninsula is still a very good choice.

Address: Siam Chaophraya Holdings, 333 Charoennakorn Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
NandA: The Peninsula Bangkok ;Siam Chaophraya Holdings, 333 Charoennakorn Road, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10600
Title: Location, pool and service great. Food only OK
Review: This is an impressive hotel. Great views over the water and the city. Rooms are big and well stocked. Staff are attentive. Swimming pool is large and shaded. A world class hotel. We live in Bangkok, and booked here as a staycation. Enjoyed it immensely. Only note is that the food was underwhelming, especially for the price. The food served by the pool was good but not great. The pizza and hamburgers at the riverside restaurant in the evening were low in flavour. Need more seasoning (or better ingredients). The buffet breakfast is expansive - but I have had better at other five star hotels. Lastly we tried the Sunday brunch. Lots of highlights here - the beef, seafood options (especially oysters) and cheese were amazing. But desert options limited and disappointing. We'll be back - but will eat dinner across the river at a competitor

Title: Disappointing
Review: Having in mind it is not the cheapest hotel around one would expect much more for the money paid. We had an awful experience with the taxi driver which was not their fault of course, however once we reached the hotel three employees were standing outside not being able to speak any English and help us out with the taxi driver! The room was ok, however the shower was not working. When we called the reception they sent a technician without sending a house keeping after that to clean. So my husband had to clean himself on his birthday!!! That was outrageous. Safe box- not working also. For two days all we could hear was how much the stuff were feeling sorry and no one did anything! We would never stay there again and I would never recommend this hotel! Extremely disappointing!

Pool itself is a heavenly oasis. Views or river action & skyline from upper rooms are like performance art!

Review: I personally feel there's nothing to wow about this hotel. The food ran out fast with refill being slow. But after the new year holiday, the crowd was thinner and the service was much better. The location is near to Asiatique but there's nothing to shop at Asiatique now.

Breakfast was delicious and high quality and the staff was very helpful with our special diet's requirements. The entire service was prodfessional and attentive and we were very happy that we choosed this hotel for our 4 days visit to Bangkok.

Title: Weekend staycation
Review: The hotel itself is nicely decorated, rooms are great and facilities are good. The food for breakfast included a good range and the hotel accommodated my request for soya milk and gluten free bread. I also really enjoyed the view from the 15th floor over cocktails one evening and breakfast the next two days. The restaurant staff were great, warm and polite. However, I found the reception staff to be unhelpful. It immediately put me off when upon checkin they insisted on a 3,000b deposit. The money itself didn‚Äôt bother me but to be told that I wouldn‚Äôt get the money refunded for upto a month if I paid on debit card really put me off. As a result I had to get money out of the cash machine onsite. In addition, on the Friday night I requested some soya milk so I could have an evening drink and was told there‚Äôs a 7/11 round the corner and to go there. I found this really unhelpful. No offer to find me any. I ended up checking with the restaurant (as it was on my floor) and she said they didn‚Äôt have any in stock but she would make sure it was there the next day. I also found the location a bit far away down the river. The boat currently finishes at 6pm. However, a taxi to Thonburi is around 70b and bike taxis are by Saphan Taksin station and cost around 40b so not too bad. Also, point to mention not all the restaurants are open at the moment.

Title: Limited review options as stayed during COVID19
Review: We have booked the hotel for our wedding anniversary. As it was during the COVID19 pandemic, we, of course, could not use the facilities like the pool or the massage. The staff was friendly and polite. The food was good. The room was rather old already and the renovated bathroom was a little weird with all the shower curtains wrapped around you. It was quite narrow but we had the option of a bathtub as well. The view from the room was beautiful and that was actually why we have booked it in the first place.

Title: Dissapointed by lack of service
Review: We arrived by car, but at the hotel there was no employee outside to help and inform us. Only after some minutes someone poppes up. It seems there was a happy hour at our floor but we were not informed. No boatservice these days available so there was a van service created, this not worked well. On our way back to the hotel from iconsiam we called the hotel we were on our way to the meetingpoint . They answered, call again once we arrived there, so we did. After our call it took about one hour before the van arrived. Nice to wait one hour in the rain pfffff. There was trafficjam they said, but they obvious not had the idea to sent the van in advance after our first call... Btw we called about 3 times but they only saying, the van is on his way. very unprofessional !!!!!

Title: Good Views and Quiet
Review: I only did a one night staycation just to relax this place did not disappoint. I booked a river view room with access to the executive lounge and breakfast. Room was clean and cozy, staff were excellent and very attentive, the food was quality and no complaints. They did a great job with the COVID-19 requirements and the Agoda discount made it well worth the stay. The only disappointment was not having the pool open but I did see they were doing some renovations to it. Plan on booking another staycation again soon, maybe for 2-3 days next time.

It is away from the drama of downtown but close enough to enjoy everything. You can take the boar up the river to see all of the Wats and for an interesting little trip.

Address: 2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
NandA: Ramada Plaza Bangkok Menam Riverside ;2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
Title: Excellent service
Review: The staff are excellent - really helpful and attentive. The location is good - on the riverside next to Asiatique. Make sure you book a room with club lounge access. We stay in lots of hotels, but usually prefer to be out exploring during the day. However, we stayed here during the COVID19 pandemic so ended up making the most of the facilities available at the hotel, while the city was on lockdown. The executive lounge is great value for money - you get a lovely breakfast, afternoon tea and free cocktails from 1800 - 2000 hours. The staff don't let your plate/glass get empty and are always asking if there is anything extra they can do to help. Based on the staff, I can't recommend this hotel enough. We live in Bangkok but still chose to stay here for a bit of a treat.

NandA: Ramada Plaza Bangkok Menam Riverside ;2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
Title: Nice stay in tubulent times...
Review: We have stayed here for the third time in the last few years and even if we would have liked the rooms to be in better condition, we can recommend this hotel. We stayed here during the Corona crisis and I would like to thank the management and staff once again. Although everything on the the pool, the gym and the restaurant had to be shut down by authorities, the best possible was done here and the support could not have been more loving and friendly. Even the general manager spoke to all of the guests, offered his help and took care of our wellbeing. It was a great relief in this tense time.

Address: 2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
NandA: Ramada Plaza Bangkok Menam Riverside ;2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
Title: Great stay in difficult times
Review: We stayed here just as Thailand went into semi lockdown for the covid 19 pandemic as we were waiting for a flight to get us home. The hotel was handling the situation very well and everything was being cleaned regularly and there was hand gel everywhere. Its hard to rate alot of the services as everything had to be closed (gym,spa,pool, etc) but they all looked very good and i would stay again in the future just to be able to try them out!! The location by the river is great and our room was amazing with beautiful views. Huge room with the nicest bed ever and the bath was so lovely to soak in! Breakfast was pretty good despite them scaling it right back as there was barely any guests and then even when they had to move it to the club lounge they tried their best to still have decent options. We had club lounge benefits and it is so worth it, lovely big area with fantastic views, great afternoon tea and lovely evening food and drinks, way more than nibbles thats for sure, we certainly never needed anything more and we are vegetarian so had limited options! I do hope the hotel gets through these difficult times as the staff there were so so amazing, even helping me find a run route around the hotel grounds so i could do my training, such wonderful people. Will go back when the world has got through these difficult times.

Title: Exceptional
Review: Nice river view hotel, conveniently accessible with free shuttle boat to Saphan Taksin pier. The hotel might be dated but they have recently refurbished it, the room looks new and everything was in perfect order. The Executive Lounge serves good variety of food and drinks and all staff here are top notch. I can feel their hospitality the moment I checked in. Will definitely be back here on my next trip to Bangkok.

Address: 2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
NandA: Ramada Plaza Bangkok Menam Riverside ;2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
Title: Perfect stay, amazing staff
Review: We stayed at Ramada Plaza Bangkok Menam Riverside for 3 nights. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. First of all, we could check in much earlier than the normal time. After having traveled for 15 hours this was incredibly appreciated by the whole exhausted family. Moreover, when I had twisted my ankle severly while temple hopping, the staff went out of their way to help me, arranged a hospital visit and checked how I was doing. The complimentary fruit basket while spending a whole day in the hotel room was definitely the highlight of the stay. The hotel is very close to the ferry stop which will take you to the temples and the Grand Palace and also to a very lively shopping mall. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Address: 2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120

Title: Very nice place
Review: Beautiful hotel nicely decorated, lobby area was massive and comfortable, tropical pool area with lots of greenery, breakfast was great , rooms spacious clean and well equipped, we had booked two one bedroom suites and one standard room , one of the suites was for a old person on wheelchair, when checked in found out that bathroom door was too small to drive the wheelchair into the bathroom ( not standard size ) therefore requested for alternative choice to solve this problem , hotel manager was unhelpful he requested us to be upgraded to executive sweet and pay the difference although I explained to front office staff that it was not out fault and I had already mentioned in my request that we had a wheelchair person with us at the end I insisted to remove the bathroom door as a solution he refused but later he preferred to do this rather than upgrading our room this was very disappointing specially when you have booked three rooms for food number if days ( very unprofessional )

Title: Location is not convenient, too far from the center
Review: Hotel is clean, nice, good services. Breakfast is very good. It‚Äôs rated correctly as 5 stars. However location is too far near end of the river, nothing to do and to see there. Main entrance near busy street, condominium, it‚Äôs dirty, the street is not recommended for walking, sightseeing, especially with kids. But there‚Äôs 2 Great restaurants near by the hotel. Dont eat in the chinese Restaurant in the hotel, 10x more expensive than outside. We walked in, checked the menu, than walked out. Estimated we wouldn‚Äôt have to pay more than 1000 US dollars for a dinner for family for 7. No, thank you. A fancy seafood dinner outside only under $200. The hotel provides free tuk tuk to Asiatique, 5 mins drive, 15-20 mins walk but dont walk, unsafe street, and dirty. Free boat to bts Taskin. From this pier, you can take boat to iconsiam, to grand palace, watpho, wat Arun, and use bts line to erawan shrine. Recommend to stay in hotel near iconsiam. Beautiful, fun in this middle area of the river.

Address: 2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
NandA: Ramada Plaza Bangkok Menam Riverside ;2074 Charoenkrung Road Soi 72/4, Wat Praya Krai, Bangkholaem, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10120
Title: Great hotel by the river
Review: This is a super hotel, I don't normally stay by the river preferring to stay near Sukhumvit, but very glad I gave this hotel a try. We stayed in the Royal Thai Suite on the Executive floor which gives you access to the Executive lounge, this entitles you to complementary drinks and afternoon tea each day, you can also have your breakfast here each morning which is quieter than the main restaurant downstairs. The rooms are wonderful with your own lounge and a spacious bedroom, with fantastic views of the Choa Phraya river. The staff are excellent, friendly and attentive. There is a lovely pool downstairs, unfortunately I didn't have time to use it. There is a free shuttle boat service that takes you to Saphan Taksin, from here you can get the sky train into downtown. Asiatique is also a 5 minute walk from the hotel and is great to visit for shopping and has a good selection of places to eat, open from 4pm every evening. This is a Great hotel by the river.

We did not try breakfast and we not regret about it once we walked pass and notice how many guests there.

Title: Above average
Review: I would like to share my 1 night experience in this hotel. It was far from what I have expected. My booking was done 1 day in advance with notification of the late check -in . We arrived the hotel at 23:00 pm , room still not ready and needed to wait almost 30 min. Then went to the room and we can not open the door due to the key was failed to operate. We went back to the frontdesk , the technician came to inspect and found that the key was mul-function. The technician opened the room using another key ( The key that can open very room) and then left to fix a key . After waiting for more than 30 min. We went back to the front desk again to ask for the key but not get it. After back to the room 15-20 min. then the technician bought the key for us. This hotel is located in the very good location, but majority failure in management and maintenance of the facilities.

Title: Stayed one night, lovely large room with river view.
Review: We stayed one night on the 9th floor which was very spacious and clean. Had lovely views of the river and the bridge. The hotel is very quiet with large restaurant and outdoor dinning area overlooking the river which was very nice. Bell boys very helpful in arranging taxis, although you will need to use google translate as English is very limited. The streets near the hotel were not very nice and would not feel safe walking around there so we took a taxi to our Wat Arun which was not too far.

NandA: The Royal River Hotel ;219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
Title: One night stay at the hotel
Review: The hotel entrence was fine, walls look very old fashioned, but for the price we paid it seemed pretty decent. Pros are clean, and peaceful room, with the nice view of the river. BREAKFAST was the best part for us with variety of choices. Cons. Very unplesent staff. The bellboy was nice to us, but showed no respect towarda the Chinese ppl, which we didn't like. He made some coments in Thai,so they couldn't understand him.He was very unhappy that few Chinese needed to enter the elevator with us as he was showing us the room.Chinese were just left behind to find their room by themselves?! In the morning guy who was working in the brekfast area had a sassy attitude while serving us our gift drinks. After when my friend has asked him if he can take a mug with his coffee into the room he said no.When he asked to get a plastic glass, so he can finish his coffee in the room he said YES, just because he was lazy to bring a glass. If you're a group of Chinese don't come here, everybody else ok

Address: 219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
NandA: The Royal River Hotel ;219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
Title: Clean, amazing views, great breakfast
Review: Breath taking view of the river and sun rise if you wake early enough. Rooms are clean and to a good standard. I booked the premier river view room which had a balcony but no bath tub as advertised, and the staff kindly upgraded me to the 9th floor with a bath and dual aspect Windows on the room and bathroom. Having a bath watching the river was amazing! There are ferries that go from very close connecting you to khao san and all destinations. Cable tv had 3 English channels (not great viewing though) and the usb point on the tv had been disabled. Wasn't an issue as wifi was great so just used my phone. Note that no one spoke much English, but nothing Google translate couldn't sort. 24 hour room service available and quiet restaurant downstairs for dinner with reasonable prices. Included breakfast buffet was great, fresh eggs cooked to order, big selection of fruits, cereals, beans, potato, pastries, salad and Thai food. Also fresh ground coffee and pot coffee. I would stay again
