Title: Hotel overlooks the river. Perfect place to relax after a long haul flight. It is slightly away the
Review: Hotel overlooks the river. Perfect place to relax after a long haul flight. It is slightly away from the shopping. Nevertheless the river ferry can take you to most places. The neighborhood is frequented by locals. This gives you an opportunity to observe Thai life. Breakfast was excellent.

Address: 219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
NandA: The Royal River Hotel ;219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
Title: Acceptable
Review: Great Breakfast, Good staff. Only had hot water 2 out of 11 nights. The shower didn't want to drain until you were almost done. The Tum was perfectly white, so when the yellow, slight brown tinge of water came out, well didn't us the tub. Tile in shower and bathroom had been dissolving away, leaving odd shaped little holes/crevices. No free WiFi in Room, I booked 2 days before my friends, and they got a WiFi package of sign-in cards each for every day they were there. Housekeeping was good, but possibly lacking staff. They didn't have any set time they would clean your room. One day it was 10am, another not till 4pm, another 2pm, Noon, just all over times. Location on the river is nice. Being so far from everything else, taxis didn't exactly know where the hotel was. Some drivers plain said no to a trip there. Our best option was to taxi to BTS and take the sky train. Still add an easy hour to going to and another hour coming back from anywhere more tourist. The one, almost in charge bellhop, wouldn't let go we didn't want to go to a fabric shop, or taylor even if we didn't buy anything. "Free trip there and back." After couple days stopped asking us finally. Pool? Yes, lacking in upkeep and cleaning. Although was after a few hard rain storms. It was fine for the tour & class groups where everything was planned. Everyday they had destinations planned for those groups. As staying there not in a large, 40-50 people group, not worth the trouble. Stay close to more walking and BTS areas.

Title: Excellent hotel in great location
Review: Stayed here five nights and liked it more each day. An under the radar hotel with many good things going for it: great location on the Chao Phraya River, excellent breakfast buffet, friendly and helpful staff, super swimming pool, nice wedding/banquet facilities, spacious rooms, and attractive price. Only a couple negatives: Chinese tour groups are noisy but they are only around in earlier morning or later evening, and sometimes hot water is lacking. I would recommend to anyone to stay here. An excellent value for the money....

NandA: The Royal River Hotel ;219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
Title: Comfortable stay for those who want to go to Yan Hee hospital
Review: The room was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was very good.Toilet could more cleaner. Amenities were satisfying but no robes . If there was a hand shower would be much easier especially if you don't want to wet your face after surgery as the hotel is very close to Yan Hee hospital. The river view was nice from the balcony. Quite comfortable stay , staffs were helpful but at times quite pushy to sale the hotel cars or some packages. Should improve TV channels as most of them are in Thai language.

Address: 219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
NandA: The Royal River Hotel ;219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
Title: Royal River
Review: We have stayed at the Royal River twice in the past on recommendations and were very happy with it but now, ten years later, I cannot say the same. The grounds and location are still lovely but even though we had a deluxe Riverfront room it was shabby. Carpets are old throughout. Front desk was very disorganized and did not used to be. Internet and wifi were poor and only in the lobby which is not acceptable these days. I had huge problems trying to contact the hotel directly from their own website to book and was only able to book through a booking agency. Despite 6 emails I did not get one response from the hotel staff. We used to look forward to the beautiful buffet breakfast and found it very limited now and below standard from the past. I felt if you were not on a Chinese tour you did not rate. We will not stay again.

Address: 219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
NandA: The Royal River Hotel ;219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
Title: Royal River Hotel
Review: The Hotel is quite aged, but well kept and clean. Well positioned for river boats, the breakfast buffet has enough choice in foods to keep most happy, bacon missing but sliced ham was aplenty, the Thai foods were really good with the pork in black pepper with vegetables the best ive had, and we lived in Thailand for 17 years! Also a nice surprise was the bread pudding with vanilla custard, proper brewed coffee all in all an excellent breakfast. At the Restraunt Fangnam, it was good to see our Chinese cousins have their own buffet setup where they can shout and yell out of hearing reach. Lots of Chinese who are quite noisy at all hours, have no respect for others the corridors at times sound like a fish market. All in all a good value for money Hotel. 711 close by, and an excellent Thai Restraunt half way between the Hotel and 711 Thai prices, clean and the menu dishes are all over the wall in A4 size colour photos. I would stay again if I had a need to visit the same area. 10 Minutes and a 60bt taxi ride to Yanhee Hospital. Derek.

Wi-fi is now available free in the Lobby area at last. Ideal if you do not want to stay in the centre of Bangkok but easily accessible by riverbus.

Title: Old World Luxury on the Chao Phaya River
Review: this older building fronting the river has been lovingly cared for and updated as necessary... it's like a throw back to the luxury of old hotels... great breakfast buffets come with the room and we found their Thai dinners were better than we found nearly anywhere... this coming from my Thai husband!

Address: 219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
NandA: The Royal River Hotel ;219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
Title: Three Night Stay
Review: The hotel is large,and has a certain stateliness. The room, which had a large balcony over-looking the river, was enormous. Everything about the hotel gave the impression that it had been built when land was cheaper in Bangkok, and at that time ago it was quite grand. The staff are helpful, and business like. However, the whole place needs money spent on it. The owners have not kept it up to standard. The room ceiling lighting did not work at all, and so it was too dark. The buffet breakfast was served in the restaurant, so you could not eat on the out-door terrace beside the river. In fact, they did not seem to take advantage of being right on the river at all. The Wi-fi only worked in the lobby. The street in which it is set, and all of that part of town, leaves something to be desired, and is not an appropriate setting for such a large hotel.It's a shame, because with a little change of attitude by those in charge it could be a much better experience. There were many Chinese tourists there for the Chinese New Year on what appeared to be package tours, and also business people, but pitifully few Western tourists at the time we were there. We would not stay at the hotel again.

Address: 219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
NandA: The Royal River Hotel ;219 Soi Charansanitwong 66/1, Charansanitwong Road, Bangplad, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10700
Title: A perfect location to see Bangkok torist sites
Review: We use the RR as a base during our visits to this part of the world. On this trip we landed in Bangkok, stayed at the RR, went to Myanmar and returned to the RR, and then went to Laos and returned for the 3rd time for 3 more days before returning to USA. The RR is next to the Boat Stop no. 16. The boats stop running at 19:00 but it runs all day like a river bus. In 10 to 15 minutes and 40 baht (about $.50 usd) my wife and I zip to boat stop 9 (the palace, the Temple and many canal trips) and lots of local tourist shopping, to boat stop 7 which is the Yahoudi River Front pavilion filled with restaurants on the river, boat stop no. 5 which is the edge of china town, the flower market and another pavilion of fine restaurants and shopping, or boat stop 1 which is the connection point for he Bangkok Highspeed overhead city train system to quickly get around the interior of Bangkok. These would cost between $7 and 20 dollars USD to take a taxi to and take between 45 minutes to an hour of traffic. Next to the RR is a 7-11 which we found to be convenient to grab a snack, or beverage at before we went to our room. 1 walkable block away 2 river dinner ships leave every night for a fun 2 hour river cruise - about $45 USD pp for buffet and about $14 USD to order from a menu that has no English. They are 10 stories of rooms, many of which have small balconies with chairs and tables that overlook the wonderful Chao Phyao River. The room size is generous and all of the ones we have stayed at with balconies have a small refrigerator and safe. The hotel is about 1 hour taxi ride $20 USD from the BKK airport or Don Mueng airports during rush hour or 45 minutes off time. Always use public taxis and not limos.

The small swimming pool was OK and the inadequate fitness equipment was OK but the sauna facility was switched off and no way could I get it to go on - no attendant was there to assist either. Review: We had a short 2 days stay. The first superior room we checked in was terrible so we had to upgrade it immediately and pay double the price. We got the best of the best and were ok and felt save. What ver the bed was super uncomfortable and no extra bed for our 5 years old daughter was offered. Haha ..they could only provide us with baby crib ... Our daughter had so much fun sleeping in it though and pretending that she is a little baby. Any way after all we had our own fun. Instead of stressing out our selfs we enjoyed every wrong thing there) We were laughing non stop when we've order chicken wings and got crispy chicken feet. The waiter with very little English was trying to explain us it the best part and a hot seller in the restaurant. Over all- the hotel catering more for Asian people; food, location, language, music, rooms... The view from presidential deluxe was awesome. Better stay on the other side of the river

Title: Amazing room ruined by the smell
Review: Myself and my girlfriend decided to spend the night in the Wat Arun Suite, after seeing it online. We loved everything about the room from the sofa to the stunning view. the shower and bath were very cosy and it was very romantic. Unfortunately, there was one major problem that spoiled our evening. My girlfriend first discovered an unusual smell when we first walked in and it wasn't until we went to bed that it became worse and I could smell it. It seems that the AC unit was emitting some sort of smell that could only be best described as sewage. It was awful and as the night went on it got worse and worse. I tried to see if it was maybe the river or the toilet but once I got close to the ac unit I could smell it at its worse. I hope they choose to fix this issue because aside from the smell the room was amazing and had it not been for the smell I would say it would have been the best room I have ever stayed in.

Title: Fun
Review: The room 301 has magnificent view of Temple of Dawn. Close to pier and sleepless Chaopraya River. So fun watching boats and cruises passing by from waking up until falling asleep.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Nice location
Review: This hotel has a great attraction, especially with a great view of Wat Arun just opposite to the hotel. Also, the Great Palace and Wat Pho are just around the corner nearby, it's just a walking distance to reach them, do not forget the streets foods as well. The staff here are very friendly to serve every customers. For me is more suitable for the couples to stay with a romantic room decoration. Highly recommended.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Rooftop bar!
Review: We stayed here for our last nights in Thailand on our honeymoon. It was kind of hard to find it, even with our tuition driver asking for directions. The room was comfy, had a lovely view of the river and temples across the way. The rooftop bar is great, but super crowded and the staff aren‚Äôt that nice. I get it, your busy but that‚Äôs part of the job. Hotel staff was nice, it was just the servers who were rude. Not a bad place to stay if you want a river view.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: The most stunning view.
Review: We stayed in the room with a view of Wat Arun for 2 nights before we flew back home. It is worth every dollar spent just for the view! The location was perfect. Next to the Thatien pier, the Grand Palace and Wat Pho and it is only a short tuk tuk ride to China Town. Great service by the front desk. Though I would not be staying here during a Thai summer as there isn't a pool at this hotel.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Unassumingly fabulous contemporary boutique hotel by the riverside
Review: We really love the contemporary interior design of sala rattanakosin and most of all the fantastic view of Wat Arun from the deluxe room and hotel dining areas. So lovely at night when lit up! Breakfast and The River dining offers great food with attractive plating. The popular Rooftop bar has awesome view of Bangkok Riverside and other landmark sites like Wat Pho, Grand Palace, et al. Hotel has no elevator tho and is at the end of a strip of small shops, restos and right beside warehousing stores. Not favourable to seniors and the disabled. But the small restos have good food at affordable prices. There is a nice souvenir shop at the corner of the street. Wat Pho and Grand Palace are just walking distance and Wat Arun is just a short boat ride across the river.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Great location, but needs revamping
Review: The location can't get better than this. It is right across the palace. There are other tourist spots around the hotel, so it is advisable to stay here to do the tours around the area. The room itself has a unique design, but it is a bit ran down. Do try their restaurant for the river view at night, or the roof top bar for a 360 degree view of the area.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Great view, good breakfast, but bedroom doors need fixing!
Review: Everything was great about the visit. Food was great, view to die for and nice mirrored window terrace overlooking Arun Temple. . The only downfall was that the bathroom slide door was very stiff, not in good working condition. Rooms could be better maintained and it would be great if the Hotel could deal with some areas i.e., Wat Pho for a discounted parking space.

Review: It's quite expensive than other similar level of hotels, but the view from room taking over everything! And staffs were very kind, also breakfast was delish-! Highly recommend if you stay in Bangkok.

Title: fascinating view, great service and breakfast
Review: ala carte breakfast really amazed me! Hotel located right opposite Wat Pho, facing Chao Phraya River. Best place for Wat Arun view. Cheer in their rooftop bar, or dinner here, for fascinating view. Cozy and Clean Room.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Amazing
Review: Everything about this hotel was amazing, the staff, the facilities, the room was always super clean and breakfast each morning was incredible. Staff always wanting to help and were super friendly!

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Good location but service is not from heart
Review: Unfortunately its competitor next door is performing much better, we stayed in both hotels during the same period, so we could clearly experience the differences; services, price, charm.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
Review: I rented a standard room and it had all the basics that I needed. The staff is friendly and very helpful with arranging taxi shuttle to the airport or give recommendations for places to go. We enjoyed a drink at the roof top bar at the end of every night (the prices are higher than normal but that is bc of the wonderful view). Breakfast was delicious and included in our room rate. This was a great location for seeing as much historical stuff as possible in a short period of time. We traveled by water taxi (Thai Tien pier is next door for the ferry across which runs until 8pm), tuk tuk and foot and saw so much stuff. They have a discount flyer for the Tuk Tuk Hop app in the lobby (essentially Uber for Tuk Tuk's) We used that for a full day, it runs from 8:30a-6:00pm and it helped us see a lot. It was worth the 300 THB (after discount promo code). Would stay here again if I returned.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Perfect Location
Review: Very professional staff, this location is walking distance to the Grand Palace and What Pho.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Very good
Review: The hotel is small, and they don't have elevators. We're a group of six girls and we were assigned on the 3rd and the 4th. Though the staff helped us with our luggages it's still inconvenient to use stairs specially it makes so much noise. The entire area is made of thin layers of wood and metal so even small steps make sounds. The good thing about this hotel is that they serve good breakfast overlooking The Grand Palace, they'll cook upon your arrival so you'll eat your food while it's warm. Though you have to patiently wait for that. Their rooftop overlooks the river and it's really beautiful. The hotel is few minutes away fromW a lot of temples. Wat Pho Arun is 2 min away on foot.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Excellent
Review: A great hotel in a fantastic location, right by the river, across Wat Arun. We had a deluxe room, this is a very small room but with very smart solutions in terms of room sharing of the bathroom and toilet. Unfortunately, the hotel is already worn, which was a bit surprising as it is relatively new. Paint stains on the walls and the flooring loosens. This is not good. But the staff are fantastic and the turndown service with a small gift and weather forecast is a nice touch. But what this hotel wins at is the rooftop bar, where you can sit and enjoy some food and drink while watching the sun go down at Wat Arun. Spectacular!

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Repeat visits
Review: Great little hotel in a great location a shoirt walk from Wat Pho, the Grand Palace, and the flower market. The rooms with a Wat Arun/riverside view are excellent. Breakfast is very good indeed and all staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. The rooftop cocktail bar provides great views and nice cocktails but has become a bit crowded with selfie obsessed people. Some decent places to eat within walking distance and a tuk tuk ride to Wat Saket, Hhao San Road and other places of interest. This was our third stay at this hotel and we would stay again.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Amazing views riverside location
Review: Sala Rattanakosin Hotel is located across from Wat Arun and the Arun view deluxe rooms have perfect views of the temple at all times of the day and night - also lovely to watch the river traffic from the room or restaurant terrace. the food is amazing - huge selction tasty and beautifully presented. Rooftop bar is fun to relax with a cocktail. Breakfast has interesting and varied menu options [not buffet - all dishes made to order] Notes about accessibility; the hotel doesn't have a lift - important that guests are able to manage stairs. Also the small soi outside is jampacked with delivery trollys/vehicles for the adjoining warehouses during the day so negotiating these can be tricky at times. In general the location is fantastic lots of eateries and coffee shops and local market within strolling distance. Very convenient for independent visits to Wat Arun, Reclining Buddha, Wat Pho and the Grand palace [no taxi or tour needed] Hotel Recommended for a special treat !

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Super Cozy and Friendly Hotel
Review: Very well located. Stunning views. Delicious breakfast. Great rooftop bar/restaurant.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Exceptional
Review: Gorgeous! Lovely hospitality, attention to detail, and the best shower I've had after months of traveling. The views alone are worth it !

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Nice view - shame about the smell
Review: The location on the river with a panoramic view across to the Wat Arun is outstanding. The hotel interiors are very stylish and the breakfast of good quality (apart from persistently untoasted toast). Sadly - what would deter us from staying here again or recommending to anyone else is the appalling smell. The charaterictic smell of sewers is evident as you walk into reception, it percolates throughout the stairwells and is persistent in the bedrooms. When this was raised with reception they brought an electric air freshener which was in addition to the essential oil burner that was already in the room (and which was quickly provided when my son and his partner also complained of the smell in their adjacent room). These of course did not eliminate the odour only masked it for short periods and in the early morning the smell of sewer was noxious - we have just returned to the UK and are aware that some of our clothes are still tainted. A pity.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Hotel with a Beautiful Temple View
Review: Wonderful small hotel with a beautiful view on temple....Having a drink seeing the lighted temple at night is wonderful. The roof top bar is good. Only setback is that the shopping area are abit far away and many times taxi have difficulty finding the hotel at night.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: In the heart of historical Bangkok
Review: Stylish boutique hotel in walking distance to the Grand Palace and Wat Pho. Trendy mix of the old building fabric and modern interior design. Fabulous views from both the award-winning restaurant and the rooftop bar. Excellent reception and friendly, accommodating staff. As the hotel is located in the middle of a market area (and therefore not that easy to find) I asked the reception to organize the transfer from the airport to the hotel: They send a very nice (brand new) car with an excellent driver at a very reasonable price: What a nice and carefree way to start my stay in Bangkok.

Address: 39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: ‚òÖ‚òÖ AGODA and this hotel completely ruined our vacation
Review: The location and facilities of the hotel were not very attractive, but I booked this hotel because I want to stay in "Wat Arun View Deluxe Room". But when I arrived at the hotel, I was booked into the 'Deluxe Room' and only the antenna of the other house was seen outside the window. and we had to stay in that room. Hotel repeatedly said "Agoda sent wrong mail. it's not our fault. we have no means of doing so. Just keep in touch with Agoda yourself." And, Agoda has given me a $ 15 coupon for three months. If you want to completely ruin your one-off holiday, please book this hotel in Agoda. Title: Absolutely Exceptional 5 star service all the way, beautiful

Title: Super place
Review: 10/10 for friendly happy staff. Staff will make or break a stay for us but these ppl made our stay right from the get go. We arrived late after flight delays but were greeted with a smile helped to our room with 0 fuss. The room was very clean with a great shower, breakfast with a view across the river was picture perfect.

Title: Great View
Review: I choose this hotel to celebrate my birthday. Because their spectacular view of famed "Temple of Dawn". This suite has wall-to-celing clear glass window, which I can see those temple all night (the temple lit-up 19:00pm.-02:00am. daily). All their restaurants facing Chaopraya River. Not only great view, but also their foods. If you guys are foodies, I recommend "Lamb Shank Musamun". It's so damm delicious, trust me. Even the location is a bit tricky to reached (no private parking). But since you arrived there, it's difference world. Try it once, please!!!

NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Excellent view
Review: Pros: 1) The rooms and bathrooms are clean 2) The staff is very courteous and speak excellent English. They helped with booking all our transportation needs. 3) They have a 12 hour laundry and the service is good 4) The WiFi is free and the connectivity is excellent 5) They have a restaurant serving lunch and dinner and they make vegetarian dishes on request and the quality is good. 6) They helped with all our transportation needs 7) The tariff is not cheap, but probably par for the location. 8) The views are absolutely gorgeous. It is bang opposite Wat Arun and watching the sun set/rise is priceless. 9) The location is great. It is right next to the ferry stop, right opposite Wat Pho and a short walk to the Grand Palace. There are plenty of great eating options very close to the hotel. 10) Breakfast was great and there are good vegetarian choices. Cons: 1) The rooms and bathrooms are tiny. 2) The corridors smells of sewage. 3) Looks like there are rats gnawing in b/n walls

Title: Great boutique hotel right on Chao Praya River - lovely!
Review: This hotel's location, and surrounding shipping/trading companies, constitute a huge part of its lovely charm and uniqueness. You are literally nestled amongst warehouses on the Chao Praya River with sweaty, muscled boys hauling boxes to/from lorries and boats. One gets the feeling that this part of Old Bangkok is on the cusp of exploding into a very trendy/chic part of town with similar boutique hotels, residences, mini-spas and coffee shops popping up all around. It's 3 minutes walk to Wat Pho, 10 minutes walk to the Grand Palace and a 5 Baht/5 minute ferry ride to Wat Arun (Temple of the Dawn). The hotel's staff were very resourceful and polite - I asked them to ask Hertz to deliver our rental car to the hotel on our final morning (done with smiles!). We also got some great ideas on what to do and where to shop from the glamorous and polite Khun Em. The breakfast (included) was superb with a wide range of offerings for the very hungry to the very fussy with excellent coffee/tea selection as well. The rooms were modern, spartan chic - which I love (hate busy, complicated, fussy rooms) - and the bed was well-appointed and comfortable. Aircon was strong and quiet. Half the rooms have a wonderful view of the Chao Praya River and Wat Arun. One must scale stairs to get to the rooms but hey, we have legs and can walk (and the porter discretely took our bags up for us upon arrival). All in all, a real gem of a hotel (after 30 years of staying in Sukhumvit area mega business hotels) and one I wouldn't hesitate to return to soon. (Note: I didn't eat in the restaurant for lunch or dinner, hence, no comments.)

Title: False-advertising, hostile receptionist but great breakfast!
Review: When we arrived at the hotel, the staff were really polite and helpful upon check in. We got to our room to discover it wasn't the one we had booked. We booked the River View Deluxe (after deciding it was worth the extra cost) but the room we were given was the Wat Po Deluxe. We went down to reception and stated this and reception told us that those rooms were limited and were filled on a "first come first served" basis. Naturally, we questioned how we were able to book an unavailable room and asked what our options were as we did not want to stay in the room we were in as this was totally different to the room we had booked. They told us that we could upgrade to the suite and pay the extra $200-and-some dollars which we were obviously not going to do. We asked if we could cancel and go somewhere else as they had mis-sold us the room but they told us that we would not get a refund. We asked again what our options were and they couldn't give us any and referred us to Agoda. At no point did we receive any sympathy or understanding from the Hotel, only hostility. We contacted Agoda and explained and Agoda paid the difference to upgrade us to the suite (many thanks to Joelson Tang). The hotel were NOT happy about this and made it known to us that Agoda were paying the extra and not the hotel. They begrudgingly led us up to the suite on the top floor which is marvellous. Stand alone bath, great views and huge. Upon check out the following day, we were asked to sign a sheet which we only questioned because we thought it might be related to covering the cost of the move to the suite. When we looked at the sheet it was a bill for a broken glass in our original room (we didn't even unpack in that room) and for 2 bottles of water we had consumed in the suite. We contested these as we hadn't broken the glass and the price list in the room said that the water was free (apparently only if you purchase a spirit). We argued some more and they wrote it off and couldn't wait to see

Title: Great breakfast, great location for temples
Review: Ideally situated in front of temples, it allows you to walk to many must-see temples and open-mall piers. It might be a little hard to find the hotel at first. If you just have a couple of days to visit and you just want to see the temples, then stay here as it's not close to a subway or the other part of the city with more night-life. The hotel contemporary look is very nice. The rooftop bar has great views of the city, river and temples. A very nice evening to be spent up there. The personnel is courteous. The room is roomy, clean, confortable. Seems odd to have the shower and bathroom sink at the end of the bedroom with no wall or door to separate the two, but it's fine. The toiletries are very nice. Room was made each day and they even offered a juice for their satisfaction survey. The breakfast is included, well-presented and delicious! The view from the breakfast area is amazing on a temple.

NandA: sala rattanakosin Bangkok ;39 Maharat Road, Grand Palace, Phranakorn, Bangkok Riverside, Bangkok, Thailand, 10200
Title: Great location near the Grand Palace and other Temples!
Review: Small Boutique Hotel in a location that offers greats views of the Grand Palace, Wat Pho as well as Wat Arun which is located directly across the river from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and carried our luggage up four flights of stairs as there is no elevator at this hotel. They will also take your luggage back down to the lobby when it is time for you to check-out. We didn't mind having to take the stairs but I would guess that this may be troublesome for some people. There are also tons of shops, restaurants and street food stalls all within a few blocks walking distance which was really great. There are also plenty of Tuk Tuks in the area should you need to grab one. The hotel upgraded our room to one with a view of Wat Pho and also decorated our bed with a "Kissing Swans" towel decoration for our Honeymoon. Breakfast was included in our hotel package and we enjoyed it on the restaurant's patio overlooking the Chao Praya River. There was a handful of choices to pick from and we were easily able to find something that suited us. There is also a rooftop bar that serves some great drinks and offers some appetizers as well. There is an awesome view of the entire area from up there and we enjoyed watching all the boats and dinner cruises go by throughout the evening. There were only a few negatives that we encountered. The first being that there were tiny ants all over our bed but after a few hours they seem to have disappeared. I also saw a lot of these in the neighborhood and would assume that they are a problem at most places in the area. The shower is only slightly tinted so you can see through into the shower from the rest of the room but since we are a couple this didn't bother us at all but might bother friends or non couples traveling together. We only stayed here for our last night in Thailand so didn't really unpack our luggage but people staying longer may find it difficult to find places to store their items when unpacking as the r

Title: Fantastic hotel only let down by restaurant food.
Review: The accommodation is great, although even some of the taxi drivers had difficulty finding the hotel. Entry is down a dead end "alleyway" opposite Wat Pho. On the food front, the soft shell crab was soggy, and the Northen Thai appetiser platter cooked element tasted like they may have been cooked in old fat! We both had types of braised meats for our main course. Neither of which were to our taste (This is not the restaurant's fault as we both tried Thai versions of meats we both love but for us they didn't work). The breakfast was brilliant, sat on the terrace facing the river and another fantastic temple, Wat Arun. It wouldn't take much to make this hotel score 5 stars in every category, and I realise that you can't cater for everyone's taste, but all in all we loved it!!!

Title: Good experience and a nice getaway
Review: Our staycation at the Sala Rattanakosin was good in many ways, but there was room for improvement. The view is wonderful and the food good, but pricey. The included breakfast was tasty as well, but rather limited; I left hungry. The patio is also fabulous, yet it is in the sun by 8:30-9am which makes it uncomfortable quickly (shade would be fantastic). Generally, we like to support boutique hotels, but when the price for a room is as much or more than the 5 star hotels further up the river, one starts to wonder. The location is great as it allows the visitor to experience a different parts of Bangkok; river life, warehouses, and the flower market nearby. This says nothing of being close to famous Wats and the Grand Palace. Overall, a very nice getaway spot with just a few tweaks to make it excellent.

Alas, the air downtown is horrible these days, which makes compelling reason to stay in this conveniently located hotel - so one can avoid walking long distances in gritty air.

Title: Room smelly but location is great
Review: We checked in first room with strong smell from the aircon. They change to another room for us and it really better. Next day we complaint to the front desk that our room's air con got problem then only they told us the whole floor air con system having problem. We spent whole day at outside and back to room, the aircon still on off automatic. We called to front desk then they request us to transfer to another room. We so disappointed because its take quite some time to get ready the room and the hotel didn't put any noticed that all the guest on that floor need to be transferred to another floor. Other than that, the hotel's staff is very helpful, location very good and room and clean.

NandA: SKYVIEW Hotel Bangkok ;12 Sukhumvit Soi 24 Klongton, Klongtoey near BTS Prompong, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: For 1 night is fine but next visit in BKK will book somewhere else
Review: Not value for money, the only 2 things we like were rooftop bar and the location. Small hotel, service could be better especially in low season there were not many guests and we were the only guests checking in, the lady behind front desk does not seems happy to serve us, she also did not try to give us early check-in (in low season!) Until I told her that our last stay in another hotel, we got an upgrade and could check-in early so she gave us 2 hours before check-in time and we were sitting waited until 10am, she did not came and tell us that our room was ready, we need to go and ask her (again, there were no other guests). Bangkok has too many hotels to offer and for the price we paid we have a plenty of choice, we might come back again to get some drinns on the rooftop bar but for sleeping I rather book Novotel Sukhumvit 20 (same price range) or muse hotel (was excellent stay there last year).

Address: 12 Sukhumvit Soi 24 Klongton, Klongtoey near BTS Prompong, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110

Title: Acceptable
Review: for Thailand standard ,their staff is terrible. the cost of the hotel is very expensive for this standard and location is extremely jam with many schools around. Breakfast if not included in the booking is extra 650 baht which is ridiculous . I suppose to book for a conference room the next round in this hotel and need to check with them regarding some issues , they don't bother to reply back. of course I am booking elsewhere. AVOID this Hotel at all cost.l

Address: 12 Sukhumvit Soi 24 Klongton, Klongtoey near BTS Prompong, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110

Title: Great Spot
Review: The hotel is located at a very convenient spot where BTS station, shopping mall, supermarkets, restaurants, food courts, cinema, massage and SPA are all within very close walking distance. Rooms are neat and tidy, staffs are nice, especially Mr. Boy who always willing to provide his best assistance whenever you need it. Breakfast place at the 2/F serves good breakfast with a variety of choices. The Skybar the roof top has a magnificent view over city of Bangkok, an ideal place for a sunset chill. If you are bored of the city centre, Sukhumvit 24 is not a bad place for an alternative choice.

Title: Great Location, Clean and New Hotel
Review: This is my second stay in this hotel. The location is great as it is a few minutes to the BTS station and nearby 2 big high end shopping centres. This location is also one BTS stop to the next shopping centre, if you are into shopping. Lots of eateries and massage around the area, both upscale and street food. The room is clean and spacious and the staffs are okay. The only issue I have is that the room was make-up quite late, I like to come back to the hotel for nap before venturing out again. Other than that, everything is great.

Title: Unacceptable 5 stars Hotel
Review: Compass Skyview - our 5 nights stay in bkk. Booked the grand executive for the bathtub with a 180 degree view and floor to ceiling windows. Disappointed stay. Had to wait a long time for the lifts even though there‚Äôs 4. Breakfast egg station chef rude and staff are not friendly. Ate there 3 times but no change in selection. Room rain shower pressure low and water temperature control poor. Air conditioning in room poor - hot middle of the night. Bedroom slippers charged 300baht if you take them home. Swimming pool size okay only. 24hours gym. Toilet cubicles in gym had faeces in them unable to flush away (what a horrible experience). Poor Housekeeping. Was able to get late checkout when requested. In other words, I don‚Äôt recommend this hotel. Hilton across the road much much better (which we have stay there 3 times before).

Title: Exceed Expectations
Review: Excellent location, next to Phrom Phong BTS and Emporium & EmQuartier (shopping plus restaurants and food courts). Also some nice restaurants (such as Sustaina) nearby. Around Baht 160 to Jim Thompson Factory Outlet or a few stops to Bang Chak BTS station. Also close to Central World, Grand Centre Point Terminal 21. Breakfast is qood, though not that many choices. Room is new, clean, spacious and modern look. Stayed 5 nights with 3 nights upgrade to a much bigger room. Came to hotel by airport rail (Baht 40) and BTS (Baht 40), left by taxi to airport (fixed fee Baht 500 arranged by hotel. Highly recommend to those first time vistors.

Title: Generally speaking, it is good and can be better
Review: Nice and much appreciated: - complementary butterfly pea drink at lobby (hope it can be less sweet) - helpful concierge and front desk staff - surprise from hotel - housekeeping staff take off their shoes before cleaning - very sweet that the hotel gives us enough bottle of water Need to improve - servers gave a pushy experience. They keep clear our plates and towel even we have not used - shower room. The water temperature is not stable. Sometimes hot very quickly. - toilet; the tissue is easily tore off and soft. Need to use a lot of tissue paper to clean - very strange to have a notice to remind people not to take away the slippers.

Title: Excellent
Review: Pros: convenient location, just a few walk from Phrom Phong BTS station, shopping malls, restaurants, massage nearby; Room is comfort in size, bright and in modern design, I stay in the corner room and observe that only the bathroom size is bigger than other with full height glass wall; requested services react promptly by staff. Cons: water pressure for shower is not good enough, longer time for cleaning if you are long-haired; breakfast not many choice, just fulfil daily needs; surprised by cleaning workers in the morning outside bathroom when using toilet without notification by hotel, be careful~ full bathroom amenities just for the first night, always not supply face towels and not enough shower gel in the rest of days.

They brought us a cake at the moment we were leaving the room, and the lady still insisted to leave the cake in the room for several hrs exposing to normal air. I found it very not hygienic. I had an extra bed which is extra fee but extremely uncomfortable. The staffs are not friendly at all like bellboy will scan you from head to toe, and the front desks are just not friendly and slow during the check in process. I left my belongings at the concierge after check out, but they lost 1 of my bag. I tried to contact to hotel to follow up but they cannot find it. I am very upset with how the hotel handle my case.

Title: If you need a handicapped room , better specified your requirements .
Review: We stayed here 3 nights. The price payed cannot justified for the room. 1st night was catastrophic! The so called handicapped friendly bath room , is without sitting aid, no shower screens , no antislip floor tiles. The whole bath room will be wet n slippery n totally not fit even for normal guest. After discussed the issues with the duty manager that night, we moved to a proper room without above issues. Except we agreed mutually there is no alarm support for the handicapped guest. We appreciate very much the hotel's arrangements for the small surprise birthday cake n room decor for my wife's birthday. There was no breakfast despite paying so much for the stay, so we cannot comment on the services. The prices for the in house restaurants is generally high. For meals we suggest just go next door to the Emporium food court or restaurants. Food is good quality n reasonable. Take note can only buy beer or alcoholics from supermarket after 5pm in Bangkok! This is new to us !

Title: Helpful, clean and great location
Review: This hotel is located right in the heart of Sukhumvit shops and entertainment. It even has a walkway to access the Terminal 21 shopping mall nearby. The hotel was very helpful in providing facilities for our young baby. A clean cot and baby bath was provided. The staff were helpful, polite and always service gave with a smile. The rooms were just big enough and generally facilities were very good. The showers have a slight issue with not being able to turn the on/off easily when wet, but other than that no problems with this hotel. Breakfast was good and again staff very helpful.

Title: 6 Stars
Review: I came to this hotel after I left another luxury hotel because their beds were too hard. Sofitel‚Äôs beds are soft and they have a pillow menu, which was funny but great. Location is excellent, next to terminal 21. I booked a Suite and it was impeccable. Excellent service and great food menu. Checkout for my suite was also 4pm, so I don‚Äôt know if this is standard for rooms or suites only. Overall an excellent stay and this will be where I stay for all future visits. 6 stars.

Address: 189 Sukhumvit Road Soi 13-15 , Klongtoey Wattana, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
NandA: Sofitel Bangkok Sukhumvit Hotel ;189 Sukhumvit Road Soi 13-15 , Klongtoey Wattana, Sukhumvit, Bangkok, Thailand, 10110
Title: Beds, Beds, more beds!
Review: I had to put that first as beds are what is most important to me. I have stayed in numerous 4-5 star hotels and Sofitel‚Äôs beds are similar to those of Pullman (sister brands). Very comfortable, especially if you have any type of back or sciatic nerve pain. I actually left another great hotel‚Äîhalfway through my stay‚Äîto come here simply because of their beds. That said, the suite I stayed in was excellent and the service always great. Location perfect‚Äîright by the large Terminal 21 mall and BTS station. This will be my go to hotel moving forward as some of the others have become quarantine centers.

Title: Grateful for the Sofitel!
Review: We arrived at the Sofitel near the end of our 7 week trip in Asia. We originally planned for 5 nights at the Sofitel; however, due to the Coronavirus outbreak and ensuing flight cancellations/rebooking, our stay was shortened to four then two nights. The management at the Sofitel were very understanding and issued us a refund for the unused nights. During our 2 nights at the Sofitel, we were extremely pleased with the comfort of the room and the overall facilities. The bed was super comfortable and the room quite spacious! The buffet breakfast included in the room rate was extensive and delicious. The wait staff were very attentive to customers. As far as safety related to the Coronavirus situation, the hotel was totally on top of the situation; checking everyone's temperature prior to allowing entrance to the hotel and providing hand sanitizer at many locations. the entire staff presented a calm and positive attitude to guests. We will return to the Sofitel!

Title: Fabulous staff
Review: On arrival we weren‚Äôt disappointed as we‚Äôve stayed in sofitels in many parts of the world, the grand entrance is amazing and the bed and pillows by far the best in any hotel or chain we‚Äôve ever stayed in. The staff are some of the best we‚Äôve encountered in luxury hotels, so often the staff are over polite and efficient which I am sure is down to training but here the staff appear to get the measure of the customer immediately. You‚Äôre greeted as you step out of your vehicle by a tall beautiful elegant member of the co coerce team and she immediately puts you at ease and you feel secure and welcome, then onto reception where the lovely Sai will check you in if you‚Äôre lucky, this lady has charm and personality in abundance and the hotel are lucky to have such a team member. The breakfast is ok but nothing out of the ordinary but there‚Äôs plenty, it‚Äôs fresh and once again the team take care of your every need. The pool is small with but never that busy.

Title: 5-star hotel but felt something is missing
Review: Counter staff surprised us with early check in at 12.15pm (usual 3pm) upon arrival. They had services to prepare for your sleep, around 6pm, camomile tea with cup at the side, check to make sure toiletries are replenished. Room is very dim at night (upon request, they can add lamps to brighten the room) and bad sound proofing. (Stayed at level 17.) You can hear next room‚Äôs activities and music from rooftop clubs when weekend starts. Breakfast variety is alright, not worth topping up. Great location, amenities are around the vicinity. Pharmacy and 7-11 are next to the hotel. There‚Äôs a small supermarket within 5 min walk. Hotel situated between Nana and Asoke station. Within 5 mins walk to nearest bridge connecting to BTS station (easier to walk). Artbox Bangkok happened to be opposite of the hotel. Many choices for massage around the area.

Title: Disappointing Club room
Review: Lack of attention to detail spoiled what should have been a real treat for my wife‚Äôs birthday. When we got to the room the bathroom floor was dirty. The safe didn‚Äôt work. We were given the wrong wifi password. So we had to contact a whole load of staff to get these fixed instead of resting after a long flight. The club decor is a bit dated, there were not enough staff on duty and the drinks and food ran out. Having stayed at a Sofitel Club room in Macau a few years ago and being delighted we were hoping for a good experience at Bangkok Sukhumvit. We had also booked a club room for 1 night on our return to Bangkok in 2 weeks time. We cancelled it and will be staying at a different hotel club room. The problem seems to be a lack of management oversight and we did not want to stay at this hotel again.

Title: Everything was great, highly recommended
Review: I stayed in Sofitel 10 apr - 15 apr (room 2019) and 28 apr - 2 may (room 2912). Both the experiences were great and I will surely come here again for next time in Bangkok. Rooms have premium look, very spacious and really quiet. Great bathroom with huge shower. All comforts are provided as well as housekeeping service h24. Bed is nice and soft and swimming pool is nice enough and powerful wifi in any corner of the building. All the staff was polite and smiling. Really worth the money you pay. Restaurants and breakfast not tested, I just had a (little bit overpriced) coke from the roof top bar, which has nice view. Mind that they will require you a deposit at the check-in. Finally, the hotel is guest-friendly with the registration of the guest's id. Highly recommended.

Title: Truly Outsanding
Review: My wife and I stayed for two nights at this wonderful hotel, and can confirm that the compliments by others that feature on the website more than rang true in every way for us as well - perhaps more so. The Front of House Staff are the best I have ever encountered and the service they provide under the leadership of Theo Laborey is truly outstanding. During our second day and final morning, I suffered a brief medical problem (having been discharged from hospital prior to our stay) which was dealt with professionally, sensitively and skillfully. I cannot thank Theo Laborey and his staff enough for this, and the way they made sure that we received a personal service so that we did not miss our breakfast (the food provided direct to our room was delicious), and that we were safely on our way home to the North East of Thailand. C'est superbe! We shall most definitely stay there again, and we recommend the hotel for its many good points and faultless service. Our thanks to all staff!

The hotel is located near asok station and sukhumvit station, and Terminal 21. Easy access to everywhere to Bangkok and Thailand.

Title: Return Visit
Review: A very high standard hotel situated near the sky train station. The hotel staff from the reception, room service and breakfast are very helpful and pleasant. The breakfast area is of a very high standard with a great selection of Asian/European foods. The bedroom is of a large size with the best ever king size hotel bed we have ever slept in. The bathroom is also of a high standard with a bath plus two shower heads in the shower room. The business centre, Sports room and swimming pool are really worth a visit. Looking forward to our next visit in one months time.

Title: Our best hotel stay of this trip.
Review: This was my second stay with Swissotel. My husband and I stayed at the previous Swissotel in Bangkok four years ago and had such a wonderful experience that we decided to stay there again. We were not disappointed. The Hotel is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and clean. The beds are comfortable. I never had to ask for toiletries to be replenished. They have concierge service which is very helpful. We ordered room service and were happy with the quality of that. We enjoyed the bar facilities. and we were happy with our breakfast experience. It was just an overall good experience.

Address: 204 Ratchadapisek Road Huaykwang, Ratchada, Bangkok, Thailand, 10320

Address: 204 Ratchadapisek Road Huaykwang, Ratchada, Bangkok, Thailand, 10320
NandA: Swissotel Bangkok Ratchada ;204 Ratchadapisek Road Huaykwang, Ratchada, Bangkok, Thailand, 10320
Title: Good stay
Review: 5 star Hotel that is beautiful, professionally staffed with great facilities for a small conference. The room was spacious with comfortable, but firm bed and nice linens. Ample storage space and a security box large bathroom with separate shower and tub. Nice toiletries. Very hot shower with good water pressure. Even a clothes drying line! No bum gun. Complimentary water x2 Breakfast buffet was fantastic with western and Asian options. Vegetarian options as well. Excellent quality. A few minor cons: Towels were a little scratchy. There was a water leak from the room above and carpet dryer was in my room one late afternoon. The shower door drips a lot of water on the floor if you leave it open after you shower. Obviously this won‚Äôt happen if you open the door into the shower. Overall a great stay. I‚Äôll return!

Title: Oldie but Goodie
Review: The hotel has seen better days and is styled like those built 15-20 years ago. Those who have stayed at Grande Sukhumvit would know. Thus, the room interiors are a tad crusty but the room is very spacious. The rebranding was done well, facilities are good, and the staff are experienced and very helpful. The hotel is just next to the MRT (metro) station and is a short walk away from a mall and a cluster of shophouses, but note that the area is not a shopping area like Sukhumvit-Asoke or Phra Ram IX.

Do you expect me to go shopping for shower gel and shampoo in the night after a long day of meeting and traveling on Bangkok super jam road? FYI, I survived on last 3 drops of shower gel on the last day of stay! Bad housekeeping!

Address: 204 Ratchadapisek Road Huaykwang, Ratchada, Bangkok, Thailand, 10320
NandA: Swissotel Bangkok Ratchada ;204 Ratchadapisek Road Huaykwang, Ratchada, Bangkok, Thailand, 10320
Title: Excellent hotel
Review: This is a very comfortable hotel with a grand, impressive entrance/lobby in an interesting part of Bangkok. It is very convenient for the MRT station 50 metres away and to escape the international comfort zone the hotel provides there is a taste of local Thai life in the night market that sets up along nearby Huay Khwang Street. The beautiful Pool was practically deserted when I stayed there during the day as most of the Chinese guests shun poolside activities, it seemed like my own private pool at times. Nice.

Address: 204 Ratchadapisek Road Huaykwang, Ratchada, Bangkok, Thailand, 10320
NandA: Swissotel Bangkok Ratchada ;204 Ratchadapisek Road Huaykwang, Ratchada, Bangkok, Thailand, 10320
Title: Nice hotel in a good location in Ratchada
Review: Nice hotel in a good location in Ratchada. Check in took a longer time though. There was no bidet/water spray in the toilet. Shower head was fixed on with no shower hose except for oddly designed water hose in the bathtub which was not suitable for bathing. Would be almost perfect if there is toilet bidet spray and shower hose in the shower cubicle. Next is the cleanliness of the shower cubicle and the bathtub. There were black, brown and yellow stains on the walls and the bathtub. Staff were pleasant and accommodating. Special room requests were attended to without fail. Hotel is in good location just opposite huai khwang night market. Overall it is a nice hotel. Would be back if there is toilet bidet installed in future...

Address: 204 Ratchadapisek Road Huaykwang, Ratchada, Bangkok, Thailand, 10320
NandA: Swissotel Bangkok Ratchada ;204 Ratchadapisek Road Huaykwang, Ratchada, Bangkok, Thailand, 10320
Title: Very good
Review: Hotel Location is very good. To get a taxi is never a problem, MRT station is just next door. Many restaurants around the hotel. Well, breakfast is always very good. Many choices and the restaurant staffs are always very polite & helpful.. The only disappointment that I had this round was during check in.. when I booked the room i specifically requested for early check in IF is available due to my early flight arrival. The hotel also send email saying they will try their best to accommodate if possible.. But when I arrived we were told that the check in time is 2pm and if you want to check in early we have to pay additional 50% of the Hotel Board rates, which is almost the same price i paid through Agoda. You see the issue here is they have many empty rooms available but due to hotel policy they made guest wait for hours before check in.. I had stayed in this hotel for many times, But had never experienced this before. Many times we were allowed to check in or even been upgrade.

Title: Good hotel.
Review: I enjoyed my stay in Swissotel Bangkok Ratchada. Tidy room, great staff, excellent breakfast and so forth. There is a few worries about staying this hotel, although it is nothing to do with it. Now, there is 3 big Train Building projects are taking place on 3 main roads in Bangkok North. Latprao and the other 2 roads that go parallel to Latprao are fully under constructions. That causes awful heavy traffic jam i.e., it took me 1 hour to get to soi 101 Latprao from the hotel. Some taxis even refused to go. You got to be aware of the current situation.

Hotel Name: Arte Plus by Afflexia Serviced Suites KLCC
Address: G-02, Ground Floor, Arte Plus @ Jalan Ampang No 3, Lorong Ampang 1,, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55000
NandA: Arte Plus by Afflexia Serviced Suites KLCC ;G-02, Ground Floor, Arte Plus @ Jalan Ampang No 3, Lorong Ampang 1,, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55000
Title: I like the unit. But I don't like the parking space
Review: The unit is clean and comes with service lift. To go to the parking lot is not convenient. I feel like it is just too far. Parking card not working. Always need to feedback via intercom. The unit comes with basic needs with hair dryer, washing machine, tv, microwave, induction cooker. But no iron. The appliances is there. But need to bring own detergent. Towel is complete. No extra plastic bag to throw rubbish. Shower foam is just enough. If you shower more than 2x, definitely not enough. All facilities are closed due to covid. Not much stuff nearby, walking distance.

Hotel Name: Arte Plus by Afflexia Serviced Suites KLCC
Address: G-02, Ground Floor, Arte Plus @ Jalan Ampang No 3, Lorong Ampang 1,, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55000
NandA: Arte Plus by Afflexia Serviced Suites KLCC ;G-02, Ground Floor, Arte Plus @ Jalan Ampang No 3, Lorong Ampang 1,, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55000
Title: Cheap but let down by horrible building layout
Review: I like that the staff are very friendly and the premises are always clean. HOWEVER.... The building layout is a disaster. Checking in is okay but it is getting to your room that is the real challenge. For our stay, we had to park at parking level CP5. Then, we had to take an elevator to level R. After that, from level R we had to take another elevator to level 25. The problem comes when you realize there is only 1 lift to take for each of these routes. There can be delays for up to 30 minutes just waiting for the SINGLE lift during peak hours! The property developer should have just went for centralized elevator lobby. I can only recommend staying here if you want a cheap property for large families and you can tolerate the exhausting journey from car park to your room every time. Also, please check the map when booking since the name "KLCC" does not imply that it is within the immediate vicinity of Suria KLCC.

Title: A waste of money. Nothing is available as advertised.
Review: All the notable features that were advertised by this unscrupulous group are not available, the lazy spa, the Swedish garden wasn't open! The swimming pool was shockingly tiny and basic. To top it off, the location was hard to get to with bumpy road and the parking area was very difficult to navigate. The staff (guy) was not helpful and the entire experience was a waste of time. Needless to say, we cut our vacation short. Definitely not worth our time and money.

NandA: Arte Plus by Afflexia Serviced Suites KLCC ;G-02, Ground Floor, Arte Plus @ Jalan Ampang No 3, Lorong Ampang 1,, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55000
Title: If you haven‚Äôt book, don‚Äôt book!
Review: You have read in few other reviews , so exactly the same. You will regret if you choose to stay here. The lift facilities are not design to meet high users capacity y, I don‚Äôt know if this works find during non-peak or weekdays. There is no AC in all the lift and most common/general back of house areas, not sure what was the issues here , so you will be sweating after waiting more than 30mins for the lift. And then continue sweating when you got into the lift. Also, be prepared to get annoyed by the lift bell sounds, you can hear when you sleep because your room is just by your door. If you are going with your kids with full hope of swimming at the ‚Äútiny‚Äù pool there, so check in early or call see if they agree to reserve the slot for you. Happen to be all slots are fully meet the limits when we go. The only pros are the external facade and architecture, which why all of us are attracted to, but really, not worth it. Choose something else with nicer view of KL skyline if you can. TQ!

Title: Indeed a good experience at arte plus but could have been better
Review: 1. Access to the arte plus building was quite confusing especially with the on-going construction 2. Access to the room was ok since the staff was clear verbally and with written instructions 3. No emergency evacuation plan in the room 4. Basic amenities ok but could be better for example toaster, a complete dining set, washing machine with detergent tablets (at least for one time wash), knife, chopping board etc 5. No information on list of items available in the room. 6. No information on how to use appliances in the room 7. Deposit was quite high but at least the afflexia operator did mention before check-in and that was useful 8. No dedicated website about arte plus. So, information are not really clear about arte plus and rooms. 9. Value for money for my promotional price. If it‚Äôs more than that, definitely not worth the stay with very basic amenities in the room. 10. Room number provided to me was good location and access because just beside the lift. Not sure other room

Title: Confusingly artsy stay
Review: We changed from shared bathroom to private studio since it feel uncomfortable to shared whole apartment with other people and this is not a hostel. We changed it to studio and got a spacious room with kitchenette. The room is clean and spacious with beautiful and modern interiors. We are very pleased with the room. What we do not pleased is the lift and car park system. Lift is confusing and we have to wait for a long time to go down or up and changed lifts to get into our floor room. Look, I came for peace of mind and not enter a maze competition of lifts. Even the car park system is ridiculous, why can‚Äôt the guest park where they want to park? This place has ample of car park anyway. The place is insta filled interiors and quite nice to take tons of pics so it is great for group gathering. The location is near to M-City Mall , nothing much really but if you want to buy some groceries and snacks, this is sufficient.

Title: Better stay away
Review: If the price more than rm150/day for me its not worth it regardless any type of accommodation they offer. Only 1 designated elevator from basement car park and ground floor to "R" floor which we need to stop here and change other unit elevator connected to room. This single lift always occupied and you will waste your 15 to 20 min just stand infront of it. This basement and ground floor lobby will surely provide you guys with free sauna experience since this area not covered with air cond. All other facilities were poorly maintain by the management. Small swimming pool provided for all 3 tower residents. Smelly towels provided in room. It will be become an essay if i list all the problem here.

NandA: Arte Plus by Afflexia Serviced Suites KLCC ;G-02, Ground Floor, Arte Plus @ Jalan Ampang No 3, Lorong Ampang 1,, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55000
Title: Great rooms but super weird and confusing apartment layout
Review: I was in a 3-br apartment. The rooms were super clean and comfortable but often when you flush the toilet it kind of leaves a smell? Like piping issue? Most common areas inside the building were stuffy! No air flow, aircond not turned on. It was definitely suffocating. The attractions have inconvenient opening times. For example the lights were not on by 7.30PM, and off by 11PM. Lazy River Spa was open 11AM-7PM (last slot) - check in time was 3PM and check out 12PM, so when would we have the time...? There are 3 towers. Parking is at one tower, then the rooms in other towers. Very confusing, not intuitive. Lifts are very, very slow. Our stay was mostly spent being annoyed and confused with everything.

Hotel Name: Arte Plus by Afflexia Serviced Suites KLCC

NandA: Arte Plus by Afflexia Serviced Suites KLCC ;G-02, Ground Floor, Arte Plus @ Jalan Ampang No 3, Lorong Ampang 1,, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55000
Title: Can‚Äôt see KLCC...not even near
Review: Too many people walking in & out at a narrow check point (guarded). Check in area was confusing. There one counter labelled big OYO and the fancy counter in glass room, with small label, that was where I had to go. Lift is confusing and need to change into another ‚Äòprivate‚Äôlift to go to the suite (ie from GF go up to R, change lift to go to your unit). Level R tower 1, was also confusing. I couldnt find the useable exit door (with PROPER label) and missed visiting the garden at night. The 2 bedrooms suite has a modern design & furnitures. Comfortable for a night stay, but will not come back because of the hassle mentioned earlier. And the word ‚ÄòKLCC‚Äô along with the title of the residency is misleading. The building is surrounded by other tall buildings, and no sight of KLCC from the 29th floor! Other facilities not tried, because it was too complicated to get to one tower to another!

Title: Not Worth
Review: The check in process took so much time even though not many customers at that time. The outside area mostly is not clean. During our stay, level G (elevator) is very dirty. The security guard spitting everywhere. Since the waiting area is small and no designated area for car to park in front of the ‚Äúlobby‚Äù, the security guard whistle a lot just to make sure the cars dropping off the passengers keep moving. It is so annoying and irritating. The elevator was terrible. Only 1 to go to level R and each elevator is designated for specific floor/tower. So, we have to wait quite sometime. You really have to be patience (trust me). I will definitely not going to come here again.

Address: G-02, Ground Floor, Arte Plus @ Jalan Ampang No 3, Lorong Ampang 1,, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55000
NandA: Arte Plus by Afflexia Serviced Suites KLCC ;G-02, Ground Floor, Arte Plus @ Jalan Ampang No 3, Lorong Ampang 1,, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55000
Title: A Perfect Staycation
Review: Arte property is not something new for us. We have stayed in Penang Arte previously and it was the same experience we had here in Ampang. It gave us the feel of a great stay at your own door step. The only down side of it was the utensils for cooking was not provided thus we had to opt from cooking and order Grab food instead. Can be improve by providing some utensils for cooking so that customers can prepare meals instead of going out. It was a bit pack and traffic was unorganized during peak hours. So we were held up for some time upon going in to check-in as well to check-out. Can be improve much better by providing waiting area for cars and bikes elsewhere instead of the front entrance. Overall, had the most amazing stay cation and will surely plan for a house party the next round. Highly recommended for people who are looking for a great place to host a house party.

Address: No 67 Jalan Pantai Bagan Lalang, Kg Bagan Lalang, Sepang / KLIA, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 43950
NandA: Avani Sepang Goldcoast Resort ;No 67 Jalan Pantai Bagan Lalang, Kg Bagan Lalang, Sepang / KLIA, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 43950
Title: Luxurious and relaxing
Review: This stay was for my son's birthday. Staff are friendly and helpful. We were allowed to check in early and the resort did simple decoration inside the room for the birthday boy (my son was so happy about that). There was a little bit dusty on the curtains but overall the room is big and beautifully decorated with fully equipped with iron and board, flashlight and umbrella as well as huge balcony facing the sea. Variety of food for breakfast. Parking lot is a bit far but shuttle van is provided to/from the parking (unless you opt for valet parking). Non-stop buggy service provided from/to room. Hence, overall we really enjoyed our stay there.

Title: Service very bad

We just asking how to book for candle light dinner but he just said the price is rm350. When we ask again how to book he said again very expensive rm350. U think what we dont have money to pay for rm350. Then he scold other staff in front of us. We are very dissapointed with the male or leader or the supervisor of that restaurant. But for the chinese restaurant the staff very polite. The food also nice but little bit expensive but for us no problem as long it worth it. Valet also not very organize. Haywire if you use that service. Sorry to said but i only can give 2 out of 5 star.

However, the hotel is advised to strengthen their resources especially during peak holiday season to not disappoint your guests that can only managed to check-in around 6 pm. Luckily they allow late check-out, but again who likes to arrive the hotel but to wait for 2-3 hours just for a room. Due to distant parking lot, do expect some waiting time for shuttle van & do not leave valuable & useful things in your car. Overall, all of the staff are polite and attentive. Keep up the attitude.

Title: Relaxing, friendly staff
Review: It's a relaxing resort with a nice view. Staff are friendly but without communication among therefore taking long time to solve problems. Rooms are not clean, although i had requested a clean room during booking & had to move to another room due to technical problem. Asked for housekeeping on the second day but after 5 hours when i went in the room, it remained unclean & nobody came even i called front desk. It was settled by i saw staff entering pantry room & asked for help! I can tolerate with some inconveniences during RMCO but not in this way!

Title: 2 days 1 Night vacation
Review: My trip was okay. Need to wait until 8.30pm for 2nd batch to join buffet dinner. During check in, I was informed by the receptionist to just walk in to the cafe and no reservation needed. However, when I attended at 6.20pm, the Person in Charge told us that the buffet is already full house. Need to wait for 2nd batch at 8.30pm. The foods was average and they didn't top up the pasta. I requested for birthday decoration but was informed to wait for 40minutes upon check in. Thought the room was ready when I reached. Nvm, I canceled the request and manage to proceed to the room with disappointed feeling.

Title: great for short weekend getaway
Review: 1. check in process - good and efficient 2. hotel staff - superb! friendly and helpful 3. room - need to improvise on the balcony cleanliness. I presume we were the first batch of visitors after the MCO period thus the rooms are quite dusty and the condition of the balcony area was a bit dirty. However, the cleaners did came by and help out with the cleaning process. TQ for the prompt responds. 4. Buggy - suggestion to have more buggy driver so that we don't have to wait for a long time to ride on the buggy 5.Restaurant - need to improve on the food availability especially during the dinner time. No outside food are allowed in the facilities but only 2 operating restaurant during dinner time is not sufficient enough to cater for all the guests.

Title: Excellent Hospitality
Review: We stayed at the Family Villa for 2 days and 1 night. It was superb and excellent experiences. Staff are all super friendly and very helpful. Food (room service and the breakfast buffet) was delicious! I love the Mee Goreng Mamak that we ordered via Room Service on the first night. We had the best view for sunrise and sunset! and side note: if you are thinking of dining out - there is Bagan Lalang seafood restaurants as well as street food nearby and if you are feeling adventurous you can drive to Pantai Morib for lunch. Overall Avani Sepang Goldcoast Resort is excellent and I totally recommend this place to everyone.

Address: No 67 Jalan Pantai Bagan Lalang, Kg Bagan Lalang, Sepang / KLIA, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 43950
NandA: Avani Sepang Goldcoast Resort ;No 67 Jalan Pantai Bagan Lalang, Kg Bagan Lalang, Sepang / KLIA, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 43950
Title: Exceptional
Review: They cancel our booking the day before the date we were supposed to check-in, which is very unacceptable. Apart from that, the damage control was indeed good. Fortunately they found us new rooms that we could spend the night there. The manager gave us complementary lunch the next day, and the service was also nice. But, I still can't accept the fact that they cancel our booking on the very last minute, and expect us to find another hotel to stay in.

Title: bad experience, horrible breakfast, hotel strict-non negotiable
Review: Checkin on 12 Dec 2020 on level 9 Discovered the hotel air conditioned is problem n switch room at 12am midnight. Later found that the aircond is problem too. Maybe level 9 has aircond problem. Bad sleeping n hot night it was Major dissapointment is the breakfast which i paid extra rm 50 for. It was the worst. Limited menu n taste bad. Consumption is control by hotel staff. Nasi lemak sambal taste bad. Cereal milk taste like plain water. Pancake is so rough. Sausage feels cheap n not cook. Omelette is nothing inside it. Worst breakfast experience ever in kl hotel. I have pictures to proof if only i can post it here.

Title: Great Location but?

You need to pay deposit based on how long you want to stay. (RM 300/per night) 2. Didn't provide dishwashing liquid. 3. If you paid for extra bed. Don't forget to asked for it because they will not prepare the extra bed for you. 4. its seems like the room didn't being use for along time cause had a BED BUG. 5. you need to wait around 5 minutes - 10 minutes for the elevator. especially during peak hours Suggestion during stay : please snap a photo every inch of the room include the bed sheet because they will charge you for something that is not came from you. don't be like us because we didnt snap the proof at the beggining.
