Title: All are good except for CHECK-OUT
Review: All were good we felt very disappointed during the check out time. As far as I am concern, the price of our stay are included together with the housekeeping services.. Unfortunately, during our check out time they found 2 towel with brown marks on it & they claimed it as STAIN..So,they were quite hesitant to refund our full deposit and informed us that RM60 WILL BE DEDUCTED. So,we went back to our room to find out if it was a stain or not... Guess what? It was just the powder marks and we decided to wash. It was definitely aren't stubborn stains as it went off as soon as we started washing...So, when we explained to them that it is washable, they told us TO WASH BOTH THE TOWELS IN ORDER FOR THEM TO REFUND FULL AMOUNT...This was really disheartening as we have never came across like this in any of the 5 stars hotel that we have even stayed in before. I am sure the housekeeping ppl were supposed to do the job. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED & THIS CAN BE MADE IT CLEAR IN NEAR FUTURE !

Title: Underwhelming
Review: Unfortunately, other than the unit is spacious and it has a nice view of KL city, I have nothing positive to say about this place. During our stay, the water somehow turned green which is a sign of contamination, yet hotel guests especially kids were allowed to swim regardless the health hazard. The "hot water" is not even warm at max temperature settings. The unit is also equipped with android tv box which is nice, but hopping from channel to channel is painfully slow which can turn you off from watching tv. I hope they improve the quality of service since this place has so much potential due to its location and view.

Title: Bad Reception
Review: One of the worst receptions I ever had. The PIC texted me to confirm my arrival time. I replied in less than a minute, then PIC told me they would send me self check-in details in a while. I did not receive any instructions even after a few hours. I texted the PIC that I was on the way & told the PIC regarding my ETA. 0 replies, I called the PIC but they did not pick up. When I reached the destination, the check in counter was empty and I waited there for 20+ minutes before someone attended to me.

On the check out day I have to check out as early as 9am but the front desk was still unavailable there‚Äôs no staff. The other staff told me it‚Äôs not opened yet which is soo frustrating (bcause I have to check out early and get my rm200 deposit) so u actually can checkout as early as 10am. I have to go somewhere else and come again to check out. The toilet is quite smelly. Dirty and stained blankets. 4 star for the spacious room but overall 0.5/5 star. Not going to stay there again. Thanks.

NandA: D'Majestic Place by Widebed ;376 Jalan Pudu, Pudu, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55100
Title: the room is dirty, the customer service is not 24-hour
Review: The toilet sink had a foul smell. The welcome towel on the bed and the quilt in the wardrobe are stained and smelly. Customer service is not round-the-clock, which leads to many problems that cannot be solved immediately. For example, we booked a room for four people, but the sofa bed was not well laid, and there were no sheets in the wardrobe, so we had to sleep on the dirty sofa overnight. The problem was solved the second day.

Address: 376 Jalan Pudu, Pudu, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55100

Address: 376 Jalan Pudu, Pudu, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55100

Title: Enjoyable stay

Address: 376 Jalan Pudu, Pudu, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55100
NandA: D'Majestic Place by Widebed ;376 Jalan Pudu, Pudu, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55100
Title: Good stay in KL
Review: The room size is big. I book for 6 ppl but the amenities is only for 4 ppl (towel, etc). Also the sofa bed does not have a bed sheet or proper blanket. They have quilt and pillow in the closet but they don't have cover. The pool view is fantastic but the water is not as clear as other 4 star hotel. My room got a washing machine and dryer also microwave and an electric stove so you should be able to cook lightly, but I did not use them. Also the hot water is only available in 1 of the bathroom (stay in room 1308). There is 7-11 store just next to the lobby and many good eatery (halal or non) around. LRT is across the street (pudu station) but I just use grab all the way because of family. Also there is no cleaning service during your stay. View at nigth from the room also good (city side).

Title: Couldn‚Äôt believe my eyes !
Review: First off we were greeted by front desk staff member Shoba. This woman is amazing, she goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is as planned. Shoba informed us all about the city and easy ways of getting around. She maintained a very positive and professional attitude our entire stay and was more than approachable. Great work Shoba. This place is absolutely stunning, the rooms are massive and very beautiful, with an even more outstanding view. The roof top endless pool will give you a photo sure to rack you up some serious social media attention. My favourite was the gym, it had a beautiful view and enough to get a good pump going. Thank you Shoba and crew for an amazing stay ! If you have the pleasure to book this hotel don‚Äôt sleep on it !

Title: Cheaper options for hotel with similar facility
Review: The owner of the room is different with apartment management so it's quite confusing for first timer who tried this kind of hotel options and cannot really asked for help from the receptionist regarding the room utility. The staff already reached out in the morning before check-in to give his contact so made me less worry, but he can only be contacted from 9 am till 6pm. The room was clean, has iron, fridge and hairdryer. Daily cleaning was not provided. There is pool but only open until 10pm not like other apartment. All area outside the room din't have aircon, quite hot. Pudu station is across the hotel. 7eleven and bus stop to bukit bintang area is just right beside the hotel

The surrounding it no great, not much to do and you have to grab a cab everytime you wanna go somewhere

Review: This is my second time staying here. The first is okay. This second time is the best! Staff are friendly, all the facilities in good condition. Near to convenient store, mamaks, computer centre, LRT & others. Thank you for the pleasant stay :)

Address: 376 Jalan Pudu, Pudu, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55100
NandA: D'Majestic Place by Widebed ;376 Jalan Pudu, Pudu, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 55100
Title: Pls note that you need to get a room number before arrival
Review: I reached the place at 10 pm, was shocked to find out there was no receptionist, only security guards. They asked for my room number which I had no clue about. I later found out that a message would be sent to me after my booking was confirmed. I searched through every emails I had but found no room number. The guards told me to call the person-in-charge whom did not pick up the phone at all. We were tired and had an early tour the next day. Finally after waiting for 45 mins did another person contact me to get hold of the room card. The room was clean and decent. The rooftop swimming pool has an excellent view, too bad it was closed at 9-10 pm. We did not get to swim but the water looked clean. If it was not because of the staff, I would have given this place a better score.

Title: Unsatisfied service
Review: AC was not working properly and mini fridge was not working. Went down the first time to request for checking. Staff came and check, changed some valve in the AC and changed a fridge for us and left (mentioned that after half an hour AC will be back to normal). Waited for an hour plus, AC was still not cold. Went down to reception for the second time to request for checking again. Staff noted on our request but no one came. Didn‚Äôt want to trouble ourselves to go down to lobby again so we just bare with the hot AC for the whole night. During checkout, all lifts were jam packed, waited for more than half an hour and finally decided to went up to the highest floor just to get down to G Floor. Management might want to consider allocating different checkout times for different floor customers to avoid this situation. Totally no social distancing was able to be kept because everyone just wanted to get down quickly. Won‚Äôt consider visiting here again next time.

Title: First and Probably Last
Review: Very bad check in process with extremely long Q at check in counter . Took us some 1.5-2hours wait in the Q prior to check in . My children ordered in room dining but the hotel kitchen staff refused to take order as they said the bill cannot be put under room charges . I contacted the F& B personnel and told to put under room and they said all sorted out but after checking with my kids, they still couldn't placed order with the same reason given. After ding dong for two hours plus, then only the in room food came. Me and my wife were in a function at the hotel at that time. Breakfast timing were given to us in 3 slots and we got the 6am slot but after telling the front counter lady, she managed to change it to 9.30am slot but on first come first serve basis but some of the people staying in the hotel were told no breakfast can be provided as its fullhouse but they actually paid for breakfast already

Title: Short weekend getaway during MCO
Review: With MCO restrictions preventing travelling to far away resorts, we decided to have a short couple getaway in the heart of the city. Pros: Great value for money considering although most of the hotel facilities were closed due to restrictions. Room facilities were nice and clean while the king sized bed was comfy. Stayed on the 28th floor so had a nice city view. Cons: The buffet breakfast was really poor. We ordered American breakfast and nasi lemak. The food was bland and frankly could have tasted way better. Hot coffee was cold by the time it reached the room and no microwave in room to heat it up.

Review: The rooms are clean, comfortable, and luxurious. Front desk staff (Jolene in particular) were extremely pleasant and professional. The only major downside was the almost complete lack of SOP compliance by guests that were allowed happen. Hotel security allowed guests to walk freely around common areas and use lifts without wearing masks. Breakfast buffet was way overcrowded to the point where social distancing could not even be managed. I understand the hotel wants to treat their guests right but this is downright negligent. I sincerely hope hotel management sees this and takes the pandemic more seriously.

Title: Best view at the lobby
Review: The room is huge and I paid extra to get the view facing KLCC park. The lobby is at level 38 and you can see most of the KL city in 360 degree because the building is in round shape and is covered by huge glass panel window. Breakfast is okay and try to get your table facing Petronas Twin Towers. Pool size is decent and I like the poolside bed because it makes u feel like at beach resort. Just a short walking distance to KLCC and Pavilion.

NandA: Grand Hyatt Kuala Lumpur Hotel ;12 Jalan Pinang, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50450
Title: Truly "Grand"
Review: This was my family's first stay at Grand Hyatt and I must say that we were truly impressed. Every touch point was simply a marvellous experience, despite the SOPs being observed at all times. Long queue during check in due to social distancing? No problem. Friendly staff are there to take you to their other counters for speedier check-in (they have 3 check-in lobbies!). Big crowd during breakfast. No issue, as they have two venues for breakfast. Spacious & modern room plus breathtaking view of KLCC for all to see. What more do you need? Truly grand not only in name but in experience as well.

But it is the friendly and efficient staff that attends to you when needed that makes the stay even more pleasant.

Would be a 5/5 stay if the room facilities are well maintained

Address: 12 Jalan Pinang, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50450
NandA: Grand Hyatt Kuala Lumpur Hotel ;12 Jalan Pinang, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50450
Title: A Grand Staycation
Review: My first stay at Grand Hyatt KL was with my family. We had two kids from my sister's family, so I requested an additional roll-over bed which they accommodated. We stayed for one night and had a wonderful swim in their lovely pool before having dinner at Thirty Eight, which was very good. The scenic view of KLCC was an added bonus. The breakfast buffet the following morning was equally good, with quality and variety. The staff we encountered throughout our stay were professional, polite, friendly, and efficient. When you pay this much for a hotel stay, you expect top quality service, and the staff at Grand Hyatt KL certainly delivered. One of my best experiences staying and dining in a hotel.

Title: Excellent
Review: Nice hotel. Rarely share an elevator ride with other people which is good for an introvert like me and to keep social distancing. Breakfast spread were limited. Probably due to MCO restriction and time limitation set to have the breakfast (an hour for each guest). I like the lake view. Worth paying a bit more. Parking is fine. Near to KL Sentral and Nu Sentral shopping mall so food wasn't an issue. All in all it was a great staycation.

Address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, KL Sentral, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50470
NandA: Hilton Kuala Lumpur ;3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, KL Sentral, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50470
Title: Lives up to its name
Review: First day checking in was smooth despite the gazillions of people (weekend) and that locals are cooped up in the same state. Guests were directed to a waiting area - cafes etc. I would say they managed the situation well. I believe staff from top to bottom came out to help manage the crowd and did what they can to ensure everyone gets their room within the same hour. Which they did on that day. Room was clean and of course maintained as expected. Staff were attentive and acted swiftly.Maybe my experience is different from others - as I could see there were guests that complained about delayed housekeeping etc I mean there are thousands of guests and only several teams handling so many aspects of hotel managing. Put yourselves in their shoes. Again, this is my experience and it was a great stay for what I have paid for. To all the staff at Hilton KL, keep up the good work. Thank you.

Title: Good

NandA: Hilton Kuala Lumpur ;3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, KL Sentral, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50470
Title: Unfriendly staff!
Review: The room and facilities were good, nice ambience but the staffs very really unfriendly. We (4 of us) went on to the cafe for a coffee on Saturday evening (About 6pm +). We was treated so badly 1) We was seated on the table and that‚Äôs it, nobody came up for a menu or for any orders 2) Eventually after 5 minutes, we told a waitress there we need a menu for order and was said will assign someone to attend us 3) 10 minutes passed, nobody came. We eventually called up another waiter and he served us with the menu And guess what? After serving the menu nobody came back for the order..literally no one! We wasted about 20 minutes for nothing and we left the cafe. Visited Le Meridien cafe, and let me be honest i got the coffee in 10 minutes. They were super friendly and attentive to us. Its a real bad experience for us, Hilton you got to buck up your ‚Äòunfriendly and inattentive employees‚Äô!

Address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, KL Sentral, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50470
NandA: Hilton Kuala Lumpur ;3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, KL Sentral, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50470
Title: Everything was great except breakfast...
Review: This is our first time staying in Hilton KL. In general, everything was great! The room was spacious and cleaned nicely, bed was comfy, the view we got was superb... just the perfect place for a short stay-cation. The only complaint I have was breakfast. We arrived the restaurant at 9:35am, ordered once but the staff took our order again when he saw our food was still not served at 10:00am, in the end breakfast was only served to us at 10:15am. Breakfast was supposed to be until 10:30am due to the MCO restrictions; though they gave us the freedom stay on and didn't ask us to leave at 10:30am, waiting 40 minutes for the same breakfast served to everyone else was kinda unacceptable, especially for a veteran hotel like Hilton. That being said, we look forward to the improvement, and also our next stay in your hotel.

It was a bit disappointing for me because my husband was itching due to his skin being sensitive to dust. I hope this problem will not happen again. Thank you

Title: wonderful wonderful place
Review: i never knew how close this hotel was to my place of work. firstly, i would want to commend ayie, the hohtel staff responsible for my check in. He was very helpful, accomodating, friendly and he sorted out my parking issues very quickly and even the room i had wrongly requested.. secondly, the pool and rooftop bar was top notch. the music, the food and service was incredible. and thirdly, their buffet breakfast was simply amazing. hands down. the selection and the price for it was something i would come for again and again. overall great experience.. my only issue was the parking.. my touch and go didnt have enough credit so i had to wait for the security guard to come and get me which was a bit of a nuisance..and the parking faced a market so the traffic was a bit unpredictable ! but otherwise i would give thumbs up and recommend to stay especially at the prices now...

Title: Great location, beautiful interior, good value for money
Review: I love the interior of the room, location is great, can see the twin towers from my room. Premium room was very spacious with king bed and long bench chair by the window. Pool is quite small but has pretty exterior. I asked for honeymoon arrangement since we are celebrating our 1st Anniversary, but the staff said due to SOP, they couldn‚Äôt provide the honeymoon arrangement. Asked if they can give us an upgrade for 1 night (second night) as we have already booked a premium room for 2 nights but we understand it was peak season so the staff couldn‚Äôt provide the same. The bar was also closed due to new year‚Äôs eve dinner. Breakfast is decent. All staff was really helpful and cheerful. Overall, we had an enjoyable and pleasant stay! Highly recommended and would come back again.

Title: Value for money, service need to be improve

Concierge is the most important part of a hotel yet the service was most disappointing. There were 3 person in front of me and it took more than 10minutes to check in a customer. Tissue box, hotel slippers are all upon request. The centralized music system at corridor starts at 8am which is really annoying.

Staff are friendly however in the new year eve night when everybody want to enjoy the night how come only 1 bell boy and 1 receptionist are in charge whereas there are few peoples queuing. Wasted a lot of my family's time. 4. Understand that they hv limited space for parking especially in peak season but at least there's someone should standby to direct us where to park.

Title: Great hotel but staff need to treat people better
Review: It is a nice hotel right in the heart of Bukit Bintang near Changkat and Berjaya times square mall. The metro station is a few meters away. The location is perfect and that's where the good part ends. The restaurant is severely overpriced for a rather drab menu. The real problem was that the attitude of the staff was extremely poor and not befitting of the brand Melia is known to carry. I do get that it was offered at a much lower rate than the usual because of the Covid crisis but that doesn't mean you treat your guests any lesser. The water bottles weren't replaced on a regular basis each day. Every request to get water bottles were treated with scorn. I had to walk to the 24 hour mart in the wee hours of morning to buy myself water after I was told they ran out of stock rather rudely ! I will not recommend it to anyone I know unless they have location as their only priority. Hospitality is all about attitude and that too the right kind.

Title: ROOM SO SMELLY AND BAD ENVIROMENT!!!
Review: I was check in around 3pm at Counter and the Staff inform us. Only 2 person in 1 room (kids also consider a person), not even mention the new rules during PKPB. No view at all, only 2-3 level are open. So creepy once you enter the room. The Bad Smell come from the carpet, the aircond also not functioning as well. We have to change the elevator 2 times just to reach the swimming pool and also need to climb the stairs. No Towel provided at the pool, no any person incharge to ask for. I checked in for 2 hours. This is not a 4star hotel, OYO is better than this. Wasted my money!!!!

NandA: Pacific Regency Hotel Suites ;KH Tower, Jalan Punchak, Off Jalan P. Ramlee (Opposite KL Tower), KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50250
Title: The pool is not for kids
Review: This is my second time stay in this hotel. During the first stay, the pool was closed for renovation. Then we came once the pool is back in business. Itl is not suitable for small kids (mine is 4yrs & 2yrs). The pool is attached in club/pub, so the moving around area is very limited. You need to get towel from reception @ L7, but they did not mention during check in. so, I have to go down twice for this. My room is not clean, I saw a shirt inside cabinet which might belong to person before me. Then there's a leftover food on the floor. My bathtub plug is faulty, hence the kids cannot enjoyed playing in bathtub. Overall, I think this is my last stay in here.

Title: Bad New Year 2021
Review: This is my first time with the bad service at 5 star hotel. 1. Calling maintainer to check on the room air conditioner it take me twice to call. 2. The breakfast is badly service with a black over cook egg. 3. Purchase the hotel with 2 days breakfast but only provide 1 day 4. At Loop the service miss place my bottle 5. The room charges got extra term n condition as not been told during check in 6. The parking is very narrow and dirty 7. Renovation construction is on going

Address: KH Tower, Jalan Punchak, Off Jalan P. Ramlee (Opposite KL Tower), KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50250
NandA: Pacific Regency Hotel Suites ;KH Tower, Jalan Punchak, Off Jalan P. Ramlee (Opposite KL Tower), KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50250
Title: Honest feedback.
Review: I will just leave my honest review here. The room I took is very spacious, I love it. However, as the check in time is 3 pm, I am quite disappointed as I didn't managed to get my room key right on time. It was delayed until 3.40pm with a reason that the hotel was fully booked a day before. I understand the situation however it was not supposed to be put on the customer's shoulder. The bath tub stopper didn't worked properly, but that was fine as they sent their maintenance staff to check upon it after I called the receptionist and it worked just fine right after. On top of that, I called the receptionist asking for the wifi ID and password, they said it is stated on the key holder that they gave to me upon checking in, however they were none stated there. (I even took picture of the holder), I guess they were rushing to pass me the key, they forgotten to jot down the details. The way the staff talked on the phone also is not really friendly as if he was annoyed I asked the question, hence I just use my mobile data throughout my staycation there. Other than 3 points I stated up here, everything else was superb. The room, the cleanliness is top notch.

Title: disappointing and misleading
Review: i called to enquire if cooking facilities are provided and was told it will be provided to me complimentary. after getting confirmation it will be provided for free, i proceeded to make the booking. upon check in i noticed the cooking facilities were not prepared. not even plates or cutlery were available. i proceeded to check with front desk and was told i need to pay RM150 to use the cooking facilities in the room! i explained i did enquire before booking and if i was told i'd need to pay RM150 to cook my own food, i wouldn't have booked this place in the beginning! no one wanted to take responsibility for the deceiving info given to me and even suggested i cook my raw food with a microwave! next morning i requested for plate and basic cutlery, but it also never came until i checked out. the room was horrible- clogged bathroom sink, faulty hot shower, noisy a/c, limited TV channels and noisy pipe system. worst hotel experience for me!

Address: KH Tower, Jalan Punchak, Off Jalan P. Ramlee (Opposite KL Tower), KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50250
NandA: Pacific Regency Hotel Suites ;KH Tower, Jalan Punchak, Off Jalan P. Ramlee (Opposite KL Tower), KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50250
Title: Acceptable
Review: The Pacific Regency Hotel Suites was without doubt the most depressing hotel experience I have ever endured. Only upon arrival was I informed the pool and bar were closed for refurbishment, a very unprofessional and greedy decision by the hotel not to inform me of this in advance in order to allow me the opportunity to make alternate arrangements. The extreme noise from this refurbishment work is omnipresent throughout the building and goes on long into the night. The drab, dilapidated rooms are dirty and worn, from the stained walls, carpets, and disgusting toilet to the broken safe, poorly functioning air conditioning and the petty decision to charge for the use of printers displays an embarrassing lack of effort made by the Pacific Regency Hotel Suites and their extreme lack of respect for their unfortunate guests. This hotel attempts to represent itself as quality business experience but in reality it is of low quality in the extreme.

Title: Good Stay. Not the best housekeeping
Review: It was a pleasant stay. The unit is ok. Parking surcharge is RM20 per day per parking. The toaster was really corroded but i didnt use it so it didnt bother me that much. If you are planning to stay for a day its definitely great. But, if you planning to stay more than 1 day, you cannot expect the housekeeper will come in and do the cleaning. She will just come and pass the plastic bags to you and show you the trash room and ask you to do everything yourself. And shes not really pleasant on the phone either. I have a doubt she never do proper cleaning of the house because you can see traces of coffee spills on the wall at the sink and the dining table was not properly wiped either. Thank God i bring my own sheets. üòÖ. Maybe owner should do a spot check once in a while.

Title: will not repeat again to this property
Review: first of all, i would like to thanks to Mr Wong to change my booking date with additional charge and i really appreciate it. I know Mr Wong is a nice guy and i dont blame him at all about this property. okay here we go about my complaint:- 1) in our previous message, they allowed me to park for awhile at lobby for check in however the day i arrived, about 220pm, the security guard not allowed any car to enter the barrier to the lobby. i make a few round the resident to looking for empty place to park my car for awhile but there is no any empty lot until i met up with 1 of security guard named Mr Laxman and i explained to him. then only he open the barrier to allowed me to park for awhile. because of this my mood spoil already. 2) i waiting Ms Sonia about 35 minutes to received the room key card (B-9-3) which make me getting bored at lobby. She came and walk like a model and didnt apologies at all because make me waiting too longer. 3) The airconditioner in B-9-3 is totally out of service! Both aircond in room and at the hall not function at all. Again, my mood spoil because of this. If u want the customer repeat to this property, pls service your airconditioner.

Hotel Name: The Best KLCC View @ Regalia Residences
Address: Chowkit / Putra WTC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
NandA: The Best KLCC View @ Regalia Residences ;Chowkit / Putra WTC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Title: VERY RUDE STAFF AND NOT ACCOMMODATING
Review: The female staff (Sania) was very rude and didn't welcome me with a smile. She was even shouting at me by the time I didn't understand what she was saying since she has a different accent (Indian). It was really annoying. I already informed the owner that I will be coming at exactly 3pm but the staff showed 30mins late as if there is no waiting outside. She didn't even orient me about the facilities of the building and just handed me the keys of the room and I needed to directly asked the owner about how to go to the infinity pool since it is located on the different building. Although the room is very clean, there's no free drinking water provided to me which was supposed to be included on my booking. You might consider booking with other hosts which offer lower price rather than this one.

Title: Worth the price you pay
Review: Pros -Great location at centre of KL -well equip with basic utensils -wifi, smart tv -2 airconds -Really great for those who travel for works or honeymoon -Great staff assistant Cons - should include mineral water or filter water -provide 3in1 drink or etc -the heater seems little bit take time to wa up - should provide the manual used on the washing machine

Address: The Robertson, No 2, Jalan Robertson, Bukit Bintang, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50150
NandA: The Robertson Kuala Lumpur ;The Robertson, No 2, Jalan Robertson, Bukit Bintang, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50150
Title: Great services & locations
Review: We booked 3bedroom units at level 22-corner unit. Pros:- - great location, right in the middle of kl city center (bukit bintang area & pudu). Walking distance to eatery places such as mamak , kopitiam and cafe . Have 7eleven and convenient fruits stores just beside the building. -Staff are really friendly and helpful. I checkin slightly earlier, but the staff really help me go through the details and procedures (Middle East guy , i think his name is louay). Requested for 2 parking which is FOC just need to pay deposits. And were given out 2 sets of access cards as per our earlier request. -very nice view from our units and great staycation for groups, facilities inside the unit are great (provided with cooking appliances and large fridge, wifi with tv and netflix, toiletries and washing & dryer machine, enough amenities for our group). -2 quuen bed and 2 single beds (is actually a studio unit with 1 room, but they renovated it into 2 other small room with sliding door partition, the 2 single beds room are not attached with any aircond or fans but it is good enough as u can still feel the aircond from the living room area). -parking space is convenient and easy access to go in and out , the guards also really helpful. -the frontdesk staff help me to create a whatsapp group and they are accessible all the time. (The unit actually operated by Maplehome-they even have their own office at the ground floor). Cons:- -lifts are really slow especially during peak hours. -sounds proof are not that great, especially if you unlucky to have a noisy neighbors üòÖ. -no drinking water provided, but there is a vending machine at lobby area (drinking water, sodas and some snacks). -only one toilet (even though is a 3bedroom unit)so might be a problems if u are coming with big group. Overall it is great and valuable for ur money. Reccomended

Title: Be Careful
Review: Not happy with my host MAPLEHOME as they do not provide honest offer. I‚Äôve booked for 2 bedroom suite and upon arrival, they offer me unit S-32-10, which i believe it was a unit which converted to 2 bedroom. There are wood partition between the living hall and the other side was a small room. A very cramp unit, as i was travelling with 3 adults n 3 children. When i complaint, they said, the 2 room apartment were fully booked and they offered me with 1+1 unit, which i have no choice to accept it. It was unit no S-28-07. The moment walked in the unit, the SEWAGE SMELL WAS TOOO STRONG and it was very terrible! I asked for another change, but however my request was not being entertained . I have no choice to stay in the unit for 2 days and i have to buy my own air freshener to cover the smells just a little bit. So pls be careful when browsing their website and the rooms display is just too good to be true. Really upset with my vacation this time. üòî

NandA: The Robertson Kuala Lumpur ;The Robertson, No 2, Jalan Robertson, Bukit Bintang, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50150
Title: Lovely escape at the heart of KL city
Review: I stayed 2 nights in a one-bedroom apartment to celebrate my 1st wedding anniversary, and I must say everything exceeded my expectation. It was worth every penny because this place is amazingly well equipped with kitchen appliances, washing machine, fridge, a nice dining table and a cozy living room section where you can watch TV all night long. The lovely interior makes you feel right at home and the cleanliness just took my worries away while enjoying my stay amid pandemic. The check-in & check-out process was a breeze and the staff was friendly and accommodating. There is a wide array of dining options nearby from Mamak restaurant, coffee shops to Western cuisines and also 24 hours convenient store where you can buy some of your essential items. Places of attractions like Jalan Alor, Bukit Bintang and Berjaya Time Square are easily walkable. Needless to say, this place is a hidden gem in the heart of KL city. Would come back soon!

Title: Quiet hideaway from the city
Review: Stayed here for 3 nights on a weekend getaway. Location is far from the city. We drove, so it wasn‚Äôt a problem. You will definitely need wheels if you choose to stay here. This resort is expansive with lots of greenery and open space. Room size is decent. Bathroom is big. The bed and pillow are very comfortable, just the right hardness. However the walls are mouldy probably due to water leakage from the aircon. Can see water marks. Toilet seat has stains all over and can tell it‚Äôs not the right fit for the WC unit. It seems like it‚Äôs recycled from elsewhere. Room rate came with breakfast. Decent offering, not fantastic. Enough to fill the tummy. My husband used the gym and he gives it two thumbs up. There was some confusion upon checkout when I asked for refund on 6% service tax exemption as announced by the Malaysian government for hotel stays between Mar-Aug 2020. I was told to claim it from Agoda but Agoda advised me to claim from hotel instead. It‚Äôs being resolved right now.

Review: Upgraded from executive deluxe to club room.very happy bout it. room is perfect overlooking green golf view and pool right beside our room 120.the room is clean with nice bathtub ,and when we asked for praying mat and towel,the staff responded very fast. the breakfast is limited at the club resort but they gv us choice to go to saujana charcoal buffet which was great.staff very attentive and respectful.the trees, surrounding nature are very well taken care. .impressive.room at good price too. cant wait to come here again.

Address: Jalan Lapangan Terbang SAAS, Subang Jaya, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 40150
NandA: The Saujana Hotel Kuala Lumpur ;Jalan Lapangan Terbang SAAS, Subang Jaya, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 40150
Title: Unsatisfactory
Review: When you enter the room it has a strong mould smell. changed the room 3 times and no change in smell. Hotel is old and needs to be renovated urgently. NOT a five star hotel ! After telling the receptionist (male Indian) he encountered me unfriendly not helpful at all. Not appropriate for five star hotel rather a cheap budget hostel. At night my grandmother woke up because of the bad smell in the room. Many things in the room had to be fixed, from broken bath hangers to exploding bulbs and so on. Overall not recommendable.

Address: Jalan Lapangan Terbang SAAS, Subang Jaya, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 40150

Title: Unpleasant stay
Review: I was disappointed on my recent stay at this hotel. When i walk in to the hotel room, there is water leaking from the main door, secondly there is an unpleasant smell, it should be come from the aircond, and third was the washroom, the toilet bowl got stain, my husband try to wash it but it‚Äôs not removeable. Actually this is my 2nd time stay at this hotel. The 1st time was 4 years back, and that time everything were ok. That‚Äôs why i plan to come back again due to valentine‚Äôs day. But it makes me feel disappointed. I hope that the they should upkeep the hotel room, especially cleaniless.

The parking space is heavily guard so feel safe to park your car in this hotel. This hotel is also connected to Cheras Mall, but there wasn't much shop going on. But it's okay, you can always go to Eko Cheras, Leisure mall, and others to buy your stuff. Grab Food and Food Panda also delivers here so feel free to order from them if you're having difficulties to find something to eat. I will be staying at this hotel again for my next hospital appointment due to my good experience in here.

I also understand because that day got many guest so it‚Äôs okay. After finish bath, I want to use the towel, omg very smelly!! Both of the towel also same! I request to change the towel but no one bother me üò≠ Ok nvm I understand also because of many guest. The next day, my bf and I woke up at 7am, you know why ? Because beside my room‚Äôs guest is too noisy until I can‚Äôt sleep!!! Very annoying and angry with this situation! Even though I ‚Äòknock‚Äô the wall for few times but they didn‚Äôt keep quiet also, I mean those kids. Ughh.. first time having bad experience in this hotel... Hopefully will improve your service, but I also will visit again. Cheers.

Title: Nice hotel but services can be improved
Review: The hotel was decent and very clean but we waited 2 hours for housekeeping to set up our sofa bed despite calling 3 times. What‚Äôs worse is that upon checking in the receptionist told us that housekeeping would come immediately. We were also vastly disappointed when we waited close to 30 minutes for our car to be picked up by jockey only to find out that our car key was still being kept in the drawer. We understand that it was New Year‚Äôs Eve and occupancy was high. But due to language barrier, it was difficult to liaise with the hotel staffs as well because it appeared that they couldn‚Äôt really understand what we were trying to say. We hope that the hotel would provide more training to their staffs to deal with these kind of situations in the future.

There are lots of nice eateries within a short walking distance. Thank you Stripes for the R&R I wanted.

Besides, the variety of the breakfast and also the cocktail section is not much but the food and drink come with quality so i still can tolerance with it. Overall is awesome, and i will try Majestic Hotel on my next visit which is the sister company of Hotel Stripe:)

Title: Very good
Review: Deluxe room, RM313/n 1. General: A New & Vibrant looking hotel, with very attentive receptionists. May find it difficult to get to the hotel thru self-drive as it‚Äôs situation along a one way road (not facing main road); Provides car vallet parking @ RM10 (doesn‚Äôt have own parking) - expect 10-15mins for car collection during peak hours; Monorial station 8mins walk away - 3stations away to Bukit Bintang. Alternatively RM5 Grab car; 2. Bedroom: Cosy; Clean; spacious, comfy bed and sofa, tv w sufficient varieties of channels; lights switches are easily reachable from bedside; Went extra mile to provide deco/cake if you‚Äôre there for special occasions/anniversary 3. Toilet: Clean; Thoughtful toilet roll hanger (flat top to place handphone or book); sufficient hangers for towels; 4. In room Amenities: Complimentary bar, coffee machine (w capsules - if comes w milk, will be a plus point), 5. Breakfast @ RM55/pax: choices are moderate but taste good and serves good coffee;

Hotel Name: Hotel Stripes Kuala Lumpur, Autograph Collection
Address: 25 Jalan Kamunting, Golden Triangle, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50300
NandA: Hotel Stripes Kuala Lumpur, Autograph Collection ;25 Jalan Kamunting, Golden Triangle, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50300
Title: Up to the Autograph standard!
Review: My first time to stay in this area, as well as this property specifically. The room was fantastic, with lots of attention to the little details. Fantastic facilities, but where I really want to take the time here in the review is with the staffing. Literally every single person I met treated every guest like a VIP. From the valet and porter working in tandem, to front desk reception, to our server in the Club floor lounge, to the housekeeper, to the phone operator, to the duty manager and staff of the restaurant at the buffet breakfast - everyone here was simply brilliant. It is not the Majestic, in terms of opulence and grandiose facilities, but it IS absolutely a standout in terms of the lion-sized hearts of everyone I interacted with.

Hotel Name: Hotel Stripes Kuala Lumpur, Autograph Collection
Address: 25 Jalan Kamunting, Golden Triangle, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50300
NandA: Hotel Stripes Kuala Lumpur, Autograph Collection ;25 Jalan Kamunting, Golden Triangle, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50300
Title: Very picturesque hotel with exceptional staff!
Review: The room exactly matched the photos that we saw on the website. Very comfortable with a very personalized touch and decor with all the necessities -- the fact that the bar was replenished daily (for free might I add) was a huge blessing! My wife and I genuinely appreciated that that 4 new complimentary bottles of water were supplied every day - something that none of the hotels we have stayed in previously have ever offered! (You usually have to buy your own water!) Housekeeping was exceptional -- always on time every morning with attention to detail -- I'd like to commend Motin for his great work. Front desk was always very welcoming and courteous -- our commendations and kind regards to Kingson, Su and Johnathan! Also the valet and outdoor greeting stuff were always quick on their feet to attend to our bags and car door opening -- thank you Sumon! In all, I cannot fault this great hotel -- we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here! God bless you all! Glenn

Title: Fantastic Memory
Review: Travelling in this pandemic make us a bit worried but the hotel followed the SOP tightly. Chekc on temperature, hand sanitise and check in MySejahtera. I seldom stay in local hotel because I‚Äôm staying nearby but wish to have some relaxing staycation so I choose Sunway Velocity Hotel. The pool is operating with control on number of pax. We need to book in advance for the pool service which I feel it‚Äôs a good at this period of time. The hotel cleanliness is superb! The carpet floor is comfortable when I step on. Sofa look so new & the TV is big enough for us. Although the room design simple but look great. Never forget the reception is so friendly. The explained well on what do and don‚Äôt. When we ask if the room has any fridge to keep our cakes, he offer the lobby fridge as the cakes quite big. They are so helpful. About late evening we cal for ice bucket service and they send to our room within 20 minutes. Big credits for the staff! I had a great and happy experience in the hotel. I can choose the hotel again when I have any other even.

Title: Awesome experience

All 4 still around when I came down to smoke at 1am and 3.30am lol. Room has a really big bed with 4 pillows. Only drawback is lack of TV channels, about 10, and only 5 watchable. Great discount during CMCO, will stay again!

Title: Value For Money !!!
Review: (+) 1. Hotel + Sunway Mall together 2. Great location 3. Very nice shopping mall 4. Food everywhere 5. Eat till you drop 6. Ample parking space 7. Parked at level 7 then lift to lobby at level 9 8. Friendly staff esp Ms Malar & Mr Lim 9. Spacious deluxe room with balcony 10. Room #2310 great view at night 11. Great view of PTT & MKL from balcony 12. PTT = Petronas Twin Towers 13. MKL = Menara KL/KL Tower 14. Great shower + powerful water pressure 15. Super single beds bigger than std single 16. Hotel Seri Pacific just across the road 17. Putra World Trade Ctr also across the road 18. Near Chow Kit area for shopping + dining (-) 1. Unfortunately, noisy neighbours with excited kids (#2311) till late night 2. Upset my sleep for next day impt meetg 3. Hope front desk staff sensitive to this #2 ----- Sincere feedback from: #Dato' Professor Dr Hj Mohd Rasid HJ HUSSIN @President of IIRMACS & RGRMAS

Title: Fantastic place & location
Review: The room we stayed in had a magnificient view of the twin towers. Breakfast despite no buffet (due to the current pandemic situation) was delicious n freshly prepared. The staffs were very kind n attentive - especially Ivan at reception, Han n Hafiz at the breakfast lounge, Aidil n June at Concierge, Gary who drove us to and fro KLCC. Staffs were serious at keeping us safe - regularly keeping to SOP n sanitising. Overall, a fantastic break for us, even with the pool closed (due to the current pandemic situation). Hope to be back to experience the pool and spa. -a family with small children

Title: Great staycation
Review: Due to covid , we at first wanted to cancelled our booking which had been made ealier this year to celebrate out anniversary. But we decided no to, instead the hotel had given us opportunity to experience their fasicility for free. We had an upgrad to have free access to the club lounge, buggy to klcc, room decoration for our anniversary. Chocolate and flowers ... thou, the hotel had take a precautions, temperature checked each time. Breastfast is luxury but on the second day of our stay, theres not much variety from the first day. Its very near to the big klcc playground , and the public swimming pool but we couldnt go due covid. We loves the lounge, with klcc view ... the staffs are friendly and helpful. We definitely will come back someday.
